loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Cherry works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Cherry is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase more dry goods, such as ballpoint pens, pins, etc. for her business.

Cherry has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods, such as ballpoint pens, pins, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable and spice vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell.

Cresilda has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Cresilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

She has a business buying and selling vegetables  in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and cooked food vending.  Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional basket of vegetables to sell.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional baskets of vegetables to sell

She requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food production business.

Elvira has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Zenia

texts.en: Zenia is 53 years old, a widow with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, including sardines, noodles and shampoo. Zenia has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year, and she also earns income from fattening pigs. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, including sardines, noodles and shampoo.

loans.name: Josephine

She has requested a PHP25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, such as coffee, biscuits, chips, sardines, etc. to sell. Josephine has borrowed and paid back 27 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 24 years and also earns income from pig fattening and sugarcane farming. Josephine aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, such as coffee, biscuits, chips, sardines, etc. to sell.

Dioscora has been farming bananas for 1 year now and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Dioscora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

Juvelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

Medalla has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and she also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

Medalla aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca just opened her floral design and wedding planning company and needs this loan to help it launch successfully.  With more than five years of experience, Rebecca decided to branch out and open her own business in the affluent town of Spring Branch, Texas, located in the Hill Country region just north of San Antonio. The Hill Country is a popular destination wedding location for many Texas brides and has proven to be a good location for Rebecca’s business.

Rebecca will specialize in fresh floral arrangements, silk designs and custom designs for holidays and special occasions. The loan will be used for getting her store ready for business - including the purchase of a register and point-of-sale system, painting the store and buying such materials such as cutting shears and other equipment.

loans.use: To pay for shop supplies, point of sale system, get store painted, and buy floral supplies

loans.name: Faisi

texts.en: Faisi is twenty eight years old and married with two children. She deals in the cocoa business, which she started eight years ago in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Faisi needs a loan to buy more cocoa to continue selling her product in a market of both men and women, with the aim of increasing capital for the business. She is affected by weather, but works hard and would like to buy land in future.

loans.use: To buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Cristo

texts.en:
Cristo has been serving sushi at Rocka’s Sushi Express for over a year, with success, Cristo specializes in Japanese cuisine - especially sushi, nigiri, and sashimi.  Intending to open a restaurant over a year ago in Brownsville, Texas, Cristo was looking for an opportunity to start his own business, using the skills he had learned working at a previous establishment. While looking for a location, he found an established sushi restaurant where the landlord was willing to have Cristo move right in and simply pay rent on the existing assets.

Cristo would like to use his loan to be able to expand by having working capital to hire at least two additional employees.  Rocka’s Sushi Express has an existing client base due to its location near a major university and highway. Cristo plans to hire and mentor college students on the art of sushi and how to manage and grow a small business.

loans.use: to expand and pay for additional employees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy commercial grade supplies and equipment at a discounted bulk rate and pay for an advertising and marketing campaign

loans.name: Gabriel Armando

texts.es:
Gabriel tiene 28 años de edad, vive en un cantón, no pudo asistir a la escuela por los escasos recursos económicos, está casado y tiene un hijo un año y medio de edad.

Gabriel se ha dedicado a la agricultura toda su vida, ya que su padre le enseñó el trabajo de campo, se inició en el negocio del comercio de ganado desde hace 3 años con el apoyo de su compañera de vida, lo cual le permitió generar su cartera de clientes y poder vender de manera rápida,  además esta actividad les permite obtener dinero extra para los gastos del hogar,  él está buscando la manera de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia,  Gabriel ha pensado ampliar su ganado, actualmente posee 9 semovientes, 4 son propios y el resto son de su suegra, ser una persona responsable le ha permitido ganar prestigio como ganadero en la zona, siempre está pensando en satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, quienes depositan su confianza sobre el ganado que él comercializa.

Él está solicitando un crédito, para comprar más ganado para ofrecer a sus clientes, desea comprar 4 vacas más. Él considera que ofreciendo más variedad, puede mejorar sus ventas, y además logrará que su negocio sea más competitivo. 

Uno de sus más grandes sueños, es sacar adelante a su familia, con el apoyo de CREDICAMPO, él espera poder hacer sus sueños realidad y ser como siempre lo ha sido, un hombre con deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 28 years old and lives in a cornerstone apartment. He could not attend school due to a lack of financial resources. He is married and has one son who is one and a half years old. 

Gabriel has worked in agriculture all of his life. His father taught him how to work in the fields. He started his business of selling livestock three years ago with the help of his life partner. This allowed him to build a portfolio of customers and sell more quickly. This work also allows him to make additional money for living expenses. He is looking for a way to improve his family's living conditions. Gabriel has thought about increasing his livestock. He currently has nine livestock. Four are his own and the rest are his mother-in-law's. He is a responsible person and was able to gain respect as a rancher. He is always thinking about satisfying the demands of his customers who have confidence in the livestock he sells. 

He is applying for a loan to buy more livestock to offer his customers. He wants to buy four more cows. He thinks that offering more variety could improve his sales and would also allow his business to be more competitive. 

One of his greatest dreams is to move his family forward. With the help of CrediCampo, he hopes to be able to make his dreams a reality and be as he has always been: a man with hopes to improve himself.

loans.use: to buy four cows.

loans.name: Gunesh

texts.en:
Gunesh is 50 years old and married, with a daughter and two sons. Her husband is a farmer and raises seasonal vegetables and fruits. She is a pensioner and her monthly income is 180 AZN. Unfortunately, this income isn't enough to cover a big family's expenses.

Gunesh's house was in poor condition and they have repaired it. Now she needs to repair old water pipes, which were spoiled during the last severe winter. Without water, her husband won't be able to raise fruits and vegetable and the family's income will go down. Besides, that family needs water for their personal use (to wash clothes, dishes, clean house and etc.). 

Gunesh applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN, in order to buy high quality materials for new water pipes and be able to support the family's income.

loans.use: to buy high quality materials for new water pipes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy towels and soap

She is such a hardworking lady amidst the challenge of seasonality changes, which especially affect her cocoa product. Above all, she still dreams of expanding her business into new markets.Hadijah is requesting a loan to buy more cocoa and cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: To buy cocoa and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Le groupe  est créé le 12 Décembre 2011 au jour d’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de  femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. Elles ont su au cours des cycles passés ensemble développer une solidarité et soutien mutuel. Elles fréquentent toutes le marché international de la zone pour y mener leurs activités de  petit commerce.

Madame Aïssatou est une femme très rigoureuse. Elle tient une boutique dans sa maison où elle vend divers produits : le riz, l’huile raffinée, le sucre, le thé, le savon et autres. Elle est très expérimentée dans le commerce de détail qui a toujours était son activité principale.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte approvisionner par l’achat de 16 sacs de riz de 50 Kg, 10 cartons de savon, 03 cartons de lait, 05 sacs de sucre, de l’ognon, des pommes de terre.

Les bénéfices lui serviront de renforcer son épargne et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 12, 2011 on the day the 'banc villageois' was inaugurated. The group is composed of women who are from the same district. Over the course of past loan cycles together, they found out how to develop solidarity and mutual support. They all attend the international market in the area to carry out their work in small-scale commerce.

Ms. Aïssatou is a very rigorous woman. She has a shop in her house where she sells a variety of goods:  rice, cooking oil, sugar, tea, soap, and more. She is very experience in retail commerce, which has always been her main work.

With this new loan, she intends to purchase supplies:  16 sacks of rice at 50 kg each; 10 boxes of soap; 3 boxes of milk; 5 sacks of sugar; onions; and potatoes.

The profits will be used to bolster her savings and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to stock up on rice, soap, milk, sugar, onions, and potatoes to sell from home.

loans.name: Molilia

texts.en:
Molilia is 40 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are in school.

Molilia is in the agricultural business, buying and selling pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs to sell.

Molilia has been buying and selling pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Molilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs to sell.

loans.name: Elmediza

texts.en:
Elmediza is 21 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Elmediza is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elmediza has been farming rice for ten years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marie's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  est créé le 24 Décembre 2003 au jour d’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de  femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. Elles ont su au cours des cycles passés ensemble renforcer les liens d’amitié et de solidarité qui les lient et ont la volonté commune de développer collégialement leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Elles font toutes comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Marie (assise à  droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 50  et mère de 04 enfants dont 02 filles et 02 garçons. Elle est vendeuse de jus de citron, de balaie à base de feuilles de palmiste qu’elle achète dans la région sud pour la revendre dans son département.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle désire acheter 300 lots de balaie, 04 bidons de 20 litres de jus de citron et 05 sacs de 100 Kg de pin de singe.

Les bénéfices dans le renforcement de la dépense quotidienne dans le but d’améliorer la qualité des repas.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 24, 2003 on the day the 'banc villageois' was inaugurated. The group is composed of women who are from the same district. Over the course of past loan cycles together, they found out how to reinforce the ties of friendship and solidarity that bind them together. And they have the common will to develop their revenue-generating businesses in a collegial manner. They all work in small-scale commerce.

Ms. Marie (sitting at the right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower in this group. She is married, 50 years old, and the mother of four children (two girls and two boys). She is a vendor of lime juice and  brooms made from palm leaves, which she buys in the south to resell in her district. 

With this new loan, she would like to purchase 300 lots of brooms, four 20-liter containers of lime juice, and five 100-kg sacks of 'monkey bread' [the fruit of the baobab tree].

The profits will be used to alleviate her day-to-day expenses with the goal of improving the quality of her meals.

loans.use: to purchase brooms, lime juice, and 'monkey bread' to sell

loans.name: Muazam

texts.en: Muazam is 54 years old. She is married and has four adult children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Muazam has great experience in animal husbandry. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 30 years. She feeds cows and sheep. Thanks to the good condition of her cattle, she has regular customers in a local market. Most of them are butchers. She is asking for a loan of 7500 Somoni to buy cattle because she wants to increase her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es:
Rosalbina se dedica a elaborar platos de comida pues tiene un pequeño restaurante y  en sus horas libres se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía. Ella pertenece al banco comunal "Cusco" desde hace varios años y en esta oportunidad requiere otro préstamo para comprar sacos de arroz. 

Rosalbina se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en:
Rosalbina prepares elaborate dishes in her small restaurant and in her free time she creates artisan craft objects. She has belonged to the "Cusco" communal bank for a few years and at this time needs another loan to buy sacks of rice.

Rosalbina is content with the loan and promises to punctually and responsibly make her payments. She is grateful to all the investors for the loan and hopes that they continue supporting all the other projects.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice.

loans.name: Melida

texts.es:
Melida es profesora y enseña en uno de los colegios más populares de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal "Cusco" desde hace varios años y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para pagar las gastos de su hogar como agua y luz.

Melida se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en:
Melida is a teacher and teaches in one of the most popular high schools in the city of Cusco. She has belonged to the "Cusco" communal bank for a few years and at this time needs a loan to pay household bills such as water and electricity.

Melida is happy with the loan and promises to responsibly make punctual payments on her loan. She thanks the investors for the loan and hopes that they continue supporting the other projects.

loans.use: to pay household bills such as water and electricity.

loans.name: Helene

texts.fr:
Madame Hélène est l’un des membres fondateurs de ce groupement qui a intégré le programme depuis le 24 Décembre 2003 au jour d’inauguration du banc villageois. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont 02 filles et un garçon. C’est une femme d’une capacité managériale pertinente et a su au fil des cycles accroître sa capacité de financer ses activités de petits commerce à savoir la vente de produits du terroir  pâte d’arachide, huile de palme, jus de citron au commerçants des région du nord et du centre. 

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle va acheter 30 seaux de 20 kg de pâte d’arachide, 10 bidons de 20 litres d’huile de palme, 08 bidons de jus de citron pour la vente.

Une partie de ses bénéfices servira à participer de manière significative à la dépense quotidienne et aux charges liées à la scolarité et la santé de la famille, le reste à renforcer son épargne afin de rendre pérenne ses activités.
texts.en:
Ms. Hélène is a founding member of this group which joined the program on December 24, 2003 when the 'banc villageois' was inaugurated. She is a married mother of three children (two girls and a boy). She is a woman with relevant managerial ability. And she found out over the course of loan cycles how to increase her capacity to finance her small-scale commerce, that is, selling area products: peanut butter, palm oil, and lime juice to merchants from northern and central regions. 

With this new loan, she is going to purchase 30 pails of peanut butter at 20 kg each; 10 containers of palm oil at 20 liters each; and 8 containers of lime juice to resell. 

Part of the profits is used to help cover the day-to-day expenses to a significant degree, as well as the cost of education and healthcare for the family. The rest is for bolstering her savings in order to make her business sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase peanut butter, palm oil, and lime juice to resell

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
Doña María Rosario con 60 años de edad mantiene una muy buena salud, mucha fuerza por la cual le agradece a Dios cada día ya que en su experiencia como caficultora es el quien ha hecho la obra para salir adelante a pesar de los desafíos enfrentados en el diario vivir como la baja del precio del café, la alza en los precios de los insumos que son utilizados para dar asistencia y mantenimiento, las plagas, enfermedades entre otros. Ella es madre de 5 hijos quienes le ayudan en las diferentes tareas en el campo pero solo tres se involucran diariamente junto a su padre ya que los otros dos estudian. Su experiencia en este trabajo es de más de 25 años ya que sus padres fueron quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad siendo esta actividad la mayor fuente de ingresos para su familia y hogar. Sus cultivos están cerca de su casa aproximadamente a 15 minutos de camino desde su habitación lo que le permite una asistencia personalizada para evitar el deterioro del grano.
Sus sueños relata Doña María Rosario: Es agradable ver como el trabajo que es llevado a cabo diariamente da frutos ya que el esfuerzo y sacrificio tiene sus recompensas. También a ella le gustaría seguir ampliando más su plantación, fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos y demás que sean beneficiosos para su familia. Otro de sus sueños es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y con mejores oportunidades en la vida. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado apoyo financiero para la compra de insumos agrícolas y poder dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café ya que de esa manera ella podrá asegurar su cosecha para esta temporada.
texts.en:
Doña María Rosario is 60 years old and in good health and much strength for which she thanks God every day since in her experience as a coffee grower who has been successful in spite of the daily challenges she lives every day with the lowering of the price of coffee, the increase in the prices of supplies that are used in growing coffee, infestations, and other ailments. She is the mother of 5 children who help her with various chores in the field but only three help daily, along with their father, as the other two are in school. She has been growing coffee for more than 25 years and it was her parents that taught her to work the land at a young age as this was the primary means of income for her family and home. Her crops are near her home approximately 15 minutes walking from her home which enables her to personally attend to her crops and avoid deterioration of the bean.

Doña María Rosario states that it is a pleasure to see the daily work produce fruits because of her efforts and sacrifices. She also would like to continue expanding her farming, providing greater support for her children and greater benefits for her family. Another of her dreams is to see her children become professionals with greater opportunities in life. Today she seeks a financial support to buy farming supplies and be able to give assistance and support to her coffee crop as in this way she will be able to ensure her harvest is ready this season.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to aid the growing of coffee.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a farming rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 6000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

Estrella has been in this business for 10 years. Estrella earns additional income a from general store.

Estrella has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Astou Sekou's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 16 Juillet 2012, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées et désireuses de faire prospérer leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Il existe une entente et un esprit d’être aide  entre les membres du groupe, Elles habitent toutes le même quartier et s’activent principalement dans le petit commerce.

Madame Astou (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons et 02 filles. Elle tient un atelier de tailleur dans la commune plus précisément au marché du quartier.  Elle est aidée dans cette activité par deux jeunes apprentis et à une bonne maîtrise dans ce domaine.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter 30 yards de basin riche, 10 yards de tissus teintés et 03 rouleaux de tissus de qualité mousseline.

Avec les bénéfices elle compte faire des briques en vu de commencer la construction de sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Created on July 16, 2012, this 'banc villageois' is composed of women who are very dedicated with a desire to make their revenue-generating businesses prosper. There is an understanding and a spirit of mutual assistance among the group members. They all live in the same district and are mainly active in small-scale commerce.

Ms. Astou (sitting at the far right with her right hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is a married mother of four children (two boys and two girls). She has a sewing workshop in the commune, at the district market to be exact. She is helped in this business by two young apprentices, and she has a good mastery in this domain.  

With her new loan, she intends to purchase 30 yards of 'riche' damask fabrics, 10 yards of dyed cloth, and 3 rolls of muslin.

With the profits, she plans on having bricks made with the aim of starting construction on her own house.

loans.use: to purchase damask fabrics, dyed cloth, rolls of muslin.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, ella tiene una pequeña picantería (Picantería lugar donde se preparara y vende chicha de Jora).  Ella pertenece al banco comunal "Cusco" desde hace varios años y en esta oportunidad requiere otro préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar chicha de jora como por ejemplo azúcar.

Marina se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y desea que sigan apoyando a los demás proyectos.
texts.en:
Marina sells chicha de jora [traditional corn liquor].  She has a small pub where she prepares and sells the chicha.

She has been a member of the Cusco Communal Bank for several years; and on this occasion she needs another loan to purchase supplies such as sugar, in order to prepare the chicha de jora.

Marina feels happy about the loan and she promises to make her payments punctually and responsibly. She thanks all the lenders for the loan and she hopes that they will continue supporting other projects.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as sugar, in order to prepare chicha de jora.

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia is 55 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for six years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Remegia is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia works hard to support her family. Rogelia is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rogelia requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Rogelia has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Rogelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring. Lilia is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like fish, meat, spices, etc for her restaurant business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like fish, meat, spices, etc

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Visitacion works hard to support her family.

She has a business of buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen food vending. Visitacion is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional box of dried fish to sell to her customers for her business.

Visitacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ouleymatou's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 16 Juillet 2012, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées et désireuses de faire prospérer leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Il existe une entente et un esprit d’être aide  entre les membres du groupe, Elles habitent toutes le même quartier et s’activent principalement dans le petit commerce.

Madame Ouleymatou (assise  à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont deux garçons et une fille. Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes et divers fruits de mer. Elle tient une table au marché du quartier depuis plus de cinq ans.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter un sac de choux à 10 000 F CFA, un sachet de carotte pour 4 500 F CFA et divers autres légumes pour la revente par de tas selon les besoins du client.

Avec les bénéfices, elle désire augmenter son épargne d’une part et d’autre part assurer une meilleure prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Created on July 16, 2012, this 'banc villageois' is composed of women who are very dedicated with a desire to make their revenue-generating businesses prosper. There is an understanding and a spirit of mutual assistance among the group members. They all live in the same district and are mainly active in small-scale commerce.

Ms. Ouleymatou (sitting at the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is a married mother of three children (two boys and a girl). She is active in selling vegetables and a variety of seafood. She has had a table at the district market for over five years. 

With this new loan, she intends to purchase a sack of cabbage at 10,000 francs CFA, a bag of carrots at 4,500 francs, and a variety of other vegetables for resale according to customer needs. 

With the profits, she wishes to increase her savings, as well as to do better at ensuring family needs are met.

loans.use: to purchase cabbages, carrots, and various other vegetables for resale per customer needs.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. Evangeline is married and has a basket making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her basket making business.  Evangeline has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her basket making business

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Silvestra works hard to support her family. Silvestra is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Silvestra requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Silvestra has been in this business for five years now.

Silvestra would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 52-years-old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Adelaida has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional gears for her fishing business.

Adelaida has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional gears for her fishing business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, milk, etc. for her business.

Teresita has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, milk, etc. for her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 45-years-old and has three children who are in school.

Susan has a fishing business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net.

Susan has been in this business for two years.  In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: Esperanza  De Vida Con El Futuro Group

texts.es: Elizabet de 37 años de edad es casada con 02 hijos dependientes. El grupo “Esperanza de Vida” está conformado por 09 socios responsables y solidarios. Elizabet se dedica a la venta y distribución de Queques y Jabón. Ella se incorporó por primera vez, por recomendación de su vecina que también es socia del grupo. El anhelo de Elizabet es tener su propio local de venta. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de queques y Jabones. El grupo “Esperanza de Vida” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitar este crédito. Elizabet es la primera del lado derecho, viste polo rosado con pantalón celeste.
texts.en: Elizabet, 37, is married and has two dependent children. The "Esperanza de Vida" group is made up of nine responsible and supportive members. Elizabet works selling and distributing cakes and soap. She is joining the group for the first time, on the recommendation of her neighbor, who is also a member of the group. Elizabet's wish is to have her own retail establishment. She asked for the loan to buy cakes and soap. The "Esperanza de Vida" group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for making this loan possible. Elizabet is the first one on the right, wearing a pink shirt and light-blue pants.

loans.use: to buy cakes and soap.

loans.name: Jobelin

texts.en:
Jobelin works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jobelin requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.  She has been in this business for seven years now.

Jobelin would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 68 years old and married with nine children. With one child still in school, Carmelita works very hard to provide for them.

Carmelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Carmelita has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, candies, biscuits, noodles, snack foods, etc. 

Carmelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Melba

texts.en: Melba is 50 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Melba works very hard to provide for them. Melba runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like soft drinks, sanitary napkins, candies, eggs, bread, shampoo, etc. to sell. Melba has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items in her store. In the future, Melba would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like soft drinks, sanitary napkins, candies, eggs, bread, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Ma. Fe works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Fe is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, etc. for her food vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is a married woman with one child, who is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Myrna is 42 years old. She has a general store in the Philippines. Myrna has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 2 years. Myrna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is 47 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, soft drinks, etc. to sell. Merlita has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns income from food vending. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Celsa is 47 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Celsa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Celsa requested a 23,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gears for her fishing business.

Celsa has been in this business for 28 years. In the future, Celsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gears for her fishing business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines. Virginia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and has now request an additional loan for her business. In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods like sugar, chips, canned goods, eggs, and noodles.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a buy-and-sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 17 years now.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nila

texts.en: Nila is 62 years old and a widow with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like can goods, spices, sugar, chips, etc. Nila has been in this business for 10 years. In the future Nila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, spices, sugar, chips, etc

loans.name: Pedra

texts.en: Pedra works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Pedra has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing nets for her business. She has been in this business for 8 years. Pedra would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing nets for her business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is 55 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell. Wilma has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns income as a rice retailer. Wilma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalie is 38 years old and three of her children are currently in school. She has a fish vending/fishing business in the Philippines. Rosalie has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional gears and materials for her fishing business. Rosalie has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional gears and materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Kurbonaly

texts.ru:
Курбонали студент  Национального  Университета Таджикистана. Он  родился  1993 года, в столице Таджикского Народа. Он живет с мамой и братом. Его отец умер 3 года назад, он работал инженером на строительной компании.  Ее мать  Галати занимается маленькой предпринимательской деятельностью, арендует маленький продуктовый магазин.   
Оценки у Курбонали хорошие. В будущем хочет  быть опытном адвокатом.   В настоящее время Курбонали очень способный молодой человек. Он очень доброжелательный, довольно  спокойный и разумный.  
 Курбонали запросил у нашей организации займ в размере 1750 долларов США для оплаты обучения за тертый   курс.   Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Kurbonali is a student at the Tajikistan National University. He was born in 1993 in Tajikistan's capital city and lives with his mother and brother. His father died three years ago and was an engineer at a construction company. His mother Galati runs a small grocery store. 

Kurbonali gets good grades and wants to be a lawyer. He is a capable young man, very friendly, calm, and sensible. He has requested a loan of $1750 to pay his tuition fees for his third year of university. He is grateful for your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.en:
The rural community of Santa Maria is just outside of the second largest city in Guatemala, called Quetzaltenango. A Friendship Bridge Trust Bank named Santa Maria is located here and is composed of thirteen animated and strong women. They have collectively decided to apply for a new loan with Friendship Bridge. 

The ladies work in various commercial ventures, including the sale of food (chicken, meat, fruit, vegetables, bakery items, pastries and tortillas), medicine, clothing, including lingerie, the sale of firewood, as well as catalogue sales. The women are quite industrious and motivated.

Elena is a 39-year-old member of the group. She has four children. Both Elena and her husband work in their bakery and sell pastries and bread. They have two locations, one of which belongs to them, while the other is a rented one. The couple works arduously seven days each week. 

Elena is starting her second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. She plans to use the funds to purchase ingredients like flour and eggs. There is a high demand for the bakery items, including bread and cakes, and so Elena is planning and budgeting carefully.

Elena and the other women in the Santa Maria Trust Bank feel blessed and grateful to have businesses where they can improve their quality of life. They are most grateful to Kiva investors who have generously funded their loans. The Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge does more than make funds available for clients. Each month, the women meet with a loan officer from Friendship Bridge. Besides making payments on their loans, the ladies receive educational training on relevant subjects like effective business practices and money management, nutrition and health, as well as children’s and women’s rights. This month’s topic was about leadership and women’s identity, where the women learned about discrimination and self-esteem.

The thirteen women of the Santa Maria Trust Bank look forward to a brighter and more prosperous future for themselves, their families and their community. Empowered by their educational training and loans, they step into the next chapter of their lives with confidence and determination! Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour and eggs.

loans.name: Farkhunda

texts.ru: Фархунда молодая замужняя женщина из района Шахритус, ей 22 года. Она работала портнихой в швейном цеху до тех пор пока не закрыли этот цех по причине не уплаты налога. Фархунда в данный момент ухаживает за больными в доме и часть семейного расхода покрывает за этот счет. Она очень хочет вернутся к своей прежней работе. Но теперь она решила работать на себя и открыть швейное дело у себя дома. Для осуществления цели Фархунда на руки имеет почти 300 долларов, а остальную сумму просит в кредит. Она собирается купить швейную машинку и тканей для шитья. Фархунда очень опытная портниха, она сама придумывает разные фасоны для платьев. Проблемы с заказами у нее не будет, так как все в окрестности знают о ее умении и таланте шитья. Фархунда с нетерпением ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Farkhunda is a young married woman who lives in the Shahrituz region.  She is 22 years old and she worked as a seamstress in a sewing shop until the shop closed because of tax evasion.  At the moment, Farkhunda works as a caretaker at a hospice, which covers part of her family's expenses.  She really wants to return to her previous work as a seamstress, but now she has resolved to work for herself and to open her own business out of her home.  Farkhunda has nearly $300 in hand to fulfill this goal, but she needs a loan for the rest.  She wants to buy a sewing machine and fabric for sewing.  Farkhunda is a very experienced seamstress and she has thought of several different dress styles all by herself.  She won't have any problems with her commissions, as everyone in her neighborhood knows about her talents as a seamstress.  She is anxiously awaiting your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric to start her tailoring business

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исмоил житель дружелюбного района Кубадиён. Ему 50 лет. Он примерный семьянин и верный муж. На протяжении нескольких лет, Исмоил занимается земледелием, выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры на орошаемой участке земли. Исмоил пару лет держит во дворе несколько скотин. За столь время он набрался опыта в этой сфере деятельности и решил начать животноводческую деятельность. Но для обоснования бизнеса ему не хватает средств. Он решил взять кредит и купить достаточное количество телят и начать бизнес. Без кредита он не сможет осуществить задуманное. Он нуждается в Вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Ismoil is a 50 year old resident of the friendly Qubadiyon district. He is an exemplary family man and a faithful husband. For several years he has grown crops on an irrigated plot of land and kept a small number of cattle. Having gained experience raising cattle, he has decided to start a livestock business. He does not have enough money, so he decided to take out a loan to buy some calves and start the business. Without this loan he will not be able to put his plan to action. He needs your support.

loans.use: to buy calves and start a new livestock business

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
Rosibel tiene 47 años de edad, vive en un cantón, ella  no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ningún grado, pero aprendió a leer y escribir cuando envió a su hija la escuela, tiene 3 hijos pero solo vive junto a su hija mejor y también con su esposo quien se dedica a la producción de granos básicos. 

Rosibel desempeña la actividad de comercio de ropa en la comunidad desde hace 5 años, el cual le permite aprender más de esta actividad en el transcurso del tiempo, esto lo aprendió de una amiga que también trabajaba en el comercio, a Rosibel le llamó mucho la atención, se propuso conocer el negocio y tomó a bien dedicarse a esta actividad. 

Ella necesita del crédito, para la ampliación de su negocio de ropa en el cual invertirá un promedio de $300, y el resto para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, comprará cemento y arena para el reparar el Piso 

Rosibel tiene como objetivo, que su negocio sea rentable para la sostenibilidad de su familia, y poco a poco mejorar la vivienda para tener un hogar digno.
texts.en:
Rosibel, 47, lives in a canton in El Salvador.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school, but she learned to read and write when she sent her daughter to school.  She has 3 children, but she lives with just her eldest daughter and also with her husband, who works producing staple grains.

Rosibel has been working selling clothing in the community for 5 years.  This experience has enabled her to learn more about the business over the course of time.  She learned this occupation from a friend who also worked in retail trade.  Rosibel was really attracted to this occupation, and so she set out to  learn the business and dedicate herself to this line of work.

Rosibel needs a loan to expand her clothing business. She will invest about half the money ($300) in her business and will use the rest to make some improvements to her house.  She will buy cement and sand to repair the floor.  Rosibel's goal is to make her business more profitable for the support of her family, and also to gradually improve her house so that she can have a decent home.

loans.use: to expand her clothing business and to make some improvements to her house

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Eva works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from an internet cafe. 

Eva is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her obtain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nicholasa

texts.en:
Nicholasa is 75 years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with five children, all of whom are adults. For their means of living, Nicholasa is engaged in a vegetable vending activity, and earns an approximate amount of not less than Php 1,000 per month.  

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for house repairs and renovation.  

Nicholasa has been a member of PMPC for seven years. 

Nicholasa, even on her old age, is still enjoying our programs and services, particularly our mortuary program.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca, age 60, is from Calube, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines.  She is a single parent bravely raising three children.  PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her pig raising business. She sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to produce good pigs in order to sell them continuously. 

Francisca is now trying to expand her pig business and has decided to venture into a little snack house. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional sacks of feed.  She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wants her business to be well known and to build good business management for her loyal customers.  With her extra income, she wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to buy addittional sacks of feed

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of two children, Estella works hard to support her family.

She has a slipper making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Estella is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her slipper making business.

Estella has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her slipper making business

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is 59 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Feliciana requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Feliciana has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Feliciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda works hard to support her family. Glenda is married and has a shells craft business in the Philippines.

She requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional shells for her business.

Glenda has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Glenda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional shells for her business

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is 60 years old and married with five children. Amada works very hard to provide for them.

Amada runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Amada has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cereal, canned goods, soft-drinks, eggs, shampoo, laundry soap, etc. 

Amada would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maritez

texts.en:
Maritez is 32 years old and married with four children. Maritez works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Maritez has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years, and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Maritez aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia is 63 years old and lives in Dr. Rizal, Katipunan Zamboanga Del Norte. She is already a widow with three kids. She has been a member since 2013. After hearing the services offered by Paglaum MPC, she never hesitated to become a member. Being a member, she maintains her records as a member in good standing. Recently, she asked PMPC for financial assistance to purchase feed for her pigs. And with Paglaum MPC, she hopes that this will help her expand her business. And she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza works hard to support her family. Flordeliza is married and has a business making shell lanterns in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more shells to make a lantern.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more shells to make a lantern

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with six children. She is 49 years old, and lives in Guipos, Zamboanga del Sur.                     

Josephine is a farmer, and grows palay crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

She requested a loan to buy ferilizer and pesticides.                                                               

Josephine has been a member of PMPC for six years. 

In the future, Josephine hopes to harvest more palay crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rena is 59 years old and a widow. She is from Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. 

Starting with capitalization of 5,000, she engaged in rice retailing in her house from which to earn a living. She became an active member with PMPC and enjoys the benefits and privileges given by the coop.

Rena is requesting financial assistance in the amount of PHP 4,500 to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. 

She deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing, and hopes to generate savings for future needs.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elnora is 48 years old and has four children who are in school.

Elnora has a sewing business in the Philippines. Elnora requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business.

Elnora has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Elnora would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Antonina has been in this business for 40 years. Antonina earns more income from pig fattening.

Antonina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Joji

texts.en:
Joji is 45 years old and has two children, one of whom is in school. Joji works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, chips, soft drinks, etc.

Joji has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Joji would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, chips, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is married, with four children.  Julieta is 59 years old and has children who are in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a shells craft business in the Philippines. 

Julieta requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional shells.

Julieta has been in this business for 22 years. 

In the future, Julieta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional shells for her business.

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.en:
Fortunato has been operating his own farm for many years, earning well to support the family.  

For many years of growing and harvesting rice and other crops, the couple was able to provide for their child's needs, and had successfully repaid his previous loan used for the farm.  He was determined in his work to give an abundant and better life for the family. 

In order to enhance the farm, he borrows a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase seedlings and organic pesticides. 

He hopes that someday, his family can earn a better income to improve their general living in the future..

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and organic pesticides

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia works hard to support her family. Leticia is married and has a business selling live fish in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional species of fish and fish food.

Leticia has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Leticia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and fish food

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 66 years old and married with four children. Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like rice, feed, noodles, canned goods, detergent soap, snack foods, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, feeds, noodles, canned goods, detergent soap, snack foods, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Pedro Alexander

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 24 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo grado, está soltero y no tiene hijos, en su casa viven sus padres y un hermano. 

Este joven trabaja como ordenanza, tiene 3 años de desempeñar esta actividad, lo aprendió gracias a que su padre trabajó por 16 años en el mismo lugar donde él trabaja hoy día, es el primer empleo que Pedro tiene y antes de dedicarse a esta labor él era ayudante de albañilería, el trabajo le queda a 4 kilómetros de su casa, los cuales los recorre en bus y trabaja una jornada de 8 horas diarias.

Pedro solicita este préstamo a CrediCampo para comprar una máquina de coser que desea regalarle a su mamá ya que ella es sastre. El préstamo le ayudará a proporcionarle  una herramienta de trabajo a su  madre para dedicarse al negocio de corte y confección. 

El joven planea seguir ayudando a su familia a superarse, además quiere seguir trabajando para superarse y para cuando decida formar su familia tener una casa digna donde vivir y proporcionarle a su familia  buena estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Pedro is 24 years old. He studied up until 8th grade. He is single and doesn't have any children. He lives with his parents and brother.

Pedro has been working as an administrative assistant for 3 years. He learned this job because his father worked for 16 years in the same place where Pedro works today. It's the first job that Pedro has had. Before working there, he was a masonry assistant. His job is 4 kilometers from his house and he gets there by bus. He works 8 hours a day.

Pedro is requesting this loan from CrediCampo to buy a sewing machine, which he wants to give to his mother, who is a tailor. This loan will help provide a work tool for his mother so she can run a tailoring and dressmaking business.

Pedro plans to continue helping his family to better themselves. He also wants to keep working to better himself, to have a decent house to live in for when he decides to start a family, and to provide his family with good economic stability.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a shell craft business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of shells to sell.

Lucena has been in this business for 30 years now. In the future Lucena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of shells to sell.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Ma. Antonia is 49 years of age, married with three children and presently residing at Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. Antonia is running a restaurant business and decided to operate a sari-sari store. Ma. Antonia has been a member of PMPC for two years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 10,000 to restock inventories for the store and to buy raw ingredients for the restaurant.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari store and buy raw ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 54 years old and has three children. She is married, and has one child who is still in school.

Margarita is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccines and vitamins for her cattle.

Margarita has been raising cattle for 17 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Margarita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and vitamins for her cattle

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en:
Mariafe  is 49 years old and married.  She has three kids, and lives in Tuyabang, Oroquieta City, Philippines. 

She earns a living through farming.  She also does a business of rice retailing. 

She has been a member of PMPC for two years, and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. 

Now she is applying a loan of Php 14,900 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for farming.

Mariafe deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for farming

loans.name: Madel

texts.en:
Madel works hard to support her family. Madel is married and has a business making shell lanterns in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years now.

She requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy more shells to make a shell lantern.

In the future Madel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more shells to make a shell lantern.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 33 years old and married with four children; one child is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a shell-craft business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. 

Maribel has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase shells for her business. In the future, Maribel would like to have money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase shells for her business

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru:
Латофат жизнерадостная,добрая и очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет троих замечательных  детей.  К сожалению Латофат в молодости не училась и не получила образование и очень об этом жалеет. Но своих детей Латофат хочет обучить в лучших учебных заведениях и делает для этого все,чтобы добиться своей цели.

Вид  деятельности Латофат заключается в том,что она  торгует продуктами  питания.  Она более 10 лет торгует на рынке недалеко от своего дома. Раньше она торговала зеленью и несколько  фруктами  на рынке города и ей приходилось ехать из дому на большой рынок , что бы продавать на улице рынка. Ей было трудно с товаром ехать в город и продавать там поэтому она  арендовала ларек недалеко от дома. Теперь она реализует там продукты и питания, разные печенья, хлеб и конфеты. 

Латофат сотрудничает с организацией Арванд более 8  лет. За этот период она набрала большое количество клиентов. Это  является их основным доходом в семье и стабильным. На полученный кредит Латофат хочет закупить продукты для пополнения ассортимента товаров. Она очень рада,что существуют такие организации как Арванд, с помощью которых люди нуждавшиеся в финансовой поддержке могут осуществить свои планы и надежды.
texts.en: Latofat is a joyful, kind, and hardworking woman. She is married and has three wonderful children. Unfortunately Latofat did not receive an education as a young person, which she greatly regrets. She wants her children to study at the best schools, and does everything to reach this goal. Latofat's work is selling groceries. For over 10 years she has been selling at a market close to her home. She used to sells herbs and a few fruits at the city market, so she had to travel from her house to the big marked to sell on the street of the market. It was difficult for her to travel with her goods to the city to sell there, so she began renting a place near the house. Now she sells groceries, various cookies, bread, and candy there. Latofat has been working with the organization Arvand for over eight years. During this period she has earned a large number of customers. This is their primary, stable, income for the family. Latofat wants to buy products to fill out her inventory. She is very happy that there are organizations like Arvand which people who need help with financial support and use to reach their goals and dreams.

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: Ma. Evelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Evelyn works hard to support her family. Ma. Evelyn is married, and has a shells craft business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more shells for her business.

Ma. Evelyn has been in this business for 12 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more shells for her business

loans.name: Ma. Pene

texts.en:
Ma. Pene is 50 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Ma. Pene has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 52 years old, and presently residing in Catadman, Ozamiz City. Susan is happily married, with six children. 

Susan is engaged in a buy and sell business of used cartons to help improve her family's finances. 

She has been a member of PMPC, Ozamiz branch, for three years. 

Susan hopes to improve her family's living in the future.

loans.use: To buy cartons to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of dried fish to sell.

Marina has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Marina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Nelcy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nelcy works hard to support her family.

She has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and a motorcycle transport. 

Nelcy is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional abaca fiber to weave for her abaca weaving business.

Nelcy has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional abaca fiber for weaving

loans.name: Rio

texts.en:
Rio is 27 years old, and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rio has a shells craft business in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional shells.

Rio has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Rio would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional shells

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. Lorna is married and has a machine shop business in the Philippines.

Lorna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional tools and equipment for her business.

Lorna has been in this business for 10 years now.

Lorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and equipment for her business

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa works hard to support her family. She is single and has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines. Vanessa has been in this business for 10 years now.

She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of frozen foods to sell. In the future, Vanessa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 52 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Elena has been farming rice for 20 years and earns additional income from selling herbal medicines.

Elena is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to pays for her laborers' salaries. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay her laborers' salaries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 46 years old and married with two children, one of whom in school, Virgie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell of household goods business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like toothpaste, soap, etc.

Virgie has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like toothpaste and soap

loans.name: Husanboi

texts.ru:
Хусанбой  добрый, трудолюбивый человек.Ему 58 лет. Хусанбой с молодости работал на поле. По началу обычным колхозником, со временем стал бригадиром сельского хозяйства. Как и все остальные жители села Хусанбой тоже много лет занимается скотоводством. Он дома разводит скот. В этом ему помогают его сыновья. У Хусанбоя очень дружная и крепкая семья.Они живут все вместе. Жена Хусанбоя хранительница очага Зайнаб по профессии педагог. Она работает учительницей в средней школе. Зайнаб очень любит детей и всеми усилиями старается передать все свое знания детям. Старший сын Хусанбоя уехал в Россию на заработки, так как в селе найти работу тяжеловато и заработанные деньги не хватает на проживание.

 Хусанбой в данное время занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных  культур. Как мы уже отметили Хусанбой имеет большой опыт в этой сфере. Он бы хотел посадить семена кукурузы и пшеницы. Но Хусанбою немного не хватает денег  для посадки семян. Он хочет приобрести минеральные удобрения и семена.  Поэтому Хусанбой обратился в МДО "Арванд" за кредитом. Хусанбой в будущем хочет чтоб его семья жили в достатке, а внуки получили образование и чтоб работали по профессии а не так как он сам в поле.
texts.en: Husanboi is a kind, hardworking person. He is 58 years old, and has worked in the fields since he was a boy. At first he was a worker on a collective farm, and over time became a farm foreman. Like all of the residents of the village, Husanboi has also raised livestock for many years. He has livestock on his property, and his sons help him. Husanboi has a friendly and close family, and they all live together. Husanboi's wife Zainab keeps the house, and a teacher by training. She teaches at a middle school. She loves children and does everything she can to give all her knowledge to them. Husanboi's oldest son left for Russia to work, since it is hard to find work in the village and doesn't earn enough money to live on. Husanboi currently farms. As we already noted, he has a lot of experience in this area. He would like to plant corn and wheat, but doesn't have the money for planting. He wants to buy fertilizers and seeds, so he came to Arvand for a loan. Husanboi wants his family to have enough to live, and for his grandchildren to be educated and work in the profession of their choosing, not in the fields like him.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Saybibi

texts.ru: Эту улыбчивую женщину зовут Сайбиби. Она из города Душанбе - столицы Таджикистана. Сайбиби жизнерадостная, миролюбивая и добрая натура. Она верит в лучшее и дарит другим позитивное настроение. Сайбиби живет с сыновьями и с невесткой. Сыновья работают строителями. Сама Сайбиби занимается шитьем на заказ национальных, таджикских, женских платьев. Данным ремеслом она занимается с самого детства. Только 5 лет назад она решилась заработать на свой талант. Она начала брать заказы на шитье. Сайбиби занимается данной деятельностью, потому что это и любимое занятие и выгодный бизнес. Сайбиби просит кредит, чтобы купить швейную машинку. Для Сайбиби швейная машинка очень нужна, потому что она будет шить гораздо быстрее и качественнее. Она надеется, что ее поддержать, и она купит долгожданную машинку.
texts.en: This smiling woman is named Saybibi. She is from the city of Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. Saybibi has a joyful, loving, and kind nature. She believes in the best and puts everyone in a good mood. Saybibi lives with her sons and a daughter-in-law. Her sons work in construction. Saybibi herself is a seamstress, and sews traditional Tajik dresses to order. She has been doing this work since childhood. Just five years ago she decided to use her talent to earn money. She began to take orders for tailoring. Saybibi does this work because she loves it and it is a profitable business. Saybibi is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine. A sewing machine is a necessity for her, since it will allow her to sew much faster and with better quality. She hoes that she will be supported and will be able to buy the long awaited machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Yulduz

texts.ru: Юлдуз 23 года. Она живет в селе района Кубадиён и вместе с семьей занимается там земледелием. Она трудолюбивая истинная сельская женщина, не боящаяся тяжелой работы. Чтобы улучшить качество жизни, Юлдуз решила параллельно начать животноводческий бизнес. Она планирует выращивать бычков в течение 30-35 дней и после откорма продавать на том же скотном рынке,где будет в будущем покупать. Юлдуз для осуществления цели просит кредит и хочет закупить двух голов молодых бычков. В данном бизнесе ей будет также помогать семья.
