texts.en: Yulduz is 23 years old. She lives in a village in the Qubadiyon area and farms with her family there. She is a hardworking, honest rural woman, and doesn't fear difficult jobs. To improve her life,Yulduz decided to start an animal husbandry business too. She plans to raises bull calves for 30-35 days, and after the fattening, sell them at the same market where she will buy more. Yulduz is asking for a loan to help reach her goal, as she wants to buy two young bull calves. Her family will also help with the business.

loans.use: To buy two young bull calves to start a new business and provide her family an additional source of income

loans.name: Jane Jerold

texts.en: Jane Jerold is the good daughter of a fisherman who spends his time working in order to provide for the family and for her studies. She helps her mother sell fish in her free time to earn a living. After joining GDMPC, she gained access to micro finance services and borrowed a loan recently to pay her school tuition for the second semester. Her dream is to finish her professional studies and have a better future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition for the second semester

loans.name: Junard

texts.en:
Junard is single and is a teacher who operates a part-time service-based business providing transportation in his community to make a living. When he has his duty in school, his tenants operate his motorcycle and he earns extra income from it. 

He has taken a loan from GDMPC microcredit to pay the hospitalization cost from when he was previously admitted to the hospital. He plans to improve his business by getting another motorcycle for rental and transportation services. In the future, Junard want to improve the general living situation of his entire family.

loans.use: to pay his hospitalization costs

loans.name: Medina

texts.en: Medina is married with one child. She operates a piggery with the help of her husband to earn a living. They have run this business for more than five years and earn well for the family. Medina is determined to send her child to school and provide a better education and because of this, she works with love and never gets tired of working. She has borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase feed. In the future, she wants to build a concrete home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is a widow with five children who operates a business vending nipa in their village to make a living. For twenty years of running the business, she has earned well to provide her needs. With her micro finance loan taken from GDMPC, she purchased more palm leaves and woven nipa to resell. In the future, Rosita wants to sustain her business in order to gain an income for her needs.

loans.use: to purchase more palm leaves and woven nipa to resell.

loans.name: Irene Rose

texts.en: Irene Rose is studying at a university to become a better person in the future. She helps her parents work in their cafeteria to earn an income. The family needs to improve their business to earn more profit. Instead of using their profit for her school obligations, they had to use it as additional capital for their business. Recently, she gained access to micro finance to pay the school tuition fees for this current semester. In the future, she hopes to become successful and to be able to help her family improve their living.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for the current semester.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 42 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Rosalie has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years, and also earns an income from food vending.

Rosalie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Sulpicia

texts.en:
Sulpicia is 44 years old, and married with five children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

She has a shells craft business in the Philippines. 

Sulpicia requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional stock of shells for her business.

Sulpicia has been in this business for 18 years. 

In the future, Sulpicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of shells for her business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. Wilma is married and has a buy and sell of clothing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of clothes to sell.

Wilma has been in this business for 15 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Abner

texts.en: Abner has been providing boarding house rental services in his village for more than four years earning well for his needs. He had successfully repaid his previous loan used for house repair. Aside from this, he started a business selling foods in his little canteen to earn an extra income. Recently, he took a new loan to purchase ingredients. In the future, Abner hopes to expand his boarding house rental business and to gain double income out of his business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for his canteen.

loans.name: Andre Marie

texts.en:
Andre Marie is 25 years old. She lives in Zamboanga City with her younger two siblings and her parents. She is a university student studying for her Bachelor of Science in Computer Science degree and she is in her fourth year. 

Andre Marie is only one step away from graduation. She is planning to find a better job after she graduates and to earn a better income in order to support her family financially. She needs to pay for school tuition fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for school tuition fees.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly is single with three children and she operates a buy and sell business to make a living. For three years in weaving lampakanay, she has earned well and has supported her children. She also sells her owned woven products. Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more lampakanay leaves and woven products to sell. In the future she wants to provide a good education to her children and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more lampakanay leaves and woven products to sell.

loans.name: Chosie

texts.en: Chosie is operating  a tailoring shop in her village to make a living. For more than four years, Chosie has earned well and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for tailoring needs. Recently, she took a new loan to repair and buy an additional sewing machine. She joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair and buy an additional sewing machine.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa has been selling charcoal in the market for more than five years earning well for a living. Her husband also works in their farm, their main source of income. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for purchasing coconut shells. In order to gain more returns, she buys charcoal from her neighbor to resell it in addition to her stocks. Improving her business make her more busy in her business. In the future, she wants to improve their business to reach their dreams of having a better living with her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Gio

texts.en: Gio is a farmer's son who wants to improve his living situation in the future. He studies business administration in a university. He has six siblings and some are still dependent on their parents. Having a big family is his challenge; he wants to finish his course in order to gain a better job and wants to help his siblings to get a better education in the future.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fee

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, aged 45 years, has four children and lives in Hoima, Uganda. From his salary, he got start-up capital and opened up a shop selling medicine to people. He earns additional income from rentals. He faces a challenge of high license fees but has a dream of educating his children in higher institutions of learning. 

Peter intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 37-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as ambitious. Lilian operates a pharmacy where she sells medicine. Her primary customers are local residents. 

Lilian says that her family's challenge is the high cost of fuel. She will use the 15,900 KES loan to buy a solar lamp for lighting their house. She hopes that in the future, she will get a bigger solar lamp. 

This is Lilian's fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a widowed woman with five children who are adults. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

Martha has operated a shoe-selling business for the past four years. She sells plastic shoes and sandals to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of shoes for resale

loans.name: Mardoqueo

texts.es:
Mardoqueo tiene 34 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está acompañado desde hace 16 años y su pareja se dedica  a los oficios domésticos, tiene 5 hijos los cuales aún viven con ellos y se encuentran estudiando en la escuela, por lo tanto toda su familia depende de él.

 La agricultura, es la actividad a la cual Mardoqueo se ha dedicado durante 25 años, lo aprendió de su padre pues desde muy pequeño le enseñó la siembra de los granos básicos, decidió dedicarse a esta labor debido a que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y fue la única forma que encontró para ayudar a su familia, el lugar de trabajo  le queda a 2 kilómetros de distancia  los que recorre caminando, en el trabajo también se involucran su hijo mayor y su compañera de vida, el cual es de 7 horas diarias.

Mardoqueo solicita este crédito para comprar una yunta de bueyes, que le servirá para transportar los granos básicos  hasta su casa ya que actualmente no tiene esta herramienta de trabajo y se le dificulta hacerlo, por lo tanto con la ayuda del crédito se le facilitará el trabajo para llevar los productos  agrícolas y asegurar la alimentación de sus hijos.

Sus sueños son progresar en la vida a través del trabajo, le gustaría tener más terreno para sembrar  y poder  sacar  más productos  para mejorar sus ingresos y poder darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Mardoqueo is 34-years old.  He went to school until third grade.  He has been married for 16 years and his wife takes care of the household chores.  He has five children who live with him and go to school.  As such, all of Mardoqueo's family is financially dependent on him. 

Agriculture has earned Mardoqueo his living for 25 years.  He learned the trade from his father.  When he was very young, Mardoqueo's father taught him to grow basic grains.  Mardoqueo decided to make his own living with this work since he didn't have the opportunity to go to much school and it was the only way he knew of to help his family.  Where he works is two kilometers away, a distance he travels on foot.  His eldest son and his wife also help him with his work, which he performs for seven hours a day. 

Mardoqueo is requesting the loan to purchase a team of oxen to aid in transporting his grains to his house.  He doesn't currently have this kind of work tool, and it is difficult for him to transport his grains.  With the help of the loan, transporting his agricultural products will be easier and assure his ability to feed his children. 

Mardoqueo's dream is to progress in life though his work.  He would like to have more land to plant and be able to harvest more product, which would improve his income and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a team of oxen.

loans.name: Gairat

texts.ru:
Гайрат трудолюбивый молодой человек в возрасте 23 лет. Женат. Гайрат недавно создал семью. У Гайрата молодая дружная семья. Они живут в родительском доме. Гайрат как и все сельские жители разводит скот. Но животноводство не основная работа Гайрата. Кроме этого он еще работает на поле. Выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры.

 Гайрат любит работать в поле, ведь только там можно надышатся чистым воздухом, полюбоваться природой. К весне работа на поле берет свой оборот и у Гайрата практически не бывает свободного времени. Он в данное время подготавливает землю к посеву семян. Для покупки семян и удобрение Гайрату нужны деньги, но накопленные деньги Гайрата не хватают для покупки подкормок. Поэтому он обратился в МДО "Арванд" за денежными средствами. Гайрат впервые берет кредит, и в дальнейшем он хотел бы сотрудничать с организацией, так как его устраивает услуги МДО "Арванд". Гайрат заранее благодарит МДО "Арванд" за поддержку и за доверие.
texts.en: Gairat is a hardworking 23 year old man. He is married, and just recently started a family. Gairat has a young, loving family. They live in the parents home. Gairat, like all village residents, raises livestock, but it isn't his primary job. He also works in the fields, raising crops. Gairat loves working in the fields, as only there can he breath in fresh air and admire nature. Towards spring field work picks up and Gairat has practically no free time. He is currently preparing ground for planting. He needs money to buy fertilizer and seeds, but doesn't have enough saved up, so he came to Arvand for a loan. Gairat is getting a loan now, and in the future would like work more with the organization since he finds their service useful. Gairat thanks Arvand for the support and trust in advance.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Boran

texts.en: Boran is from Fuzuli city. Over 21 years that city was occupied by Armenians and since then Boran is an Internally Displaced Person-IDP. Today he is living at Mahmudlu-2 village of Fuzuli region with his wife and child. His child is 9 years old and goes to the third class of school. Boran has a store and there he sells food products. Today Boran needs support for the work. Therefore he has applied to Komak company for a loan in amount of 2000 Azerbaijan New Manat- AZN. With this loan Boran wants to buy more products for sale.

loans.use: to buy more products for sale.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Angela de 58 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes; ella quiere realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor, Angela  tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Angela, age 58, lives with her life companion in her own house.

She has had a business selling clothing for several years. This has given her a great deal of experience, which helps her to obtain excellent earnings. The business is located in her home. She has a large clientele, as people know that everything she sells is good quality at an affordable price, and she provides incomparable service that is always geared to the demands and tastes of the customers. 

She would like to make a new investment, but she does not have enough capital to support it.  This is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, which would allow her to purchase clothing wholesale. Angela has good credit references and impeccable morals; and she promises that she will be able to pay off the debt. And, at the same time, she hopes to make her home financially secure.

loans.use: to purchase clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Jane Jerold

texts.en: Jane Jerold is the good daughter of a fisherman who spends his time working in order to provide for the family and for her studies. She helps her mother sell fish in her free time to earn a living. She requested a loan to pay tuition fees and now she is requesting a loan for her school allowances and miscellaneous expenses. Her dream is to finish her professional studies and have a better future.

loans.use: to pay for school allowances and miscellaneous expenses.

loans.name: Junry

texts.en:
Junry is studying business administration in a university. As the first son, he has to be a role model to his three siblings. His father is a private employee and his mother takes care of the household. 

To pay for his school tuition fees, he has borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit. He is planning to find a better job after he graduates and to earn a better income in order to support his family financially.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fees

loans.name: Garson

texts.en: Garson is a farmer with three children. He also had engaged in providing transportation services to earn more income while waiting for cropping season. He also used his motorcycle in carrying his farm products. For ten years in farming, his experience made him gain a better income from the farm. Recently, he borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to use for motor repair and buy tires to replace the old used ones. In the future, he wants to acquire a new motorcycle to use it for expansion of his services.

loans.use: to use for motor repair and to buy tires to replace the old used ones.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en: Morris is a 48-year-old man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 15 years to 22 years. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes to sell. He describes his family challenge to be a poor lighting system and the high cost of fuel. He will use the Kes 14500 loan to buy a solar lamp for lighting his house. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man. He has two children aged 2 years and 5 years. He describes himself as hopeful. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits. His business is located in an urban town and his primary customers are small scale. He says his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds and his biggest family challenge is lack of enough water harvesting capacity to store clean water. 

George will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a water-harvesting facility and stock of fruit. The water-harvesting facility will enable his family to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that he will have a bright future. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water-harvesting facility and stock of fruit

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 31-year-old married man with three children living in Hoima, Uganda. He earns additional income from a milling machine, farming, and being a stockist of soft drinks and beers. After being affected by poverty in his childhood, he promised to redeem his family from that animal (poverty). However, price fluctuations and competition hinders the business. He desires to build a residential house. Patrick wants a loan to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Nora Leonor

texts.es: La señora Nora tiene 55 años de edad, es una persona responsbale y trabajadora,es viuda desde hace varios años, su esposo era policía y falleció cumpliendo su labor con un disparo en un atraco a una joyería. Actualmente la señora trabaja como portera de un colegio en la ciudad de Cochabamba, una de sus hijas quedo embarazada y el padre del niño la abandono para no tener responsabilidades, ahora ella se hizo cargo de los gastos de su hija, la acogió en su casa  y disfruta de la compañía de su pequeño nieto, el motivo del presente crédito es para poder comprar mercadería (dulces, galletas y otros) para su puesto de venta, ofreciendo sus productos en el recreo del colegio, de esta forma podra generar mayores ingresos para otorgarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: Nora is 55 years old. She is a responsible, hardworking person. She has been a widow for several years; her husband was a police officer and died in the line of duty of a gunshot wound during a jewelry store robbery. Nora currently works as a caretaker at a school in the city of Cochabamba. One of her daughters became pregnant and the child's father abandoned her so he wouldn't have to take responsibility. Now Nora has taken on paying her daughter's expenses. She took her into her home and enjoys her little grandson's company. She is requesting this loan so she can buy products (candy, cookies, and so on) for her stall and sell them during recess at the school. That way she will earn greater profits so she can offer her family a better life and cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy products (candy, cookies, and so on) for her stall.

loans.name: Ana Delmy

texts.es:
Ana tiene 51 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora que a pesar de ser una madre soltera ha logrado sacar adelante a su única hija de 26 años de edad, Ana solo pudo estudiar hasta cuarto grado en la escuela, lo cual se le ha dificultado para conseguir un buen empleo.

Ana se ha dedicado desde hace 20 años a comercializar con ventas ambulantes, ya que la situación económica en la que ella vivía le obligaban a ejercer dicha actividad, pero realizar ese trabajo le resultaba un poco inestable y riesgoso, hasta que decidió poner una tienda estable en su casa  en la que lleva  15 años invirtiendo y brindando servicio a los clientes, ofreciendo productos de primera necesidad.

Ella necesita el crédito, para invertir en su tienda ya que los pedidos son constantes al igual que la demanda de producto, ella espera poder seguir trabajando con su negocio por mucho más tiempo. 

Ella planea para un futuro, abrir otro negocio dedicado a la misma actividad, esto con el objetivo de tener un negocio más surtido y más grande, de donde pueda obtener ingresos que le ayuden a sostenerse junto a su hija y su nieta de 4 años, ella piensa lograrlo con mucho esfuerzo mediante el trabajo, y la ayuda que le brinda CrediCampo.
texts.en:
Ana is 51 years old. She is a hard-working woman who, in spite of being a single mother, has managed to raise her only daughter, who is now 26. Ana was only able to attend school through the fourth grade, which has made it difficult for her to find a good job.

For 20 years, Ana made sales as a walking vendor, since the economic situation in which she was living obliged her to undertake this activity, but doing this work turned out to be a little unstable and risky, until she decided to set up a permanent shop in her house, where she has been investing and offering service to customers for 15 years, offering products to meet basic needs.

She needs the loan to invest in her store, since the orders are constant, like the demand for products. She hopes to be able to continue working in her business for a long time.

In the future, she plans to open another store dedicated to the same business, with the goal of having a better stocked and larger business, from which she can obtain income that will help her support herself, along with her daughter and her 4-year-old granddaughter. She thinks she can achieve this with much effort through work and the help that CrediCampo offers.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Cielito Lindo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CIELITO LINDO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Soledad es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de medias, snack de comida, venta de busos, venta de utensilios, venta de jugos, elaboración de bolsas, elaboración de puertas, venta de polleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Soledad es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una prima que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de bolsas plásticas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al observar que este producto es uno de los más vendidos en el mercado, es por ello que con un poco capital decide comercializar este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de bolsas plásticas) que adquirirá de las fábricas de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es soltera y dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, capacitación y crédito que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Cielito Lindo" communal bank is getting its first loan from Pro Mujer as a part of the "Centro Focal de Alto Lima."  It is made up of 8 members and is led by a board of directors where Soledad is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied and include selling socks, selling snacks, selling sweatshirts, selling tools, selling juice, making bags, making doors, and selling polleras (traditional skirts).

The loan that they will receive will benefit small businesses, including that of Soledad.  She says that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer and that she became involved with it after her cousin (who is a member) invited her.  She has a business selling plastic bags.  She started this business after observing that this is one of the most sold goods in the local market.  It is for this reason that she used her scant resources to start this business.

The loan that she is asking for is so she can increase her capital and buy plastic bags.  She will get them from the La Paz factories and then sell them according to her customers' demand.  This type of work allows her to earn money so she can support her family (she is single and has two children).

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health aspect, the training, and the loans that the group offers.

loans.use: buy plastic bags.

loans.name: Alibala

texts.en: Alibala is single and lives in the Baku region with his parents. But Alibala is from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan-Djabrayil city and for 21 years, his family members have been IDP (İnternally Displaced Persons). Alibala has been in the master business for three years. He paints furniture, wooden doors, windows, etc. Now he needs different colors and brushes. To meet this need, he has applied to Komak for a loan of 1,500 Azerbaijan New Manat. Alibala says thanks to the Kiva organization and the lenders for help. In the near future, Alibala wants to get married and increase his business.

loans.use: to buy different paints and brushes

loans.name: Edda Ramona

texts.es: Doña Edda es originaria de la ciudad de Managua, casada y madre de tres hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Se siente agradecida con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que logro comprar la materia prima suficiente para la elaboración de tortillas que también ofrece en su pulpería. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Maíz, Arroz, Frijoles, Cuadernos, Folders, Lápices entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para obtener ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de su hogar.
texts.en: Edda is from the city of Managua. She is married and has three adult children. She is a businesswoman and has her own grocery store. She is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because she has been able to buy the ingredients to make tortillas, which she also sells in her shop. She is requesting this loan to buy corn, rice, beans, notebooks, folders, pencils, and so on. She calculates that the loan will be of great help to her to earn more income and be able to improve conditions in her home.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, beans, notebooks, folders, pencils, and so on.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco tiene 50 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pero aprendió a firmar ya que un amigo le enseñó, está soltero y no tiene hijos, él vive con su madre y ella depende de él totalmente.

Marco se dedica al cultivo de maíz,  además le gusta trabajar con ganado, pues piensa que es un buen negocio, él compra el ganado y luego los vende a un mejor precio, además tiene un grupo de músicos que cantan y tocan en un mariachi que él posee.

Él solicita este crédito, ya que vendió los animales para cancelar un crédito que tenía, pero con este préstamo comprará otra vez su ganado, para negociarlos y que de esta manera no le falten los ingresos para el hogar.

Él sueña con seguir adelante con su negocio de compra y venta de ganado, para tener mejor calidad de vida y seguir cuidando de su madre.
texts.en:
Marco is 50 years old. He did not have the opportunity to go to school, be he learned to sign his name, since a friend taught him. He is single and has no children. He lives with his mother, and she depends on him completely.

Marco raises corn. In addition, he likes to work with cattle, since he thinks that it is a good business. He buys cattle and then he sells them at a better price. He is also part of a group of musicians who sing and play in a mariachi band.

He is applying for this loan, since he sold his animals to pay a debt that he had, but with this loan he will again buy cattle to sell, so that in this way he will not lack income for the household.

He dreams of continuing forward with his business of buying and selling cattle in order to have a better quality of life and continue caring for his mother.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Saraswati Mission Shakti Shg Group

texts.en:
This group is named "Saraswati Mission Shakti Shg" and is from a small village in Sonepur district in Odisha, India. This small village is very far from the capital and is in its growth stage. All of the members of the group want to help their families and their community. All the group members are women.

All of the members work at rural activities such as raising farmyard animals, vegetable cultivation, etc. Urmila, the lady standing with her hand raised, is president of this group. Urmila is 39 years old and married with three children. She lives with her husband and children. Currently, she has 15 goats. She is requesting this loan to buy balanced feed to continue raising her animals. She hopes to continue fighting for her family and to improve their lifestyle.

All the group members are very excited and very grateful to Kiva's lenders for this kind of help and support.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita owns and operates a general store, selling groceries in her village to earn a living. She's been in this business for more than three years. She earns well from this business and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. To gain more profit, Conchita needs additional capital. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. While her husband is earning from the farm, she is hopeful too to gain more profit from her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a widowed woman with three school-going children. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Saumu has operated a clothes-selling business for the past two years. She sells from door-to-door to passers-by and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Llano Grande Group

texts.es:
La señora Nivia Yaneth es casada. De edad 37 años. De escolaridad Primaria completa. Tiene 4 hijos y de ellos 3 estan estudiando. Se dedica a la agricultura y luego vende lo que cosecha. Inició este negocio vendiendo en la plaza de la localidad y a la fecha lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de semillas para la producción de sus cosechas. Desea en el futuro contar con más capital y tener buena producción.

Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio.
texts.en:
Sra. Nivia Yaneth is 37 years old, married, and completed her primary school education. She has four children, three of whom are studying. Nivia is a farmer who sells what she harvests. She started her business by selling at the town plaza. As of now, she has six years of experience.

Nivia organized a group so that she could request a loan. She will buy seeds so that she can produce her crops. In the future, she would like to have more capital and good production.

The other group members work in the retail trade.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima is a 38-year-old mother of two sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a mason by profession, and he is responsible for feeding his family and managing the entire household. Fatima has been running her own business selling clothes for the past six years. And she also contributes her income with her husband's to fulfill the needs of her family.

Fatima needs different types of clothes for the purpose of reselling, but she does not have enough money to buy these clothes in bulk. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva group loan with other two members. With the help of this loan, she can easily purchase clothes in bulk for her business purpose. 
For this financial assistance, Fatima is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of clothes for the purpose of reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in her business selling chickens and the shop that she has in her house.

loans.name: Maria Zonia

texts.es: Maria de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, lociones, etc. desde hace varios años, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, posee mucha clientela por la calidad y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Maria esta solicitando un crédito par ala compra de mas productos por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo e ingresos y asi ella y su familia puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, age 48, lives in her own home with her family. She has been selling perfumes, crèmes, deodorants, lotions, and other products for several years. Maria offers her products as a traveling vendor by going to different neighborhoods near her house. She has many customers because of the quality and good pricing of her products. With the income she generates from her sales, Maria is able to cover some of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy products in bulk. This will enable her to continue her business since it is her only source of both income and work. As a result, Maria and her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, deodorants, lotions, and other products.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
This is Mupa. Her previous loan was a big help in that she was able to buy more bales of used clothes to sell. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing.

Besides clothes, Mupa also sells goats. She is now applying for a 50,000 KES loan to buy more goats to raise and sell. She looks forward to an increase in her income with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Dzitu

texts.en:
Dzitu is a married woman who is blessed with six school-aged children. She lives in her own house which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Dzitu sells charcoal from her home to her neighbors and other villagers. The cost of transporting it is a great challenge for her.

Dzitu joined Yehu to get access to financial aid. She is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her coffee plantings.

loans.name: Jellybeth

texts.en: Jellybeth is studying for a Bachelor's of Science in criminology at a university. Her parents are earning from fishing and selling fish to provide for their big family. She has four siblings still depending on her parents. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to pay for her school tuition fees. She wants to become successful in order to gain a better job and be able to share with her family what she has attained in life.

loans.use: to pay for her school tuition fees.

loans.name: Jaidi

texts.en:
Jaidi’s mother is a teacher in her village; her father works as a driver to help earn money to support the family. Jaidi is studying to get a Bachelor of Science degree in Information Technology and dreams of getting a good job in the future.

She joined GDMPC to avail herself of its loans. She is now applying for 10,000 PHP to pay her tuition. In the future she wants to be successful and contribute to better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a married woman. She describes herself as serious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, curtains, etc. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her family challenge to be poor source for cooking. She will use the KES 65,000 loan to buy a gas cooker and add stock of clothes, curtains etc. The gas cooker will enable her family cook efficiently. She hopes that in the future, she will have a sustainable business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker for personal use and add stock of clothes, curtains, etc. for her retail business.

loans.name: Dionalyn

texts.en: Dionalyn is studying for a Bachelor's of Science in Information Technology at a university. She is hoping that having a better education would uplift the general living standards of her family. Her father is a farmer while her mother works as a baby sitter to earn a living. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to pay for her tuition fees. She is thankful to GDMPC for supporting her in her ambition to be a better person someday.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Ignatius

texts.en: Ignatius is aged 47 years and has four children; he lives in Hoima, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy chicks for rearing. He also gets additional income from salary and farming. Due to his personal demands, he has decided to engage himself in produce by buying and selling; he is targeting the high demand for produce in his area. Price fluctuations and bad roads affect his profitability base. He dreams of buying a lorry to ease transportation of his products to his customers. Ignatius will use the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en: Mlongo appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support that has improved her living standards. She is requesting for a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase bales of women wrap clothing (khangas) for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of women wrap clothing (khangas) for resale.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es:
Ella es Katherine, Caracterizada por ser una persona sencilla,  directa, carácter maduro, carismático, sensible, frágil, juicioso, trabajador, responsable y comprometido. 
Nacida el 2 de Abril, después de la separación  de los padres, la madre se va para otra ciudad, donde vive la familia, en donde se radica a vivir con ella, la mama empieza a trabajar, para responder por la hija, la cual comienza a crecer cada día mas, en esos tiempos ocurre una de las perdidas familiares más significativas para el núcleo familiar, la muerte del abuelo, 14 meses después el fallecimiento del  tío,  consecuencias que llevaron al cambio de lugar de vivienda.
Algunas veces la madre tuvo la obligación de dejarla en varios lugares donde amigos para el cuidado de la hija, en donde llegaban hasta una semana que no se veían, por cuestiones de trabajo para la manutención y educación de la hija. A pesar de esa falta de convivencia entre mamá e hija,  Katherine siempre fue una excelente estudiante, con un buen desempeño académico, sueños, ilusiones y metas propuestas.
Empezar a realizar una carrera después de salir de undécimo es el sueño de cualquier persona, el ¿Qué? El ¿Dónde? Y el ¿Cuánto? Son las principales preguntas que pasan por la cabeza cuando esta a unos cuantos meses de salir del colegio.
Los inconvenientes eran el ¿Dónde? Y el ¿Cuánto?, ya que solo contaba con la madre como apoyo económico, en ese tiempo la madre no contaba con un trabajo, ni un sueldo estable, por ello el Sena sería una buena opción de estudio; debido a que en grado décimo se empezó a realizar un curso en el colegio con convenio con el Sena, este se llevó a cabo por unos cuantos meses, y no se pudo terminar, 
Ella se entera de Campo Alto, en el cual iba a realizar los estudios. Katherine indaga en internet, se comunica directamente con el instituto, le informan sobre el descuento que en esos momentos manejaban y se matriculo en el programa de mercadeo y ventas. 
Estudiar en campo alto es una puerta abierta no solo para el aprendizaje superior sino para la vida laboral, profesional y sobre todo para la vida personal y familiar. Retribuirle a la madre los años de dedicación, esfuerzo para que este donde esta es una de las metas por cumplir, por ello lucha cada día mas, para poder terminar lo que en este momento se encuentra realizando, dando paso a nuevas metas por cumplir, nuevos objetivos enfocados y las mejor actitud para aprender cada día más.  
Ella ingresa a trabajar los fines de semana para tener ayuda económica en el estudio, allí aprende a conocer personas, escuchar, observar, además de trabajar allí e interactuar con la sociedad, con actitudes, totalmente diferentes a la suya ha sido una experiencia inolvidable para ella, además con este trabajo se ha podido cancelar los dos semestres ya terminados en Campo Alto, en donde solo falta un semestre para finalizar, la meta próxima es realizar prácticas remuneradas, para terminar de pagar el estudio, colaborar a la madre, y continuar el próximo año con la carrera profesional, no solo esto, sino aprender cada día mas, de las personas, hechos, actos y actitudes vistas y vividas, para ser cada día mejor.

Como ya menciono antes el convenio de kiva le sería de gran ayuda, ya que ella misma es la que cancela el valor de las mensualidades y el trabajo es solo los fines de semana.
texts.en:
This is Katherine, who is known for being a simple, direct, mature, charismatic, sensible, fragile, wise, hardworking, responsible, and committed person.

She was born on April 2nd.  After her parents got divorced, she and her mother moved to another city (where her family lives).  She started to work to support her daughter, who grew more every day.  During this time, one of her closest family members, her grandfather, died.  Fourteen months later, her uncle died and as a result they had to move to a different house.

Occasionally, her mother had to leave her with friends so she could be taken care of.  At one point, they went without seeing each other for a full week due to work.  Despite these challenges, Katherine was always an excellent student and did well in school.  She also had goals, hopes, and dreams.

Starting a career after 11th grade is everyone's dream.  What, where, and how much are the main questions that occupy the thoughts of every student who has only a few months left of high school left.

The inconvenient questions were what and how much, since she only had her mother to support her.  At this time, her mother didn't have work or a stable salary.  For this reason, El Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje (Sena) was a good option.  In 10th grade she started a high school class with a contract with Sena.  She participated for a few months but wasn't able to finish.

She heard about Campo Alto and planned to do her schooling there.  Katherine looked it up online and communicated directly with the institute.  They told her about a scholarship that they had at the time and she started school there studying commerce and sales.

Studying in Campo Alto has been a great opportunity not only due to the great education but also because of the work, professional, and above all personal and family life that she enjoyed.  One of the reasons she is where she is is because she wants to pay her mother back for her years of support.  For this reason, she keeps going every day and works to finish what she has started.  She always has new goals to meet, new objectives to focus on, and always has a good attitude about learning more every day.

She started working on the weekends so she could have financial help while studying.  There, she learned to get to know people, to listen, to observe, and also to work there and interact with people who had totally different attitudes than hers.  It has been an unforgettable experience for her.  In addition, with the help of this job, she has been able to pay for both semesters that she has spent at Campo Alto and she only has one semester left.  Her current goals include paying for her last semester, paying back her mother, and starting her professional career next year.  Not only this, but she wants to learn more every day about people, facts, actions, and attitudes seen and lived.  She wants to make every day better than the last.

As she already mentioned, before her payment is due, Kiva would be a great help.  She will make the monthly payments by working on the weekends.

loans.use: pay for another semester of school.

loans.name: Leofe

texts.en: Leofe has been working in her own farm to make a living. For more than six years, she has been earning a good income and has successfully repaid the previous loan that she used for her business. To improve her business, she had to expand her farm to gain more returns. She took a new loan recently to buy a new variety of seeds and organic fertilizer for the farm and buy tires for the motorcycle. She also used her motorcycle to carry farm produce. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of seeds and organic fertilizer for the farm and buy tires for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
For more than six years Gina has helped her husband catch and sell fish to earn a living in the local community. They make a good living this way.

Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that allowed her to improve her living situation and help with her business. She successfully repaid a previous loan which she used to buy fishing equipment. She is now applying for a new loan, this one for 30,000 PHP, to buy more varieties of fish to sell and boxes to put them in.

Gina plans to use her anticipated profits to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of fish to sell and boxes to put them in

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, 45, is married with seven children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has had a small retail shop for the past seven years, which has helped him to look after his family. There are challenges for him, though, because of insufficient capital to put into his shop and price fluctuations in Uganda.

However, William is determined to educate his children at least up to university level so that they can become self-sufficient. He is therefore applying for a 1,000,000 UGX loan through HOFOKAM to cover the school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay for school fees for his children

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is married with two children who go to school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food .

Rose sells household items: various plastic items such as plates, cups, basins and carpets among others. With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase more stock of household items such as basins, jugs, plates, cups and chairs for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household items such as basins, jugs, plates, cups and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is married with one child who goes to school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Jacinta has operated a shoe-selling business and has been tailoring for the past three years. She sells to passers-by and her neighbours. With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of shoes and fabric for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of shoes and fabric for her business.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.ru:
Муродчон жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 48 лет. Он женат и имеет троих замечательных детей, которые очень любят и уважают своего отца. Муродчон со своей семьёй живёт в сельской деревне. Жена Муродчона домохозяйка, она занимается домашними делами, а также помогает Муродчону вести бизнес. Чтобы иметь постоянный доход в своей семье Муродчон занимается собственным бизнесом. 

Муродчон вместе со своими детьми решили вести бизнес, продавать на местном базаре сухофрукты. Этот вид бизнеса хорошо работает, особенно для местного населения. В каждом доме должны иметь разного вида угощения для гостей, куда и входят также сухофрукты. Большинство туристов также закупают данный продукт, так как это является изюминкой Таджикистана. Для ведения своего бизнеса Муродчон имеет собственную торговую точку на местном базаре. Сейчас Муродчон желает закупить на большом базаре оптом, разного вида сухофрукты для дальнейшей продажи, но у него не имеется достаточной суммы. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку сухофруктов. Муродчон очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Murodjon is a cheerful and hardworking man.  He is 48 years old, married, and has three wonderful children who deeply love and respect him. Murodjon and his family live in a rural village.  Murodjon's wife is a housekeeper and takes care of household business as well as helping Murodjon run the business he started in order to provide his family with a stable income.

Murodjon and his children went into the business of selling dried fruits at the local bazaar where he has his own sales stall.   He does a good business, especially among the people in his village.  Everyone has to be ready for guests and to have on hand an assortment of treats, including dried fruits.  The majority of tourists also buy them because they are the essence of Tajikistan.  

Presently Murodjon wants to buy a large quantity of assorted dried fruits at wholesale prices, but he doesn't have enough money.  Because of this he has applied to MDO Arvand and wants to take out a loan for the purchase of dried fruits.  Murodjon is really hoping for a positive response and wants to thank MDO Arvand for its support in advance.

loans.use: to buy dried fruit

loans.name: Anarbubu

texts.ru: Анарбубу 66 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 6 детей. Все женаты, проживают отдельно со своими семьями, самый младший сын проживает совместно с родителями и своей семьей, помогает по хозяйству. У Анарбубу - среднее образование. По характеру -честная, ответственная, трудолюбивая и позитивно настроенная на жизнь. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Анарбубу занимается полеводством дополнительно животноводством, стартовав 9 лет назад, с 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Анарбубу, на сегодняшний день имеется: 2,34 ГА собственной земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации, а также имеет 2 дойные коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анарбубу обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку семян фасоли для посевных работ, а также удобрений для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Анарбубу планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Anarbubu is 65 years old and she has a secondary level education.  She is an honest, responsible, hard working woman with a positive outlook on life.   She and her husband raised six children.  They are all married now and live with their own families.  Their youngest son and his family live with them and he helps them with Anarbubu's farming and animal husbandry businesses.   She started these businesses 9 years ago with a starting capital of 20,000 som (KGS).  Now they provide her family's main income.  As a result of her hard work, today Anarbubu owns 2.34 hectares of land where she grows beans for home consumption as well as sales.  She also has two milk cows.  Her monthly income amounts to 17,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further developing her business, Anarbubu applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan to buy bean seeds and fertilizers for her farming business.  Anarbubu plans to invest the profits from the loan in acquiring more cattle and to save save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, bean seeds

loans.name: Cruz Celedonio

texts.es: Don Cruz Celedonio es originario de la ciudad de Managua, casado y padre de cuatro hijos. Es de oficio vulcanizador, se dedica a la reparación de todo tipo de llantas. Se siente agradecido con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que logro obtener las herramientas necesarias para la realización de su trabajo. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Llantas para carros y motos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ofrecer un servicio con mayor rapidez, eficiencia y calidad obteniendo así mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Mr. Cruz Celedonio is a native of the city of Managua. He's married and is a father of four children. A tire repairman by trade, his job is repairing all types of tires. He is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito because he was able to obtain the tools necessary to perform his work. The loan he's requesting is for the purchase of: Tires for cars and motorcycles. He figures the loan will be of great assistance since it would enable him to offer quicker, more efficient, and higher quality service and thus increase his profits.

loans.use: To purchase: Tires for cars and motorcycles

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary a sus 37 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y pujante, madre soltera de una hija adolescente, a la que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
Desde hace 10 años se gana la vida trabajando como comerciante independiente, pues tiene un pequeño negocio en un quiosco ubicado en una calle muy transitada del municipio donde reside; allí trabaja sola todos los días y ofrece mecato, alimentos fritos, gaseosas y otros productos, de esta forma logra generar los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su labor y ampliar su negocio, encuentra en el crédito un apoyo para lograr sus objetivos, pues requiere comprar material de construcción y pagar la mano de obra, así cambiará la imagen del establecimiento y podrá atender mejor a su clientela, generando mayores ingresos por las ventas que espera aumentar.
Mary manifiesta que desea seguir trabajando con perseverancia y entusiasmo, pues sueña con tener la capacidad para dar a su hija una buena educación universitaria para que se forje un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Mary, 37, is a hard-working and successful woman.  She is a single mother with one adolescent daughter, who she has brought up with a lot of dedication and sacrifice.

She has been earning her living for the last ten years as an independent trader.  She has a small kiosk located on a very busy street in the area where she lives.  She works alone every day and sells snacks, fried foods, soft drinks and other things.  This allows her to generate enough income to pay for the household expenses.

She finds the loan useful in helping her to achieve her aims, which are to strengthen her position and expand her business.  She wants to buy some building material and pay the labor costs for this expansion, which will change the image of her shop and allow her to serve her customers better.  This, in turn, will help her generate more profits.

Mary aims to continue working with the same determination and enthusiasm as her dream is to be able to pay for a university education for her daughter so she can have a prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cinco hijos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, con las ventas de sus productos y la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Sandra esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herbicidas y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía  para poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sandra, 35, lives in her own house with her husband and five children.  She has been working in agriculture for several years, sowing mainly corn and frijol bean crops.  With the sales of these products, she helps her husband with the household expenses.  

Sandra is asking for a loan to buy some agricultural supplies such as seeds, compost, fertilizers, pest control and herbicides; and also to improve the soil shown in the photograph, where she sows these seeds.  As a result, she will be able to continue with this work which gives her a good income and allows her to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, pest controls, herbicides and improve the soil.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 25 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el se dedica desde hace 8 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y maicillo, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los alrededores de la zona, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, controles de plagas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. para poder seguir con sus cultivos y así poder tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: The 25 year old borrower lives in his own home with his partner and child, and has worked for 8 years in agriculture. He sows maize and sorghum and once his harvest is ready he markets it in the surrounding areas. The borrower is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, pest control, fertilizer, weedkiller, etc, so that he can continue with his crops and earn more income to increase his family's financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase seed, pest control, fertilizer, weedkiller, etc.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas vive en la ciudad de Huancarani al Sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad economica principal es la venta de abarrotes en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella también ahora se está dedicando a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y chanchos.  

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar y sacos de fideos y sacos de arroz.
texts.en:
Felicitas lives in the Huancaraní neighborhood in the southern part of the city of Cusco. Her earnings come primarily from selling groceries from her home. She has been in this business for a number of years now, and it is going very well for her thanks to the determination she applies to her work. Felicitas is also raising small animals like guinea pigs and pigs.

She is taking the opportunity to request a loan to purchase more merchandise, such as bags of sugar, pasta and rice.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise, such as bags of sugar, pasta and rice.

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru: Бурулкан 38 лет, разведена, одна воспитывает 4 дочерей. Две старшие дочери учатся в школе, младшие дошкольного возраста. У Бурулкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бурулкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 25,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бурулкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, 10 овец. По хозяйству помогают отец и брат Бурулкан, которые проживают рядом с ней. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бурулкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку ntkzn для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бурулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Burulkan is 38 years old, divorced, and is raising four daughters.  Her two eldest daughters are in school, the youngest two are still too young.  Burulkan has a secondary level education and her family's main income is the animal husbandry business she started 14 years ago with a purchase of 25,000 som (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of her hard work, today Burulkan has three milk cows, two calves, and ten sheep.  Her father and brother, who live next door, help her with the business.  Her monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further developing her business, Burulkan applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan to buy calves to increase the size of her herd.  Burulkan plans to invest the profits from the loan in increasing the size of her herd further still as well as to save money for her children's educations.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Jarkynay

texts.ru: Жаркынай 47 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Жаркынай - среднее образование. По характеру Жаркынай очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. В данный момент Жаркынай вместе с мужем занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 25 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жаркынай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,500 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, также обрабатывает 0,55 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает картофель, кукурузу и зелень на реализацию. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жаркынай обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Жаркынай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Jarkynay is 47 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising five children.  Jarkynay has a secondary level education.  She is very responsible, outgoing, and cheerful.  Presently, Jarkynay and her husband are in the animal husbandry and farming business.  They started their business 25 years ago with a purchase of 3,000 som (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of her hard work, today Jarkynay has two milk cows.  Her monthly income amounts to 10,500 som (KGS).  She also works 0.55 hectares of land where she primarily grows potatoes, corn, and herbs, which she sells to wholesalers.  

With an aim to further developing her business, Jarkynay applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan to buy cows for fattening and reselling at a good price at the market.  Jarkynay plans to invest the profits from the loan in acquiring more cattle as well as to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Generación 2013 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GENERACIÓN 2013” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silvia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de dulces, venta de CD’s, venta de vajillas, servicio de mantenimiento de máquina, venta de mantas, venta de deportivos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silvia es integrante, ella indica que  hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su tía que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de dulces; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus familiares ya que ayudaba en el negocio que tenían, posterior a tener un pequeño capital decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de dulces por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializa en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella  es soltera y vive con su tía.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrecen en la institución.
texts.en:
The group “Generación 2013” began its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the "Centro Focal de Santiago II". It is comprised of eight members and is directed by the office of Silvia who is President. The members of the communal association run various businesses. Among those are blanket weaving, candy sales, CD sales, silverware sales, machine repair service, blanket sales, and sporting goods sales. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small business owners where Silvia is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago after the invitation of her aunt who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling candies. She learned this business from her family as she helped them with the businesses they had. After making a small profit, she decided to start her own business.

The loan she will now take is to increase her capital (buying wholesale candy) that she will acquire at fairs in the city of El Alto. Then she will sell it at her place of business. This kind of job allows her to make an income to maintain her home as much as possible as she is single and lives with her aunt. 
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the healthy environment they offer her at the institution.

loans.use: to buy wholesale candies.

loans.name: Alpha Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mariamu est une commerçante depuis 20 ans et membre d’un collectif d’affaires « Alpha ». Senior entrepreneur, âgée de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants, dont 7 étudient et 3 autres sont encore gamins.  Elle est vendeuse souliers usagés. Elle installe son business dans le marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 20 paires de souliers dames.  Son conjoint est un couturier. Elle avait débuté avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite  accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir  ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en  leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflit dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en:
Mariamu has been a trader for twenty years, and she is a member of the business group 'Alpha'.  This senior entrepreneur is forty-eight years old, married and has nine children.  Seven of her children attend school but the others are still too young.

Mariamu sells second-hand shoes at the central market in the town.  She has requested this loan from the field partner, Hekima, in order to expand her business.  She will buy twenty pairs of women's shoes for resale.  Mariamu's husband is a tailor and she started her business with money provided by him.

In the future, she would like to increase her working capital, feed and educate her children.

Mariamu is very grateful to Hekima for providing invaluable support to non-bankable, women entrepreneurs, by offering them unguaranteed loans.  This is especially important during this post-conflict period in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of women's shoes for resale.

loans.name: Valientes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VALIENTES” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: carpintería, servicio de construcción, venta de ropa, costura de deportivos, venta de refrescos, venta de cotillones, venta de comida, servicio de seguridad.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de ropa americana; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con un poco capital que tenía y al observar que este producto se vendía con gran existo lo adquirió.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de la ciudad de Oruro y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, crédito y capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The communal bank "Valientes" will begin its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II Regional Office. It consists of nine group members and is run by a board of directors in which Lidia is the president. The businesses in which the communal bank members work are varied, and include: carpentry, construction services, clothing sales, sewing athletic apparel, soft drink sales, party novelty sales, food sales, and security services. The loan that will be received will help the group of micro-business entrepreneurs that Lidia is a member of. She states that she's been a member of Pro Mujer for two years and got in through the invitation of one of the organization's representatives when she visited her home. Currently she has a business that sells american clothing. She informs us that she started the business with the small amount of capital she had and upon seeing that the product was selling very successfully she acquired it. The loan that she will now obtain is to increase the capital (the purchase of wholesale clothing) that she will acquire from the city of Oruro and subsequently market it in her selling location. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she cohabits with her partner and has seven children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the healthcare, loans, and training offered by the organization.

loans.use: To purchase clothes wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer for his studies.

loans.name: Evelyn Jacqueline

texts.es: Evelyn es originaria de la ciudad de Managua, casada y madre de dos hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de servicios básicos y perecederos. Se siente agradecida con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que logro comprar estantes para la presentación de sus productos. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Cuadernos, Lápices, Libretas, reglas entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda porque podrá obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Evelyn is originally from the city of Managua. She is married and a mother of two children. She is a merchant and works selling basic services and perishable foods. She is thankful for Kiva and MiCrédito as she has already been able to buy shelves to showcase her products. She is applying for a loan to buy notebooks, pencils, notepads, rulers and more. She believes that the loan will help her a lot because she will be able to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, notepads, rulers, and more.

loans.name: Zoren Roi

texts.en: Zoren Roi is studying Industrial Technology at a university. He wants to get a better job that makes him an excellent person in the future. His mother is a teacher and he never wants her to despair because of him. All he wants is his family to be proud of him. He is the eldest of three siblings and he wants to be a role model. He joined GDMPC and had borrowed a loan to pay for the school tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for school tuition fees.

loans.name: Songre Group

texts.fr:
NIENKOUN est responsable du groupe SONGRE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère d’un enfant. Il est âgé de 06ans et va à l’école. Elle a 02personnes en charge. 
Mme vend du savon et de l’eau glacée depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
 Mme veut s’acheter 03sacs de savon kabakourou et 04cartons de savons parfumé. 
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices. Ambitionne s’acheter une moto et améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Nienkoun is the leader of the 'Songre' Group.  She is doing very well.  She is married and has one, six-year-old child who currently attends school.  She is financially responsible for two people.

Nienkoun has been selling soap and iced water for six years.  She buys her supplies at a local market, and sells to both men and women.

With her loan, Nienkoun will buy three sacks of washing soap (savon kabakourou) and four boxes of perfumed soap.

She intends to save her earnings as she would like to buy a motorbike and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of washing soap and 4 boxes of perfumed soap for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay for labor to assist with her coffee farm.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar de 51 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz, maicillo, ayote y loroco, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijos, Oscar esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas,. controles de plagas, etc. para seguir con sus cultivos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar, 51, has earned a living as a farmer for several years.  His main crops are corn, sorghum, squash and loroco (plant buds).  He sells the produce at the different markets close to his place of residence and the income earned covers some of the household expenses.  

Oscar lives in his own home with his wife and children.  He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, disease control, etc. so he can continue to grow crops and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, disease control, etc.

loans.name: Solace

texts.fr: Monsieur SOLACE est un  homme âgé de 51 ans qui habite dans le même quartier  que le guichet. Il détient un périmètre et y pratique le maraîchage.   Il a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans cette activité. SOLACE est marié et père de famille. Il sollicite ce crédit d’un montant de 300.000F pour acheter des semences et engrais pour la bonne pratique du maraîchage. Il commence sa journée à 6h du matin pour la terminer à 17h le soir. Il prend en charges les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais scolaires de ses enfants.  A l’avenir il voudrait aménager l’ensemble de ses terrains pour y pratiquer le maraîchage.
texts.en:
Solace is fifty-one years old, and lives locally to the field partner's office.  He owns a plot of land where he grows vegetables, and he has more than ten years' experience in his business.  Solace is married and has children.

He has requested this loan of 300,000 francs CFA, in order to buy seeds and fertilizer for his vegetable-growing business.  He starts his working day at 6am and finishes at 5pm.  Solace is responsible for the day-to-day expenses of his family and the school fees of his children.

In the future, he would like to improve his land and continue his vegetable-growing business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his agricultural business.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 39-year-old man who describes himself as determined.

He operates a restaurant where he cooks food to sell. He says his biggest business challenge is the changes in tastes and preferences of his customers. He will use the KES 14,500 loan to buy a solar panel for lighting his house.

He hopes that in the future, he will be able both economically and socially to sustain his family. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM, and the previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel to enable him to light his house

loans.name: Sol De Huascata Group

texts.es: Este es La Alcancía Comunal “Sol De Huascata” constituida por 06 socios emprendedores y solidarios que buscan mejorar cada día y pasan a su 6to ciclo. Este es el caso de nuestra socia  Celia de 47 años casada con 02 hijos independientes. Con mucho esfuerzo Celia ha logrado cumplir con algunos de sus sueños como implementar su negocio y mejorar su vivienda. Hace más de 10 años que  Celia cuenta con un salón de belleza la cual brinda servicios de cortes, tratamientos capilares, peinado, manicure, entre otros.
