En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para la compra de tintes, tijeras, cremas, esmalte de uñas y de esta manera ofrecerles una mejor atención a sus clientes. El deseo de Celia es aperturar otro salón de belleza, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. El grupo “Sol De Huascata” agradece el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Celia es la segunda del lado derecho y viste polo negro y pantalón celeste.
texts.en:
This is the communal bank "Sol de Huascata" which is comprised of six supportive members who strive every day for a better life.  They are in their sixth loan cycle.  Such is the case of one of the members, Celia, who is 47, married and has two independent children.  Through much effort, Celia has been able to meet some of her goals such as starting a business and renovating her home.

For over ten years, Celia has been running a beauty salon where she provides hair cuts, hair treatments, styling, manicure, etc.  On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy hair color, scissors, creams and nail polish so she can offer better customer service.

Celia's dream is to open another salon so she can earn more income.  The group "Sol de Huascata" is grateful for the loan and committed to continuing to work well.  Celia is second from the right in a black top and light blue pants.

loans.use: To buy hair color, scissors, creams and nail polish to offer better customer service.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
Claudio vive en la ciudad de Huancarani al sur del Cusco y su actividad económica es la elaboración de muebles de madera como por ejemplo mesas, sillas, puertas, camas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad Claudio requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo cola, maderas y clavos.

Claudio continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Claudio lives in the city of Huancarani which is south of Cusco.  He earns a living making wood furniture such as tables, chairs, doors, beds and other products.  On this occasion, Claudio is requesting a loan to buy work materials such as glue, wood and nails.

Claudio continues with the communal bank "Mamacha Rosario" which belongs to the Arariwa Association.  He is grateful for this opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more work materials such as glue, wood and nails.

loans.name: Mercideta

texts.en:
Mercideta operates her own farm while her husband works as a government employee to earn a living.

For many years she has earned well from her farm, and it helps her family a lot. She successfully repaid her previous loan which was also used for the farm. Recently she has taken out a new loan to continue improving their farm by purchasing fertilizer and organic pesticides.

In the future, Mercideta wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides

loans.name: Emmanuela Group

texts.fr:
Mme M. ISABELLE  est responsable du groupe EMMANUELA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a13ans  et le moins  âgé de 11mois. 03  vont  à l’école.  
Mme gère un kiosque  depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
 Mme veut s’acheter 03sacs de riz et  des condiments. 
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Ambitionne s’acheter une parcelle  et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
M. Isabelle is the 'Emmanuela' Group representative.  She is doing very well.  She is married and has four children.  The eldest child is thirteen years old and the youngest is eleven months old.  Three of her children currently attend school.

M. Isabelle has been running a stall for six years.  She buys her supplies at the local market and sells her products to men and women.

She will use her loan to buy three sacks of rice and other food ingredients for her business.  Her earnings will be reinvested in her business.

In the future, M. Isabelle would like to buy a plot of land and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of rice and other food ingredients.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with two children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Unificada Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIFICADA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dora es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de juguetes, taller de tapicería, venta de cosméticos, servicio de construcción, venta de ropa, costura de ropa, librería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dora es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio reciclaje de chatarra; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con un poco capital que tenía y con el apoyo de una amiga que le explicó la modalidad de negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de aluminio por mayor) que adquirirá cuando las personas le entreguen en su negocio y posteriormente lo comercializará en las tiendas fundidoras. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y capacitación que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen no se encuentra una socia por que se fue a colsulta médica.
texts.en:
The communal bank "UNIFICADA" is beginning its fourth loan cycle in the Pro Mujer Program, at the Santiago II Social Center.  The group is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors.  Dora is the treasurer.  The members are involved in different business such as toy sales, reupholstery, cosmetic sales, construction, clothing sales, sewing and book sales.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners, one of whom is Dora.  She says she joined Pro Mujer a year ago and was invited by a representative of the institution who visited her at home.  She is currently in the scrap metal business which she started with a little capital and support from a friend who explained the nature of the business to her.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her work capital to buy wholesale aluminum from suppliers which she will sell to stores for processing.  She is able to earn an income this way to support her family.  She lives with her common-law husband and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it is he loans and training the institution offers.

One of the group members is missing in the photo because she had a doctor's appointment.

loans.use: To buy wholesale aluminum.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en: Mely has been operating her own general store for a living. She earns well from this business and has successfully repaid her previous loan which she used for the business. From her nine years of experience in running the store, she has no doubt she can sustain it. Recently she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, she wants to build a house and be able to support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 46-year-old married female with seven children, three of whom go to school. They live in Kasese, Uganda. She has been working in a salon for six years and decorates for additional income. Margret started her business to cater for her family and educate her children like any loving mother. She hopes to expand her business. However, inadequate capital and debtors are the challenges she faces. Margret has asked for a loan to buy hair weaves to use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves to use in her salon.

loans.name: Umoja Kibabi Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Nyamwiruki est une brave commerçante, dynamique, entrepreneur depuis 20 ans est membre d’une Association d’Affaires « Umoja Kibabi », âgée de 66 ans, divorcée et mère de  plusieurs enfants, qui tous mariés, mais continue à garder ses 6 petits fils/filles orphelins,  qui étudient. Elle est vendeuse de la tomate. Elle étale ses activités dans le marché central de la place. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 10 paniers de tomates. Elle bénéficia son premier capital de son ami. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses petits fils. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle, pendant, ce moment de conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Nyamwiruki is a courageous, dynamic, woman entrepreneur.  She has been a trader for twenty years, and is a member of the business group 'Umoja Kibabi'.  She is sixty-six years old, divorced and mother to several children who are all grown up and married.  Nyamwiruki looks after six of her grandchildren who have been orphaned.  All of these children currently attend school.

Nyamwiruki sells tomatoes from a stall in the local market.  She has requested this loan from the field partner, Hekima, in order to expand her business.  She will use the money to buy ten baskets of tomatoes for resale.  Her business was started with money that she received from a friend.

In the future, she would like to increase her working capital, educate, clothe and feed her grandchildren.  She is very grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable, women entrepreneurs, by providing unguaranteed loans.  This is especially important during this time of conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 10 baskets of tomatoes.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Ella es Paola, tiene 17 años de edad, en el 2013 finalizo el  bachillerato en el colegio cortijo – vianey.  Ella quiere iniciar una carrera técnica en auxiliar de salud oral desarrollando y adquiriendo habilidades como: atención al usuario, expresión comunicativa y la escucha activa entre otros.
Las metas a corto plazo es empezar una carrera técnica en salud oral, adquirir y desempeñarse en el ámbito laboral y así mismo apropiarse en la vida social, cumpliendo con las diferentes responsabilidades que le exigen este cargo.
Las metas a largo plazo son; continuar con una carrera profesional  para ser una buena odontóloga y tener muchos más conocimientos sobre el tema, siendo una persona llena de valores y conocimientos desempeñándose en el sitio que le corresponda según los estudios 
Ella se enteró por medio de páginas amarillas sobre campo alto, averiguo sobre esta institución y le llamo mucho la atención ya que se comunicó con ellos para más información y allí le dijeron que en las practicas el 80% de los estudiantes según el desempeño conseguían empleo allí mismo, y también que poseían una bolsa de empleo para todos los estudiantes 
Ella también se enteró del subsidio de kiva lo cual le ayuda mucho a desempeñar esta carrera ya que los costos son un poco más bajos y esto le beneficia tanto a ella como a la persona que le colabora con los gastos
Se siente muy feliz ya que inicia otra etapa de la vida desempeñándose con nuevas personas y aprendiendo nuevas cosas, ella sabe que cualquier aprendizaje es bueno y jamás se desperdicia. También experimentar como es la vida laboral y el esfuerzo que se le pone para obtener logros y metas. 
Ella quiere ser un orgullo para la familia, en especial para los padres quienes han sido las personas que toda la vida han hecho parte de los triunfos y colaborado para ellos. Siente una gran responsabilidad al saber que las personas que la quieren y que la apoyan tienen mucha fe depositada en ella para que pueda conseguir las cosas que quiere.
texts.en:
Paola, in the photo, is 17.  In 2013 she finished her high school education at the Cortijo-Vianey school.  She would now like to study on a dental course, learning such skills as customer service, communication skills and active listening, among other things.

Her short-term goals are to start this course in dental care, gain knowledge and then develop in the professional as well as in social areas of life; all the time fulfilling the different responsibilities that her profession demands. 

Her long-term goals are to complete the dental course so she can be a highly-skilled and honest dentist with a lot of knowledge in the area that she is studying.

She heard about the loans that Campo Alto offer in the Yellow Pages, which prompted her to find out a little about the organization.  She was told that normally, based on their performance, 80% of students found work.  In addition, the organization also has a jobs board for all students to be part of.
She also found out about the Kiva loans, which help her to carry out her studies, making the costs cheaper both for her and for those who help her with these expenses.

She is very happy to be starting a new stage of her life, developing with new people and learning new things.  She knows that this is important and she will never waste this time.  She also wants to experience what it is like to work and the effort required achieving objectives.

She wants her family to be proud of her, especially her parents who have always been part of her success.  She feels a great responsibility knowing that the people who love and support her have a lot of faith in her and her ability to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for one semester of her studies.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman and has three children who are in school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a fish selling business for the last five years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business. She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business.

loans.name: José Benjamin

texts.es:
José de 51 años de edad, solo logro estudiar hasta 3º grado, por motivo de fuerza mayor  no pudo seguir sus estudios por lo que desde pequeño se dedico a la agricultura . Esta acompañado, su compeñera de vida se dedica a los oficio del hogar. El tiene una hija la cual ya es mayor de edad y vive con él. 

El trabaja en la agricultura en lo que es el cultivo del maíz, la distancia que tiene es aproximadamente a cinco metros de sus casa en el cual lo hace en conjunto con su familia. José de igual forma también se dedica a la ganadería y a la compra del ganado, dichos trabajos los realiza desde muy pequeño, 

José comprara dos novillo de repasto los cuales al engordarse los venderá para pagar su préstamo y con las ganancias ahorrar un poco para los gasto de su familia y comprara algunos alimentos para el sustento de su familia

El sueño de José es seguir trabajado y de las ganancias, desea compra un terreno y así poder tener su casa propia para así poder vivir mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
José, 51, only studied until 3rd grade because of circumstances beyond his control, so he started working in agriculture at an early age.  He lives with his partner, who takes care of the house.  He has a daughter, who lives with them and is now an adult.

He works in agriculture growing corn; he has a plot of land five metres from his house which he looks after with the help of his family.  He also raises livestock and buying and selling cattle, another job he has done since he was young.

José will buy two calves for grazing, which, once they have fattened up, will be sold to pay off his loan and with the money left over he will save for the household expenses.

He dreams of buying his own plot of land where he can build his own house and live a better life with his family.

loans.use: to buy two calves for grazing.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
María es una microempresaria dedicada y trabajadora, su campo de acción es la confección, prestando el servicio a terceros.
Todo comenzó hace más de 8 años cuando trabajaba como empleada en un taller de confección y por medio de la observación aprendió el oficio; hoy en día, a sus 40 años de edad, ya tiene su propio taller en el que genera 6 empleos directos; trabaja todos los días y su fortaleza es la fabricación de pantalones y camisas de dotación; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una máquina a doble aguja, así podrá cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes y entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna, con el fin aumentar la producción y adquirir nuevos contratos, que permitan darle continuidad a su microempresa.
María sueña con seguir fortaleciendo su taller y tener cada día mayor nivel de producción para generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de su familia como la de las personas que influyen diariamente en su labor.
texts.en:
Maria is a small businesswoman who is hard-working and dedicated.  She manufactures clothing for wholesalers.  

It all started more than eight years ago when she was working in a clothes workshop and was able to learn about the industry.  Now, at 40 years of age, she has her own workshop and has six people working for her.  She works every day and her main area is producing pants and shirts for uniforms.  In this way, she can generate sufficient income to be able to support her husband with the household expenses.

She will invest this credit in a double-needle sewing machine.  This will help her to satisfy her customer demands and be able to deal with orders on time.  This will improve production and win new customers, which will allow the company to survive.

She dreams of strengthening her workshop business and having a higher level of production each day, which will generate more employment and improve the quality of life both for her family and for those who work with her.

loans.use: to buy a double needle sewing machine.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis who lives in Hoima, Uganda is 30 years old. He started by farming and used the proceeds to start up a salon. His dream is to educate children to higher institutions of learning. He desires to expand business into new markets but competition and high rental costs hinder his business. Denis has asked for a loan to buy more machines and inverters for the salon.

loans.use: buy more machines and inverters for the salon.

loans.name: Maria Teodula

texts.es: María tiene 40 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 19 años de edad. María se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mas tres años y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. María desea reparar la sala de su vivienda la cual se encuentra deteriorada por causa del tiempo por lo que solicita esta crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro ya que desea poner material más resistente y seguro.
texts.en:
María, 40, lives in her own house with her daughter, 19.  She has worked as a housekeeper for more than three years to earn a living and support her household.

María wants to refurbish her living room, which has become worn over time.  She's asking FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, sand, bricks, and rebar because she wants to use more resistant, safer materials.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and rebar

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en: Caridad has been selling fish for many years while her husband fishes. She earns well from this. She has successfully repaid her previous loan which was used for purchasing fish to sell. Her earnings helped a lot to support her children's education. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC to purchase more fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions and pay for her children's tuition.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Rosario de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, desde hace varios años se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de refrescos su negocio lo tiene ubicado en las afueras de su casa, posee mucha clientela pues es un producto muy vendible, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir los gastos que se les presentan en su hogar, Doña Rosario esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de frutas, azúcar, hielo, bolsas, pajillas, etc. y así seguir con su trabajo y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposo.
texts.en: 58-year-old Rosario lives in her own house with her husband. For several years she has made a living by making and selling soft drinks. Her business is located outside her house and she has a lot of customers because her product is very sellable. She manages to cover her household expenses with what she obtains from her sales and with the help of her husband. Rosario is requesting a loan in order to purchase fruit, sugar, ice, bags, straws, and other products so she can continue with her work and have a better quality of life with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, sugar, ice, bags, straws, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of underwear

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO RENACER” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vanesa es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de mandiles, venta de zapatos, venta de DVD y helados, taller de soldados, tejido de prendas, venta de ropa, taller de tapicería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vanesa es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprenderá, con el crédito que sacará y con un pequeño capital que tiene guardado del trabajo anterior en el que apoyaba a sus tíos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cocina industrial) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Nuevo Renacer” (“New Rebirth”) will begin their fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II.  It has eight members and has a board of directors, of which Vanesa is Secretary. The members’ business activities are varied, including: sewing aprons, selling shoes, selling DVDs and ice-creams, a welding workshop, knitting garments, selling clothes, and an upholstery workshop.

The loan will be of benefit to the microbusinesses of the communal bank Vanesa is a member of. She says that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling food. She will launch the business with the loan she is taking out and with a small amount of capital she saved from previous work when she helped her uncles.

The loan she is taking out now is to increase her capital (purchasing an industrial stove), which she will acquire from distributors in the city of El Alto. After she makes the food she will sell it in her stall. This work enables her to generate income to support her family, since she is single.

When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial stove

loans.name: Kaduka

texts.en:
Kaduka is married woman with eight school-going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past four years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Elxan

texts.en: Elxan has been in the tailoring business for many years. He is 46 years old and not married. Elxan lives with his sister. His sister was divorced and has two children. Elxan support the needs of his sister and her children. Today Elxan wants to buy different materials for his business. He has applied for a loan of 1500 AZN. He is thankful to Kiva organization and the lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy different materials for his business.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en: Janice is single and operates a general store in her village to make a living. After ten years of running this business, she earns well enough to provide for her needs. With her micro-finance loan taken from GDMPC, she has bought more grocery goods for resale. In the future, Janice wants to see her business sustained and she wants to ensure a better source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Twekambe Kagere United Group

texts.en: John is a thirty-seven-year-old married man with four children who all go to school. They live in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a mechanic for fifteen years. Being a responsible man, he started to cater for his family's basic needs. Poor roads are the main challenge he faces in his vision to open his own garage. John intends to use this loan to buy spare parts to sell. He is a member of Twekambe Kagere United Group where each member guarantees the others in their loan.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as maize flour, wheat flour, milk, cooking oil, detergents, sweets and sugar to invest back into her business. She is grateful for the new support that she has received.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as maize flour, wheat flour, milk, cooking oil, detergents, sweets and sugar

loans.name: Gelyn

texts.en: To earn a living, Gelyn owns a farm that grows and harvests bananas. In many years of growing and harvesting bananas as well as other crops, she has earned some income to support her family. To enhance her farm, she is taking a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer. She hopes that someday, her farm will improve enough that it ensures her a better source of income.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is married with three children, two in school and one who is not yet old enough to go to school. They live at their own house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanaisha has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past three months. She sells from the market to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini greengrocer in the future.

With the loan of KES 15,000 she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a divorced woman with two school-going children. She owns a house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanakombo operates a food-making business, making things like meat and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, maize flour and meat for her business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, maize flour and meat for her business

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: Don Rafael es originario de la ciudad de Managua, casado y padre de dos hijos. Es de oficio vulcanizador, se dedica a la reparación de todo tipo de llantas. Se siente agradecido con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que logro comprar las herramientas necesarias para la realización de su trabajo. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Llantas nuevas y Neumáticos de varias numeraciones. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá mejorar sus servicios e incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Rafael, who comes from the city of Managua, is married with two children. He is a vulcaniser by trade and repairs all types of wheels. He is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito as they helped him to buy the tools he needs for his job.  He is applying for the loan to buy: new wheels and tyres of different grades. He believes that the loan will be very useful in enabling him to improve his services and boost his income.

loans.use: to buy new wheels and tyres of different grades.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: Don josé de 51 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura siembra maíz, sandia y pepino comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa, sus dos hijas y sus dos nietos, Don josé esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, semillas, etc. para seguir con sus cultivos y darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Don José is 51 years old. For several years, he has worked in agriculture, growing corn, watermelon and cucumbers. He sells them in nearby the area where he lives. With what he gets from his sales he is able to cover household expenses. He lives in his own house with his wife, his two daughters and his two grandsons. Don José is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pest control, seeds, etc. to continue with his crops and give his family everything they need without limits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pest control, seeds, etc.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 34 de edad, no estudio, pero aprendió a firmar por sus propios medios, es casado, su esposa se dedica a destazar reces y cerdos para negocio. Tienen 3 hijos; quienes ya son adultos y estan casados, el oficio de la crianza de ganado, lo aprendió por iniciativa propia y con el respaldo de su esposa. El negocio lo tienen en su casa  y lo apoya una hija. El horario es variado.

Con el préstamo comprará un toro, para que le pueda cargar las vacas. El préstamo le mejorará su negocio, ya que cuando tienen vacas produciendo leche, también la comercializan y eso prermite tener mejoo calidad de vida.

Su sueño es tener más vacas productivas de leche, para poder comercializar con los habitantes de la misma comunidad. Con respecto a su familia es de tener salud para seguir trabajando. Lo que espera para sus hijos es que progresen. El préstamo le ayudará para comprar lo que necesitan. Las ganancias de su negocio las utilizará para subsistir en el dia a dia y poder ir cancelando su crédito. Las aspiraciones es de tener más vacas productivas de leche y solo lo logrará con su esfuerzo y el apoyo de credicampo con los prestamos.
texts.en: José, who is 34, did not have a schooling but he taught himself to sign his name. He is married and his wife slaughters cows and pigs for the business. They have 3 children who are grown up and married. José taught himself his trade of breeding cattle and is supported by his wife. They run the business from their home with the help of one of their daughters. They have a varied schedule. He will use the loan to buy a bull to breed with the cows. The loan will help him to improve his business as, when they have cows producing milk, they can sell it and this helps to improve their quality of life. His ambition is to have more milk-producing cows so that he can sell it to members of the local community. As far as his family is concerned, he wants to be healthy so he can carry on working. He also wants to see his children get on in life. The loan will help him to buy what they need. He will use his earnings to cover day-to-day expenses and to pay of his debt.  He aims to have more milk-producing cows, but he will only be able to do this through his own efforts and the support of a credicampo loan.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Freddy Enrique

texts.es: El señor Freddy Casado padre de 3 hijos, todos asisten al celegio, su esposa trabaja como domestica en casa privada el por su parte es guarda de Seguridad, entre los dos lucha para sacar a su familia adelante, el credito lo solicita para la compra de materiales de cosntruccion como: arena, cemento, perlines ya que realizara una modificaciones en la vivienda, agradece le apoyo que Afodenic y fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en: Freddy Casado is the father of 3. They all go to school. His wife works as a maid in a private home. He is a security guard. Together the two of them fight to get their family ahead. He is asking for the loan to buy construction materials, such as sand, cement and beams, because he is going to make some changes on his house. He is grateful for the support and loans that Afodenic and Kiva have given him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Rosa Imelda

texts.es: Rosa de 66 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Rosa esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas productos por mayor como: granos básicos, azúcar, sopas, leche, golosinas, refrescos, etc. para poder seguir con sus ventas y darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en: 66-year-old Rosa lives with her family in her own home. She has been running a small shop (located in her home) for a number of years and has a wide clientele due to the variety of goods that she sells and her good prices. She uses her earnings to cover some of her household expenses. Rosa is seeking the loan to buy in bulk more products such as: basic grains, sugar, soups, milk, sweets, soft drinks, etc. This will enable her to continue running her shop and give her family everything they need.

loans.use: to buy in bulk good such as: basic grains, sugar, soups, milk, sweets, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
This is Mejumaa.  Her previous loan was a big help in her business.  She was able to purchase food ingredients for her food preparing business. 

She also practices tailoring.  She would like to apply for a loan of kES 50,000, to buy more stocks of household consumables such as maize flour, cooking oil, sugar for her business.

Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables such as maize flour, cooking oil, sugar for her business

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 53 year old married man with eight children who lives in Hoima-Uganda.  He earns additional income from brick laying.  He ventured into several businesses so as to have constant income to enable him to meet his family and personal needs.

Price fluctuation and inadequate capital affect his business as he desires to expand his business into new markets. Robert is requesting for a loan to buy general merchandise.

loans.use: he wants a loan to buy general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is the son of a fisherman who wants to improve his living situation in the future.  He studied in a university majoring in Marine Biology.  He has eight siblings, some of whom are still dependent on his parents.  Having a big family is his challenge to finish his course in order to gain a better job and he wants to help his siblings to provide a better education in the future.  

He works as an electrical installer and ornamental fishe dealer.  He borrowed a loan to pay his school tuition fees. He is thankful to GDMPC for being a part of his ambition.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fees

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a 38 year old married woman.  She has 3 children.  She describes herself to be determined.  She operates a retail business where she sells groceries and also keeps livestock for sale.  She has been involved in this business for 7 years.  Her business is located in a good area. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.  She will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lamp for lighting her house.  Her business goal is to have a stable business within 5 years.  She hopes that in the future,she will expand.  This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a solar lamp for lighting her house

loans.name: Santos Maria

texts.es: Doña Santos, tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Tiene 20 años de dedicarse al negocio, ella elabora y vende tamales de carne de pollo y cerdo. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y vende por encargos. Ha solicitado el tercer ciclo que es por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar insumos como carnes, hojas, harina de maíz, condimentos arroz papas, manteca y otros para elaborar los tamales y vender y con otra parte del préstamo va comprar algunos materiales para hacer arreglos a su vivienda para tener mas espacio para su negocio y brindar mejor servicio.
texts.en: Santos, who is 57 and the single mother of two children, lives in the town of Choloma in the Cortes department. She has been running her business making and selling chicken and pork tamales for 20 years. She runs the business from her home and sells her products on demand. She has applied for 20,000 lempiras in this third loan cycle to buy supplies for making and selling tamales, such as meat, leaves, corn flour, condiments, rice, potatoes, lard and other things. She will use another portion of the loan to buy some materials to repair her home so she can have more room for her business and, as a result, offer better service.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as corn flour, meat, lard, rice, potatoes, condiments etc to make tamales and also to buy some materials to repair her home.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a widowed woman with three children who are adults.  They live in their own house that has no electricity but has piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Florence has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past three years.  She sells from her home to her neighbors.  She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.  With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Gouwend Manegre Group

texts.fr:
Mme CHRISTINE est responsable du groupe GOUWEND MANEGRE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 22ans  et le moins  âgé de03ans. 01  va  à l’école.  Elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme est dolotière  depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Zorgho. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
 Mme veut s’acheter 03sacs de mil germé pour la préparation du dolo (bière de mil). 
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Ambitionne agrandir son activité  et améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en: Mrs CHRISTINE is responsible for the GOUWEND MANEGRE group. She is married and the mother of six children aged between 22 and 3 years old, one of whom attends school. She is currently responsible for four persons. For the past 5 years, she has been making and selling dolo, a type of beer made from millet. She stocks up on products at Zorgho, and sells to both men and women. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase three bags of sprouted millet in order to prepare dolo. She plans to reinvest any profits in her activity, and hopes to increase her activity level as well as her living conditions.

loans.use: purchase three bags of sprouted millet for the preparation of dolo (beer made from millet)

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
Don Arístides es un señor de 53 años que habita en el municipio de El Jicaral al norte del departamento de León, casado, padre de dos hijos en edad escolar.
A la edad de 19 años inició a laborar como maestro de primaria en una escuela de una comarca aledaña para mantener a su familia la cual procreó bien joven.
Desde entonces gracias a esta actividad le ha permitido construir su propia casa y formar académicamente a sus hijos.
Don Aristides además de ser maestro, en sus tiempos libres se dedica también a la agricultura, ya que cuenta con una propiedad que le heredaron sus padres en las cuales cosecha granos.
El profesor Arístides se dio cuenta que en Ceprodel financian créditos con fondos de unos inversionistas del extranjero llamados Kiva los cuales apoyan al más necesitado y en este momento él necesita un crédito para cubrir gastos médicos como comprar medicamentos con el fin de mejorar su salud.
Espera y confía en Dios que estas personas aprueben su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Aristides is 53 years old and lives in the municipality of El Jicaral, in the north of the León department. Aristides is married and a father to two school-aged children.

At 19 years old Aristides started working a primary teacher in a nearby area. He did this to support his family, whom he had at a very young age.

Since then, this work has allowed Aristides to build his own house and to educate his children.

In addition to working as a teacher, Aristides spends his free time working in farming. He has property that he inherited from his parents and, on this land, he grows grains.

Arístides realised that "Ceprodel" provides loans funded by foreign investors through Kiva. These loans support the most needy people and Aristides needs a loan to cover medical expenses (to buy medicines) so that he can improve his health.

Aristides hopes and trusts in God that these people will approve his loan and support him.

loans.use: to buy medication.

loans.name: Adoté

texts.fr: Adoté est vendeur d'appareils électroniques un certain temps. Il habite à Lomé avec sa femme et ses enfants. La femme de Adoté est couturière. Suite à un ralentissement récent de son activité il désir réinvestir pour devenir un vendeur plus important, voire un grossiste. Dans ce but il sollicite un crédit auprès de WAGES. Il compte utiliser les profits qu'il réalisera en les réinvestissant dans son activité. Sa priorité est de gagner un revenu suffisant pour garantir la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Adoté has been selling electronic equipment for a number of years. He lives in Lomé with his wife and children. His wife is a seamstress. Due to a recent decline in his business activity, he would like to invest more in order to become a more active salesman, and potentially a wholesale supplier. In order to achieve this, he is asking for a loan from WAGES. He plans to reinvest all profits into the business. His priority is to earn sufficient income in order to provide an education for his children.

loans.use: purchase electronic equiment

loans.name: Umoja Kibabi B Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Margeurite est une brave commerçante, dynamique, entrepreneur depuis 24 ans est membre d’un groupe d’Affaires « Umoja Kibabi B», âgée de 44 ans et mère de 6 enfants, dont 4 étudient et 2 sont encore gosses. Elle est propriétaire d’un restaurant. Elle installe ses activités dans une maison du marché central  de la place. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 50kg de pommes de terre, huiles, oignons, piments, sel, etc. Elle bénéficia son premier capital par le truchement de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle, pendant, ce moment de conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Margeurite is a courageous and dynamic entrepreneurial business woman, and has been a member of the business group Umoja Kibabi B for the past 24 years. She is 44 years old and the mother of 6 children, 4 of whom attend school and 2 of whom are still very young. She is the owner of a restaurant, and sells food in a stall in the central market. She is asking for a loan from Hekima in order to increase her activity level. She will use this loan to purchase 50 kilos of potatoes, oils, onions, spices, salt, etc. She began the business with money provided by her husband. In the future, she hopes to increase he working capital, and continue to feed her children and send them to school. She is grateful to Hekima for the support their povide unbankable female entrepreneurs, by providing them loans without the need for physical collateral, in particular during this politically unstable time in the eastern region of the country.

loans.use: purchase 50 kilos of potatoes, oil, spices, salt, etc.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman; she has two children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest  monthly expenses are food and school fees .

Patricia operates a maize selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of maize to sell.

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize to sell

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards, and she appreciates Kiva lenders for supporting her financially.

She also sells coconuts in her food stall. 

She is requesting a loan of ksh.30,000 to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell.

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business, and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell

loans.name: Lozi

texts.en:
Lozi appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.  She thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support.

She is requesting a loan of ksh.50,000 to purchase coconuts, wheat flour, rice, cooking oil, and maize flour for her business. 

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts, wheat flour, rice, cooking oil, and maize flour for her business.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
This is Mwanamisi. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to pay school fees for her grandchild, and she thanks Kiva lenders for supporting her financially.

Besides the retail shop business, Mwanamisi sells second hand clothes.

She would like to apply for a loan of ksh.30,000 to increase her stock of second hand clothes, and use the rest of the money for her medical expenses.

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart

loans.use: to buy more stock of second hand clothes, and use the rest of the money for her medical expenses.

loans.name: Mwanapazia

texts.en:
This is Mwanapazia. Her previous loan was a big help in her business; she was able to buy more shop items. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for a loan of 30,000 Kshs to increase her stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. 

The more items displayed at the store, the better.  More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Las Malvinas Group

texts.es: Avelinda de 43 años de edad es separada con 4 hijos independientes. La Alcancía Comunal “Las Malvinas” está formado por 09 socios entusiastas y emprendedores. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas, gracias a su perseverancia su negocio le va muy bien y ha mejorado su calidad de vida. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de frutas como plátanos, naranjas y mandarinas. El grupo “Las Malvinas” agradecen a todas las personas que facilitaron este crédito. Avelinda es la cuarta a lado posterior derecho viste blusa celeste lleva puesto una bolsa crema.
texts.en: Avelinda, who is 43 years old, is separated and has four independent children. The communal bank "Las Malvinas" is made up of 9 enthusiastic and enterprising members. Avelinda makes a living selling fruit. Due to her perseverance her business is going well and her quality of life has improved. She requested this loan in order to buy fruit such as bananas, oranges and mandarins. The group "Las Malvinas" is grateful to all the people who made this loan possible. In the photo, Avelinda is the fourth at the back, wearing a sky blue top and who is carrying a cream coloured bag.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as bananas, oranges and mandarins.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 31, is a hardworking lady in Hoima, Uganda. A government worker, she used a little savings to open a veterinary drug shop to earn extra income to improve her total welfare, only to be affected by the high license fees levied on her business. 

Josephine is requesting a loan to buy veterinary drugs to sell. Her dream is to build a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy veterinary drugs to sell.

loans.name: Reygelyn

texts.en:
Reygelyn is studying Information Technology at a university, and wants to improve her family's living situation in the future.

She is determined to finish her course in order to gain a better job, and wants to help her parents when they get old.
 
She had joined GDMPC and had borrowed a loan to pay her tuition fees. 

She is thankful enough to GDMPC for being a part of her journey.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is married and has four children, all of whom go to school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Dzame has operated a coconut selling business for the past six years, selling from home to her neighbours and passerby. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two sacks of coconuts to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma appreciates Kiva for supporting her financially. She has greatly improved her sheep selling business, and even started selling coconuts from the profits she got.

She is requesting a loan of ksh.15,000 to pay school fees for her child and purchase sacks of coconuts to sell.

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child and purchase sacks of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 34-year-old hardworking woman living in Hoima, Uganda. She has a restaurant business which she started six years ago to improve on her standards of living and support her family. 

Her dream is to expand her business to greater heights, and to start offering outside catering services in town, though she is challenged by competition and inadequate capital.

 Florence intends to use the loan to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Los Tillales  (24 De Mayo) Group

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Los Tillales, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
Este es un grupo formado por 9 mujeres y 2 hombres que tiempo atrás decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos han podido mejorar sus negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, agricultura y cría de animales.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Geoconda, tiene 35 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual 3 tres hijos  de 16, 14 y 7 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y la menor en escuela. Su marido es agricultor. 
Doña Geoconda es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado ganar lo suyo y a su vez contribuir para solventar los gastos del hogar ya que su marido no gana mucho en sus faenas en el campo, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres desde hace 20 años, la misma que con los créditos ha ido mejorando y surtiendo cada día más, ella trabaja todos los días y a toda hora ya que es un  negocio que lo tiene en su casa razón por lo cual no le incomoda atender a sus clientes a cualquier hora.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda. Esta desde el inicio  en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos para mejorar su negocio y su vida. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Los Tillales" group meet in the neighbourhood of the 24 de Mayo. This area is renown for its beautiful landscapes and its hard working people, dedicated to farming and raising animals.

This group consists of nine women and two men who decided to unite and form this group a while ago. It has helped them a lot as with the loans they have been able to improve their businesses. They make a living in various activities, such as business, farming and raising animals.

One of the members of this group is Geoconda, who is 35 years old, and lives in a common law marriage from which she has three children, aged 16, 14 and 7. The oldest two children study at college and the younger one at school. Her husband is a farmer.

Geoconda is a woman who has always enjoyed earning her own sustenance and at the same time contribute to paying the household bills, as her husband doesn't earn much from his labouring in the fields. She has run a small grocery store for the past 20 years. This same grocery store is the one she has been improving and stocking thanks to the loans. She works every day and at all hours as it is a business which she runs from her house and she doesn't mind serving customers at any time of the day,

This loan is to buy supplies to stock her store. She has been in this group since its beginnings and she likes it due to the help she receives with the loans in order to improve her business and her life. Her dreams are to get ahead and extend her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for their grocery store.

loans.name: Mariga

texts.en:
Mariga is married and has six children, all of whom go to school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Mariga has operated a coconut selling business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbours and passerby. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two sacks of coconuts to sell, and for transportation costs. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of coconuts to sell, and for transportation costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, blocks and zinc sheets.

loans.name: Marina Lissette

texts.es: Marina de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee desde hace varios años una pequeña farmacia ubicada en su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa, los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Marina esta solicitando un préstamo a INTEGRAL para la compra de mas medicamentos por mayor como: alcohol, jarabes, pastillas, algodón, inyecciones, etc. para seguir con su negocio que le genera buenas ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marina, age 31, lives in her own home with her husband and child. She has been managing a small pharmacy in her house for several years. Marina has many customers because of the variety of products that she sells, the good prices, and the friendliness she provides at the time of sale.

With the income she earns from her business, Marina is able to help her husband with some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy more medicines and supplies in bulk such as alcohol, syrups, pills, cotton, injections, and other products so that she can continue her business. This will enable her to generate good earnings and provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more medicines and supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina vive en la ciudad de Huancarani al sur de la Ciudad del Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades personales, económicas y familiares. Su actividad economica es la venta comida y con la agricultura. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo fideos, azúcar, verduras, carne, arroz, aceite y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Alejandrina lives in the city of Huancarani, which is south of the city of Cusco. It is in this place that she conducts her personal, business, and family activities. Her business activities involve selling food and farming. She has been in this line of work for many years and is doing well thanks to her efforts.

Alejandrina is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy more basic necessity products such as noodles, sugar, vegetables, meat, rice, oil, and other items.

loans.use: to buy noodles, sugar, vegetables, meat, rice, oil, and other items.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Doña Martha es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, casada y madre de cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya independientes. Tiene 49 años de edad. Es de oficio tortillera, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su negocio hace varios años con un puesto de venta de tortillas y poco a poco con el dinero obtenido logro establecer una pequeña pulpería que funciona hasta el día de hoy. Su meta próxima es ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en una tienda general. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Arroz, Frijoles, Azúcar, Aceite, Café, Papel higiénico entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda porque podrá abastecer la demanda de sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Martha is originally from the city of Esteli. She is married and mother to four children, three of whom are now independent. She is 49 years old. She makes a living selling tortillas and running a store. She started her business various years ago with a tortilla stall and slowly with her profits she managed to set up a small store which continues running up to this day.

Her next goal is to extend her business and convert it into a general store. She is requesting this loan in order to buy; rice, beans, sugar, oil, coffee, toilet paper, amongst other items. She thinks that this loan will help her greatly as she will be able to supply the demand of her customers and obtain greater profits. Her future plan is to improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, coffee, toilet paper, among other items.

loans.name: Albertina Isabel

texts.es: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 30 años de edad. Tiene 5 años como enfermera; su esposo no tiene empleo formal. Este segundo crédito que solicita a Pana Pana, es para comprar materiales de construcción para apoyar en la mejora de vivienda a su mamá donde viven en hacinamiento 10 miembros de la familia. Su sueño es acondicionar la casa de su mamá, comprarle electrodomésticos básicos para su vivienda,  continuar apoyando a su familia, especialmente a su papá que se encuentra muy delicado de salud.
texts.en: Albertina is originally from Puerto Cabezas and is 30 years old. She has been working as a nurse for five years. Her husband does not have an official job. This is Albertina's second loan from Pana Pana. She will use it to buy building materials with which to make improvements to her mother's house. There, ten members of the family live in overcrowding. Albertina's dream is to fit out her mother's house and buy her electrical appliances. Albertina wants to continue supporting her family, particularly her father who has health problems.

loans.use: to buy building materials to help improve her mother's home (where ten members of the family live together in a crowded space).

loans.name: Maria Lesly

texts.es: María, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera, vive donde un tío y hermano en el municipio de Puerto, Cortes. Ella se dedicaba a estudiar y hace 5 años decidió tener su propio negocio, vende ropa nueva como ser: blusas, calcetas, jeans, camisetas, vestidos y ropa interior. El negocio lo tiene en el mercado local. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de ropa nueva como blusas, camisas, ropa interior y pantalones para mantener surtido y vender mas. Su plan es poder incrementar las ventas y los ingresos.
texts.en:
María is 23 years old. She is single and lives with her uncle and brother in the municipality of Puerto Cortes. She used to study and five years ago she decided to have her own business. She sells new clothes such as; blouses, socks, jeans, T-shirts, dresses and underwear. She runs her business in the local market. 

She is requesting a loan for 10,000 HNL in order to invest in buying new clothes such as blouses, shirts, underwear and trousers in order to have a good stock and sell more. Her plan is to be able to increase sales and her income.

loans.use: to buy new clothes such as blouses, shirts, underwear and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en: Rafik was born in 1962. He is married with two children. One of them is in the first year of medical college. Another is going to eleventh class and preparing for University. They are living in Baku region. Rafik is involved in a taxi driving business. Today he wants to repair the car’s motor, and for this reason Rafik has applied to the Komak company. He needs 800 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). Rafik says he is very thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for their help.

loans.use: to repair the car’s motor

loans.name: Rozi

texts.en: Rozi is 43 years old, married, and has 10 children. She used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children. For 23 years, she has been selling clothes. She farms for additional income. She is determined to educate her children up to university so as they become independent. Rozi has requested another loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan of KES 15,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el Caserío de Vista Alegre una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café y de esta manera tener una producción adecuada para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Segundo is 33 years old.  He lives with his wife and their children in the village of Vista Alegre, a rural area in Callayuc, which is a community known for its green landscapes, and its people who work in agriculture, commerce and livestock.  This area is located in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern sierra.  

For the past 10 years, Segundo has worked in agriculture, particularly growing coffee, and he has a lot of experience in the field.  He is seeking a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase fertilizers to care for his coffee crops.  This will allow him to have an adequate crop to offer his customers.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, beans, maize flour, and sugar, and to pay school fees. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, beans, maize flour, and sugar, and to pay school fees

loans.name: Kihika

texts.en: Kihika, 42, is a Ugandan married woman living in Kagadi and she is the mother of 7 children. She operates a produce store, a business she started in 2000 because she feels the business is easy to manage. She also has a passion for agriculture, which helps her to earn an extra income. She hopes to buy a vehicle and educate her children. Kihika describes herself as a hardworking lady but her challenge is poor roads. She has asked for  a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a 55-year-old married man with seven children who owns a house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He was in agriculture for many years, and then he started buying and selling coffee. Now he also processes coffee for sale. His hardship is that the business is seasonal and there are price changes. His vision is business growth plus educating his children. Wilson needs the loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to  sell.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan of KES 15,000 to buy more stock of food ingredients, such as onions, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar, for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food ingredients such as onions, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar for her business

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en: Riziki appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan of KES 25,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has eight children, six of whom go to school and two of whom are adults. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanamisi has operated a coconut selling business for the past four years, selling from home to her neighbours and passerby. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase 2 sacks of coconuts for resale and transport them to her place of operation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of coconuts  for resale and transport them to her place of operation.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the Coastal Region of Kenya.

Nyamvula operates a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the 10,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Kache wants to purchase a water tank for her water storage at home.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase a water tank.  She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
This is Tatu. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more books in her bookshop. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. She thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support. 

She would like to apply for a loan of 25,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more stock of books for resale. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of books for resale

loans.name: Obed

texts.en: Obed is a 28-year-old married man with two children who owns a produce store in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has also dealt in agriculture for the past four years and now he started buying and selling produce alongside processing  maize for sale.  His hardship is that the business is seasonal. His vision is to become a market leader of produce plus owning a modern food store that caters to the increased demand. Obed needs the loan to buy produce for processing to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce for processing to sell.

loans.name: Delmer

texts.es:
Delmer tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Colasay, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, que se caracteriza por con sus paisajes verdes ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de cafeto, tiene una parcela donde tiene sembrado su cultivo, es un joven emprendedor que ha solicitado un préstamo en Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos y pago de mano de obra por el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Delmer is 26 years old. He lives with his parents in the Colasay district, a farming, business, and ranching community characterized by its green landscapes that is located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He works in farming, especially in the cultivation of coffee trees. He has a parcel where he has his crops planted. He is a young entrepreneur who has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 4,000 nuevos soles in order to buy manure and pay for labor to maintain his coffee crops and in this way have an appropriate product to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy manure and pay labor for his coffee crops

loans.name: Bujubuli Abango Clan Development Group

texts.en: Patrick is a 48-year-old man married with 4 children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been operating a commercial agriculture business for 4 years. He obtains additional income from retail trade. Patrick started his business to get more income to provide for basic wants. He is faced with a problem of overdependence on elements of weather, which are hard to predict these days, and his dream is to expand his farm plantation to a large estate. Patrick is requesting a loan to buy farm inputs. As a member of Bujubuli Abango Clan Development Group, each member guarantees the others in order to get a loan.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Meselemani

texts.en:
The desire to have a prosperous life is one of Meselemani's dreams. She always struggles to achieve success. She is a very dedicated woman who has been operating a tailoring business that made profits that enabled her open a food kiosk.

She wants to make improvements to her food kiosk business so that she can have reasonable sales. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase biscuits, milk, sweets and pens for her business. She looks forward to the financial support with gladness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, milk, sweets and pens for her business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman with five children; one attends school, and the rest are adults. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 12 years, she has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan of  50,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to purchase more goats.

loans.use: to purchase more goats.

loans.name: Mwari

texts.en:
Mwari is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past 10 years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Castinaldo

texts.es:
Castinaldo tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío La Mina una zona rural del distrito de Querocotillo, una comunidad con relieve accidentado lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, su población también se dedica a la ganadería y comercio, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El junto a su familia se dedican a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz amarillo desde hace diez años, también se dedican a la crianza de ganado vacuno lechero ofertando la leche en su domicilio a vecinos y de más clientes.

Castinaldo ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono para su cultivo de maíz y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes una producción oportuna a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Castinaldo is 42 years old.  He lives with his wife and their children in the village of La Mina, a rural area in Querocotillo, which is a hilly community that has developed through its agriculture.  In addition to agriculture, the region's population also works in raising cattle and commerce.  La Mina is located in the Cutervo province, which is in the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern sierra.

Castinaldo and his family, work in agriculture, particularly, growing yellow corn, which he has been doing for the past 10 years.  He also works raising dairy cattle to offer milk in his home, to his neighbors, and to other customers.  

Castinaldo is seeking a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase fertilizers to grow corn.  This will allow him to offer his customers a good crop at a better price.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers to grow corn.

loans.name: Kelbin

texts.es:
Kelbin tiene 22 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cañaris una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Ferreñafe que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café desde hace 5 años, junto a su familia se ha esforzado en la labor que realiza, Kelbin ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para el pago de mano de obra a jornaleros que dan mantenimiento a su cultivo de cafe y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Kelbin is 22 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the Cañaris district, a farming, business, and ranching community located in the province of Ferreñafe in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

He has worked in farming, especially coffee cultivation, for 5 years. Together with his family, he has worked hard at what he does. Kelbin has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles in order to pay day laborers who maintain his coffee crop and in this way produce a greater income for his family.

loans.use: to pay day laborers

loans.name: Adriano

texts.es:
Adriano tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Mangaypa una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.
