El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de cafeto y frutales que los comercializa en el mercado de su distrito desde hace 8 años, son una familia emprendedora que se ha esforzado en la labor que realizan, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una cosecha oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Adriano is 26 years old. He lives with his wife and children in Caserío de Mangaypa, a rural area of Pomahuaca district, a farming, business, and ranching community located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He works in farming, especially in the cultivation of coffee and fruit trees, which he has sold in his district's market for 8 years. They are an entrepreneurial family that has worked hard at what they do. He has requested a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy manure for his coffee crop and in this way have an appropriate harvest to offer his customers, producing a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure for his coffee crop

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomás tiene 57 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el caserío Las Palmillas una zona rural del distrito de Cañaris, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Ferreñafe que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de arroz, junto a su familia se esfuerzan en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para el pago de mano de obra de jornaleros que dan mantenimiento a sus cultivos de arroz y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
57-year-old Tomás lives with his wife in the village of Las Palmillas, a rural area in the district of Cañaris. This is situated in the Ferreñafe province of Lambayeque region on Peru's north coast. The people of his village work in agriculture, trade and cattle-rearing.
Tomás and his family work tremendously hard in agriculture, growing rice in particular. He has sought a loan of 2,500 nuevos soles to pay daily workers who maintain his rice crops and this will enable him to increase his income and benefit his family.

loans.use: to pay daily workers.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Apolinaria is 49 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Apolinaria has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Apolinaria requested a 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Apolinaria has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Apolinaria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 33 years old, married, and has three children. He owns a motorcycle transport business in Kyenjojo, Uganda, which he has been doing for eight years. He started with capital saved from riding for others and now has his own motorcycle (pictured above). 

Christopher requested a loan, which he will use to buy another motorcycle. He experiences hardship due to competition for clients and poor roads. In the future, he hopes to buy more motorcycles and land.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with seven children, two of whom attend school and the rest are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma runs a fruit and vegetable stall, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.
 
With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is married woman with two children who are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past three years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over three years, she has operated a business of a fruits-and-vegetables stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Anzazi

texts.en:
Anzazi is married and has nine children, all of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a fish selling business for the last two years, selling at her business place to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business. She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business

loans.name: Jose Alvaro

texts.es:
José Álvaro tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que se caracteriza por tener grandes depósitos de arena y ripio que la población utiliza para la construcción de sus viviendas, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros por las zonas aledañas a su distrito y de esta manera genera ingresos para su familia.

José ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternitva un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra repuestos para mejorar su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando este servicio.
texts.en:
José Álvaro is 28 years old, and he lives with his wife and children in the district of Cayaltí.  It is a community characterized by having large deposits of sand and gravel, which the people use for the construction of their homes. It is located within the Chiclayo Province which belongs to the region of Lambayeque on Peru’s northern coast.

He provides public transport service in his own motorcycle taxi, carrying his passengers throughout the areas adjoining his district; and in this way, he generates income for his family.

José has requested a loan of 1,500 Nuevos Soles for the purchase of spare parts, in order to improve his vehicle, and continue providing this service.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Jan Manuel

texts.es:
Jan Manuel tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Lagunas una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al comercio venta de alfalfa, chileno y otros desde hace tres años, también presta servicios como fumigador y jornalero agrícola en las fincas de sus vecinos y moradores de su distrito, es un padre emprendedor ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para arreglar el techo de su vivienda y tarrajeo de las paredes de la misa y de esta manera tener un hogar seguro para residir.
texts.en:
Jan Manuel is 29 years old.  He lives with his wife and their children in the district of Lagunas, a community that is dedicated to agriculture, commerce and raising cattle.  It is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.  

He works in commerce, selling alfalfa, peppers, and other products, which he has done for the past three years.  He also offers his services as an exterminator and an agricultural day laborer on the farms of his neighbors and other residents of the community.

He is an entrepreneurial father who is seeking a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to repair the roof of his home and plaster the walls.  This will allow him to have a secure home in which to live.

loans.use: pay for repairs to his home and to plaster walls.

loans.name: Gilmer

texts.es:
Gilmer tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad con grandes depósitos de piedra y ripio que la población utiliza para la construcción de sus viviendas, también se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio como maestro de construcción desde hace más de 20 años, cuenta con personal a su cargo en cada trabajo realizado, es conocido por la labor que realiza dentro de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de un “trompo”, herramienta que lo podrá utilizar como un servicio adicional a si trabajo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
41-year-old Gilmer lives with his wife and children in Cayaltí which is in Chiclayo province in the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru. His town has large stores of stone and rubble which the inhabitants use to build their homes.  They also work in agriculture, trade and cattle-rearing.
He has been offering his services as a master builder for over 20 years and has employees who work with him on each job. He is well-known around his district for the work which he does. He has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to buy a cement mixer which he can use to offer an additional service and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is married with five children. Four children are in school and one is too young to go to school yet. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past three years, Kwekwe has practiced farming and growing various crops such as tomatoes and other vegetables. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business. With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase seeds and pesticide and to hire a tractor to plow her farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and pesticide and to hire a tractor to plow her farm

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
Asunción tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío Chilasque una zona rural del distrito de Cañaris, es una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Ferreñafe en la Región Cajamarca, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café desde hace diez años, su esposa le apoya en las labores de cosecha haciendo el pago a los jornaleros, brindándoles alimentación, son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realizan, Asunción ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Asunción is 55 years old.  He lives with his wife and their children in the Chilasque village of the rural Cañaris district.  This community is dedicated to agriculture, commerce, and raising cattle.  It is located in the Ferreñafe province in the Cajamarca region on Peru's northern coast.

He works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee.  He has worked in this field for 10 years, and his wife helps him with working the crops, paying laborers, and bringing food.  They are a close family that puts a lot of effort into the work that they do.  

Asunción has requested a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to purchase fertilizers for his coffee crops.  This will allow him to have a good production to offer his customers, which will increase his earnings for his family.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers to grow coffee.

loans.name: Norma Marina

texts.es:
Norma Marina tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad ubicada sobre el valle de Zaña donde se puede apreciar grandes cantidades de piedras y ripio que se utiliza en la construcción de viviendas, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores en la parte posterior a su domicilio, cuenta con clientes en le mercado de su distrito así como también en los alrededores de su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Norma Marina is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the Cayalti district, a community located in the Zaña valley where large quantities of rocks and gravel can be seen that are used in the construction of houses. Its population works in agriculture, business, and ranching. It is located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

She raises and sells small animals behind her house. She has customers in her district's market as well as in the area surrounding her community. She has requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles in order to buy feed to fatten her animals and in this way produce a greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten animals

loans.name: Cruz Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío Las Naranjas, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café, arroz y frutarles, comercio y ganadería ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a los cultivos de piña, café, maíz y pan llevar desde hace diez años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro, son una familia emprendedora, Elmer ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos y pago de mano de obra para sus cultivos y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Elmer is 48 years old.  He lives with his wife and their children in the Las Naranjas village.  It is a rural area in the Pucará district, which is a community that is dedicated to agriculture, particularly growing coffee, rice and fruit, as well as commerce and raising cattle.  Pucará is in the province of Jaén that is located in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern sierra.  

He works in agriculture, specifically, crowing pineapple, coffee, corn, and other basic goods.  He has 10 years worth of experience in this field.  They are an entrepreneurial family.

Elmer has requested a loan of 3,500 nuevos soles to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor for his crops.  This will allow him to have a good output to offer to his clients, and increase his earnings for his family

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and pay for labor for his crops.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a thirty-four–year-old married man with 5 children, and he lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

He has been a mechanic for 7 years and repairs motor cycles, bicycles and cars. It is through this business that he obtained the capital for his salon business, which he started in order to supplement the income from his garage. 

John’s challenge is limited capital to buy equipment which would help him work on his customers quickly, and to buy land to build on. He is therefore  requesting a loan to buy salon equipment, and land.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment, and land

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and reselling vitamins and medicines in the Philippines. Carmen has been in this business for three years.

She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more boxes of vitamins and medicines to sell.

Carmen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of vitamins and medicines to sell

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school whilst the rest are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is married and has seven children. All of the children go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a fish selling business for the last four years. Mariamu sells at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to acquire financial services for her business. With the 25,000 KES, she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  San Miguel está en  el 4° ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante .Se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que en la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza que han hecho, todas están por debajo de los indicadores mínimo, por lo que todas están esforzándose por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Perla, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace, y con lo cual ayuda a su familia. Comenta que sigue estudiando para poder perfeccionarse y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo e ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora y que lucha.
La Sra. Perla solicita este préstamo para la compra de utensilios  e insumos  lo que le ayudará  a  mejorar la calidad de su trabajo, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: The San Miguel group is in the 4th cycle of the programme run by the women's communal bank, where they all work and help each other to get by. They live below the poverty line, that is to say that in the eliminating poverty survey which they took part in, they were all below the minimum threshold. Consequently, they are all doing their utmost to improve. One of the groups' members is Perla, who prepares and sells food as a means of helping her family. She says that she is always studying to improve her skills so she can continue to grow and improve her living conditions. She is a very enterprising and determined person. Perla is applying for this loan to buy utensils and supplies which will help her to improve her quality of life and boost her income.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and supplies for preparing food.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 59 years old and widowed with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Corazon has a computer gaming station business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 15 years.

She requested an 11,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy an additional computer unit for her business.

In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional unit of computer for her business

loans.name: Crismelen

texts.en:
Crismelen is 27 years old and married with one child who attends school. She works very hard to provide for the family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for four years. She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, and candies. 

Crismelen requested a 13,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional groceries to sell like snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, and candies. 

Crismelen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell like snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, and candies.

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi is a 35-year-old, hard-working, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in motorcycle (boda boda) transportation as his main source of income, although he earns an extra income from agriculture. He started this business in order to educate his children and to sustain his family. He faces a challenge of so many accidents that occur, due to the bad roads, and climatic changes that affect his crops. He hopes to become a prominent businessman.

Levi is requesting a loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Sappilakhon

texts.ru: Саппилахон 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Саппилахон - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Саппилахон занимается полеводством, стартовав 25 лет назад, с 4,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Саппилахон, на сегодняшний день имеется: 0,48 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает овощи, кукурузу, хлопок для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Саппилахон обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку семян хлопка, семян овощей для посевных работ и удобрений для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Саппилахон планирует вложить в ремонт дома.
texts.en: Sappilakhon is 46, married, and has three children. She has a high school education and earns her family's main income through farming, which she began 25 years ago with 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Sappilakhon now has 0.48 hectares of land where she plants vegetables, corn, and cotton for personal use and sales. She earns 14,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue expanding her farm, Sappilakhon applied for a loan with Bai-Tushum and Partners to buy cotton and vegetable seeds and fertilizer. She plans to use the profits to repair her home.

loans.use: to buy cotton and vegetable seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past ten years, Mwanasha has operated a food-preparing business, making various foods, such as rice and chapati (flat bread), selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. 

Mwanasha wants to purchase a water tank for water storage. She is requesting for a loan KES 15,000 to purchase a water tank. She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Max

texts.en:
Max has been selling fish in the market for 20 years earning well for the family.  He also fishes. 

Max requested a loan from GDMPC, which he will use to buy more fish to sell. In the future, he wants to own more stalls in the market in town to sell more volumes of fish . He hopes to improve the general living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 31 years old, single, and has one child. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda, where he raises cattle. He started this business to increase his income and look after himself.  

Ronald is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy more cattle for his farm. He has hardships of competition and theft of his cows. He hopes to increase the size of his farm.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for his farm.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

She has been in this business for 47 years now.

Elvira would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a married woman with one child who goes to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Zainabu operates a food making business, making consumables like beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase food items like wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and of establishing a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items like wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman and has four children, with three in school and one under school age. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the last thirteen years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business. She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for her business

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Eme

texts.en:
Eme is fifty-four years old and widowed with six children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Eme is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eme has been in pig fattening for twenty years. She earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Fe requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Fe has been in this business for 49 years now.

In the future, Fe would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Josias

texts.es:
Josías tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío de Piquijaca una zona rural del distrito de San Felipe una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, siendo el principal cultivo la lima, tiene sembrado aproximadamente 1 ha de finca frutera, dedicándose a este rubro desde hace 10 años, sus cosechas son de manera mensual y los comercializa a los moradores de sus distrito quienes son los encargados de comercializarlo en los mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Josías ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de abono para su cultivo de lima y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Josías, 32, lives with his wife and children in the hamlet of Piquijaca, a rural area of San Felipe, located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru.  The residents work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Josías has worked in agriculture for 10 years, mainly growing limes.  He plants approximately one hectare of fruit on his farm.  He harvests monthly and sells to area residents who then sell the fruit in markets in the city of Chiclayo.

Josías has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,500 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy soil amendments for his lime crop.  That way he'll have a good harvest to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments for his lime crop

loans.name: Bunazira

texts.ru: Буназире 50 лет, не замужем. У Буназиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Буназира занимается животноводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Буназиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 9 дойных коров, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,33 ГА, на которой выращивает картофель, кукурузу, хлопок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Буназира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Буназира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на покупку автомашины.
texts.en: Bunazira is 50 years old, unmarried, and has a high school education. She earns her income through animal husbandry, which she began 30 years ago when she bought cattle for 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, she now has 9 dairy cows and a 0.33 hectare plot of land for planting potatoes, corn, and cotton. She earns 10,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand her farm, Bunazira applied for a loan with Bai-Tushum and Partners to buy cattle to fatten and resell. She plans to use the profits to invest in more livestock and to save up for a car.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Rocha

texts.en:
Rocha is a married man who is very hard-working and responsible. He has seven children, all of whom go to school. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past year, Rocha has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) and a retail shop business. His potential customers are town-dwellers. He cites the high cost of maintenance as his major challenge. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, Rocha wants to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle and household consumables for his shop. He joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle and household consumables for his shop.

loans.name: Larina

texts.en:
Larina is a 48-year-old married woman with four children (one is in school). She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Larina has a general store business in the Philippines and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Larina has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Larina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Visitacion has been in this business for 25 years now. Visitacion requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Visitacion would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Appolo

texts.en:
Appollo used the previous loan to buy more computers to open an internet cafe.

He has built a house and needs funds to finish it. As a hardworking man, he manages to look after his family's demands.  His dream is to construct rentals but he has limited capital. 

Appollo requests a loan to buy doors, windows and plaster his house.

loans.use: to buy doors, windows and plaster for his house.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 66 years old and married with nine children. Lucena works very hard to provide for them.

Lucena runs a general store in the Philippines and requests 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Lucena has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, snack foods, biscuits, noodles, and cooking oil. 

Lucena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mila is 53 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Mila has a general store business in the Philippines. Mila requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Mila has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Mila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.  Perlita has been in this business for 20 years.

Perlita requests 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fabric and thread for her business.

Perlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric and thread for her business.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a married woman with three children. She is 38 years old and has two children who are currently in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Rosalia requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Rosalia would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario works hard to support her family. She has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines.  Rosario has been in this business for 10 years.

She requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials like nail polish and nail cutters for her business.

Rosario would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish and nail cutters for her business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert used the previous loan to buy more livestock and sprays so as to treat and expand his livestock farm.

For 3 years in this business, Robert has been able to look after his children and educate them. He also does farming to supplement his income, but is limited by capital to expand his business and become a model farmer and livestock producer in his area; a dream that he has always hoped to achieve. Robert is in need of a loan to buy two heifers.

loans.use: to buy two heifers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more goods and renovate his shop.

loans.name: Diapalante Ndioloffene Group

texts.fr: Le groupement Diappalante Ndioloffène est composé d 5 personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier et se réunissent à chaque fois de besoin. Leur présidente s’appelle Awa, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Agée de 58 ans elle évolue dans la vente de bijoux, tissus et autres accessoires de beauté.  Elle n’a aucunes charges particulières car ayant de grands enfants qui ont pris la charge des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. AWA sollicite ce montant pour renforcer son fond de roulement et satisfaire ses clients. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 16. Elle a une expérience de 3ans dans cette activité et voudrait à l’avenir augmenter ses revenus en diversifiant  ses produites et gagner d’autres clients.
texts.en: The Diallapante Ndioloffène group is composed of five people who live in the same neighborhood and meet as need. Their leader’s name is Awa; she is the one raising her hand in the photo. Awa is married and has children. She is 58 years and works selling jewelry, fabric and other fashion accessories. She has no special financial burdens since her children are grown and have taken over providing for everyday household needs. Awa is seeking this loan to bolster her working capital and meet customer demand. She starts her work day at 8 AM and ends at 4 PM. She has three years of experience in this business. In the future she would like to increase her revenues by diversifying her offerings and attracting new customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric and jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with four children.  Victoria is 39 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Victoria has a manicure/pedicure and foot spa business in the Philippines. She requests14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy supplies for her business.

Victoria has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner and has a retail dry goods business in the Philippines.  Virginia has been in this business for 3 years.

Virginia requests 9,000 PHP through NWTF to re-stock dry goods including blankets, slippers, and blouses.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to re-stock dry goods including blankets, slippers, and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Revendeuse d'alimentation générale depuis 2007, Afi sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour améliorer son stock. Elle exerce seule son activité et espère avec le profit qu'elle va réaliser assurer le besoin de la famille. Elle a 37ans.
texts.en: A retail grocer since 2007, Afi is requesting her first loan from WAGES to increase her inventory. She operates her business alone and hopes that, with the profits, she will ensure her family's needs are met. She is 37 years old.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Twizigirane Group

texts.fr:
Rosalie  fait partie du groupe  Twizigirane et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 28 ans et est mariée  à Sylvestre, un fonctionnaire. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants  âgés de 6 à 9 ans tous étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de riz depuis 2 ans. 

Elle est à son  sixième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de riz à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Grâce aux gains de son commerce, elle parvient à satisfaire les besoins de sa famille (alimentation, logement, habillement).
texts.en:
Rosalie is part of the group Twizigirane and lives in Gitega. She is 28 years old and married to Sylvestre, a public servant. Together they have three children, from 6 to 9 years old, who are all students. 

Rosalie has been doing commerce in rice for two years. 

She is on her sixth Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of rice to resell, so as to earn more. 

Thanks to the gains from her business, she is managing to meet the needs of her family (food, housing, clothing).

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of rice to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamada KUÑA RORY está en el tercer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona muy alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Herculana es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona muy alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad, Sale a vender su productos alrededor de su zona y un poco mas alejado donde tiene sus clientes. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de jabones, aceite, edulcorantes y demás productos para que ella pueda seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
En la foto del grupo hay una persona demás que integra el grupo, pero no retira préstamo.
texts.en:
The group called KUÑA RORY is in its third loan cycle of the women's committee programme in the city of Concepción, at quite a distance from the central area and still growing. The members of this group want to fight to keep growing and provide a better environment to the place where they live and for them to continue slowly growing.

Herculana is one of the members and lives in an area quite a way from the city centre. She goes out to sell her products around her neighbourhood and a little bit further out where she has customers. Her dream is that over time, and with the the help of others in her neighbourhood, they can improve their district and thus offer a greater degree of security to their families and be able to give them a better future. She is asking for this loan to buy soap, oil, sweeteners and other products so she can carry on with her sales like she is currently doing. The additional person in the photo is part of the group but did not request a loan for this cycle.

loans.use: to buy soap, oil, sweeteners and other products.

loans.name: Sadatou

texts.fr: Sadatou est une femme âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée à un commerçant et mère de famille. Elle revend  des produits d'alimentations générale à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Sadatou a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. Dans les prochaines années, Sadatou voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle prévoit assurer l'épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Sadatou is a 45-year-old mother of a family. She is married to a merchant. She sells grocery items out of her home. She purchases her goods in Lomé. Sadatou has requested her second loan from WAGES to purchase grocery items. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, she would like to open a store. She plans to make sure her family thrives.

loans.use: to purchase general grocery supplies.

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es: Es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 48 años de edad, casada con 6 hijos, de los cuales tres han conformado su familia y tres se encuentran estudiando su carrera universitaria. Su esposo es conductor de taxi. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de fritos (carne de pollo frito con tajadas y repollo) en su vivienda que es de tambo de madera. Ya tiene experiencia de trabajar  con crédito, porque comenzó  como socia y coordinadora de un grupo solidario de Pana Pana; ahora está pasando a solicitar un crédito individual para incrementar su mercadería de pilipitas, carbón, yuca, pollo, quequisque, aceite, frijoles, verduras y especias y construir un anexo de madera. Su experiencia en el Grupo Solidario por más de dos años fue muy buena, logró mejorar su negocio, recientemente construyó un pequeño bajarete, a la orilla de su casa, creando un punto estratégico y visible para la venta de sus productos, también le han permitido comprar una estufa, diversificar su oferta, debido a que hace unos meses vende frijoles cocidos y nacatamal de viernes a domingo. Su sueño es apoyar a su familia, particularmente a su hija que se encuentra estudiando su carrera universitaria en Managua.
texts.en:
Fermina is an enterprising woman. She is 48 years old, married and has 6 children; 3 of whom have their own family and 3 whom are studying at university. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has a small shop selling fried food (fried chicken with fried plantains and cabbage) from her home which is a dairy barn made of wood. She already has experience with loans because she started as a member and coordinator of a solidarity group from Pana Pana. 

Now she is requesting an individual loan to increase her goods; pilipita (type of banana), coal, yucca, chicken, quequisque (tuber), oil, beans, vegetables and spices and to build an annex made of wood. 

Her experience with the Solidarity Group, more than two years, was very good; she managed to improve her business. Recently she built a small wattle and daub house at the edge of her house creating a strategic and visible point for the sale of her products. It has also allowed her to buy a stove and diversify her offerings because for months now she has been selling cooked beans and Nicaraguan tamales from Friday to Sunday. 

Her dream is to support her family in particular her daughter who is studying at university in Managua.

loans.use: to increase her goods; pilipita (type of banana), coal, yucca, chicken, quequisque (tuber), oil, beans, vegetables and spices and to build an annex made of wood.

loans.name: Vecinas Amigas Group

texts.es:
El comité Vecinas Amigas,  el comité fue formado con amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Lambaré, donde cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante y por medio del trabajo grupal ir creciendo.
Griselda vende ropas de manera ambulante, es una persona muy entusiasta y por sobre todo muy luchadora que con esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante. Comenta que su suelo es poder seguir creciendo y seguir ayudando a su familia como lo viene haciendo. Pide este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas como ser jeans, remeras, camisas, pantalones y demás, de manera a seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The committee "Vecinas Amigas" [Neighbor Friends] was formed with friends and neighbors from the city of Lambaré where each one uses her best efforts to be able to get ahead and continue growing through group work. 

Griselda sells clothing as a street vendor. She is an enthusiastic person and above all else, fights with strength and sacrifice to get ahead. She says that her dream to is to be able to continue growing and continue helping her family as she has been doing. She asks for this loan to invest it in the purchase of assorted clothing such as jeans, t-shirts, blouses, pants and more. This way she can continue to make sales.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, blouses, pants and more for sale.

loans.name: Esperanza Unida Group

texts.es:
El grupo de mujeres llamado La Esperanza Unida está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Hermelinda quien se dedica a la venta de joyas variadas y que por medio de ese negocio ella tiene los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia. Es muy luchadora y se está esforzando bastante para ir mejorando ya que siempre participa de forma muy activa en las capacitaciones que recibe.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de joyas variadas para poder venderlos, y de esa forma tener los ingresos para seguir ayudando a su familia. También agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo.
texts.en: The group of women known as "La Esperanza Unida" ("United Hope") is in their first loan cycle, where they all work and help each other to succeed. They are taking the survey on poverty elimination, where four of their members can be found living below the poverty line. One of the members is Hermelinda, who works selling jewelry, and by doing this she has the income to be able to help her family. She is very hardworking and is trying her best to go on improving, since she always participates actively in the training she receives. She requests this loan to invest in purchasing jewelry that she can sell, and this way have the income to continue helping her family. She also appreciates the opportunity that she is receiving to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
Kuña Kyrey lleva por nombre este grupo, que se está esforzando por salir adelante y poder ayudar a sus familias con el trabajo en conjunto. Ellas también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, con el cual podrán ir mejorando el estilo de vida de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien se dedica a la peluquería, y comenta que es muy buena en lo que hace, y que siempre tiene mucho trabajo y clientela, ya que sus clientes siempre quedan muy conformes con el servicio que ella da. Maria es una persona muy trabajadora, que con sacrificio se ha hecho camino.
Maria pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de shampoo, acondicionadores, tintes, peines y demás, que le permitirá seguir trabajando y luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Kuña Kyrey is the name of this group that is making an effort to move foward and to be able to help their families with the work together. The women also form part of a poverty elimination program with which they will able to improve the lifestyle of each one. 

One of the members is Maria who works in a hair salon and says that it is very good what she does. She always has a lot of work and clients because her clients are very happy with the service that she gives. Maria is a hard working person who, with sacrifice, has made a way. Maria requests this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of shampoo, conditioners, dyes, combs and other things that will allow her to continue working and struggling as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioners, dyes, combs and other things.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Emprendedoras, ya que eso es lo que son todas ellas, mujeres emprendedoras con grandes ideales que se están esforzando por sus familias para poder darles todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener por medio de la ayuda de todas. También forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, el cual por medio de la encuesta de 50 indicadores podrán conocer la situación de vida de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosa, quien en su  encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir un nivel medio, donde ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, todo esto sumado a sus ventas de frutas, verduras y hielo que hace, ella se esfuerza mucho y pone todo de si por mejorar.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras varias para la venta, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Las Emprendedoras" (The Enterprising Ones), because this describes each of them.  They are enterprising women with great ideals who are exerting themselves for their families so that they can give them everything that they would not otherwise be able to have.  They are also participating in the Poverty Elimination Survey.  With their responses to the 50 questions in the survey, the financial situation of each of them can be understood.  

One of the members of this group is Rosa.  Her survey showed her to be at poverty level 2, which is to say, the average level.  Through her efforts and continued work, and by adopting the key behaviors of a successful woman, she has been improving her poverty situation.  She has applied all of this to her business selling fruits, vegetables and ice.  She's working really hard, and putting everything she has into improving the business.

Rosa is requesting this loan to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables to sell.  This will help her to carry out her business plan and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
Yeny vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella es una madre trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia que se dedica a venta de CDs y DVDs . Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como CDs y DVDs. 

Yeny agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Yeny lives in the lovely city of Cusco, where she is a hardworking mother who gets her family ahead by selling CDs and DVDs.  She’s been doing this for several years and things are going very well for her.  She is asking for this loan to buy CDs and DVDs.

Yeny is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy CDs for her business.

loans.name: Door War Group

texts.fr: Door Waar est un groupement composé de 5 personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier et se réunissent à chaque fois. La présidente AISSA  est une jeune femme âgée de 27 qui est mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des denrées alimentaires comme le riz, l’huile, le sucre et le savon. Elle a une expérience de 2ans et n’a aucunes charges particulières à part ses besoins propres. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 21h. Elle voudrait ouvrir une boutique de denrées alimentaires pour augmenter ses revenus et diversifier ses produits et ca grâce aux financements de l’institution.
texts.en: Door Waar is a group composed of five persons who live in the same district and who gather together as needed. AISSA is the president. She is a young woman, 27 years old, and a married mother with a family. She works at selling grocery supplies, such as rice, oil, sugar, and soap. She has two years of experience and has no particular expenses at all apart from her own needs. Her day starts at 9 AM and ends at 9 PM. She would like to open a grocery store to increase her revenues and diversify her products, all thanks to financing from the microfinance institution.

loans.use: to purchase grocery supplies to resell

loans.name: Jappale Sor Daga Group

texts.fr: JAPPALE SOR DAGA est un groupement d’intérêt économique qui est composé de 5 personnes. Elles habitent toutes dans le même quartier et se réunissent à chaque fois de besoin. Astou est leur présidente, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle est âgée de 54ans est évolue dans la commercialisation des denrées alimentaires comme le riz, le sucre, l’huile etc.. Elle a une expérience de 4ans dans cette activité et commence sa journée a 9h pour la finir à 18h. Elle demande un crédit pour acheter et vendre les denrées alimentaires. Elle n’a pas de charges particulières à part ses besoins personnels. Grace aux crédits de l’institution elle voudrait devenir le fournisseur potentiel du marché de sa commune.
texts.en:
APPALE SOR DAGA is an economic interest group composed of five persons, who all live in the same district and who gather together as needed. Astou is their president. She is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 54 years old and works selling grocery supplies, such as rice, sugar, oil, etc. She has four years of experience in this business. Her day starts at 9 AM and ends at 6 PM.

Astou is asking for a loan to purchase grocery supplies to resell. She has no particular expenses apart from personal needs. Thanks to loans from the microfinance institution, she would like to become a potential supplier for the market in her commune.

loans.use: to purchase grocery supplies to resell

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia vive en la ciudad de Huancarani al sur de la Ciudad del Cusco y continúa participando en el banco comunal "Mamacha Rosario" de la Asociación Arariwa. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura, ella cultivo  como por ejemplo trigo, cebada, moraya seca, maíz y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Celia requiere el préstamo para compra semillas y abonos.
texts.en: Celia lives in the city of Huancarani, south of Cusco, and she continues to be a part of the "Mamacha Rosario" communal bank at the "Asociación Arariwa". Celia's principal work is in farming. She grows, among other things, wheat, barley and corn. Celia has had this business for a number of years and it is going well thanks to her efforts. On this occasion Celia needs a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilisers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. María forma parte del grupo de crédito 10 de Agosto desde hace 10 años, en todo este tiempo ha llegado a tener muy buenas amigas con quienes comparte sus momentos buenos y malos. Vive en la parroquia de Santa Ana en Cuenca, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno, su gente es de un corazón cálido y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora María tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, dos de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente y cuatro estudian en un colegio del sector, su esposo labora en la construcción, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la ganadería, con la leche que obtiene de sus animales realiza quesos, también cría cuyes, cerdos y pollos, cultiva y sus cosechas son para  el consumo de su casa. El dinero de su crédito es para compra abono y pasto para mejorar sus potreros. Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria has been part of the “10 de Agosto” lending group for 10 years.  During that time she has made some good friends, with whom she shares her good times and bad.  She lives in the Santa Ana parish in Cuenca, where its architecture is a mix of old and new.  Its people are warm hearted and keep their culture and traditions.

Maria is 43 years old, married, and has six children, two of whom work and help her financially.  Four of them attend the local school.  Her husband works in construction.  They own their home.

Maria takes care of the housework, but raises livestock to help with the family finances.  She makes cheese with the milk she gets from her animals and also raises Guinea pigs, pigs, and chickens.  She raises crops for family consumption and will use the money to buy grass and fertilizer.  Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
Gliceria is 65 years old from Dauis, Bohol. She is married with seven grown children. Her husband works as a carpenter and also fishes for a living. Gliceria has spent the last 20 years selling home-cooked snacks like steamed cassava cupcakes. This has been her means of supporting her children. She is asking for a loan of 9000 PHP to buy cassava, firewood, coconut and sugar. This way, she can continue to sustain her business. 

Gliceria hopes to improve her family's living conditions. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy cassava, firewood, coconut and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's school expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Edinah

texts.en:
Edinah is a divorced woman, with two school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, Edinah has operated a clothes-selling business, selling second-hand clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Edinah is requesting KES 40,000 loan to purchase bales of clothes to resell. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El grupo de nombre San Roque está en su 4to ciclo  del programa de comité, donde además trabajan dentro del programa de la eliminación de la pobreza, el cual por medio de la encuesta de eliminación pueden conocer la situación de cada una.
Una de estas señoras es Liria  quien entre el trabajo que ella  realiza se dedica a la confección con lo que ayuda a su familia con los gastos del hogar.  A parte de las capacitaciones correspondientes y de los seguimientos ellas ponen su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Liria pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir con la confección, como ser telas, hilos, botones y demás, y así seguir trabajando y luchando.
texts.en:
San Roque Group is in its fourth loan cycle with the committee program.  They're also working with the poverty-elimination program, in which they take a survey learn the status of each member.  Through training and monitoring, the women put their best effort into being able to grow and get ahead.

Liria's one of these women.  She helps her family pay the household expenses with her job making clothing.

Liria's requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other sewing supplies to continue working and striving.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Luchadoras se llama este grupo de 18 mujeres muy luchadoras, es por eso que todas pusieron ese nombre al grupo. Cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Lucila integra este grupo, ella es la presidenta, y comenta que siempre trata de instar a sus compañeras a esforzarse y trabajar duro para salir adelante. Ella se dedica a hacer comidas y las vende de manera ambulante. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar sus insumos para seguir haciendo las comidas que vende, como ser verduras, condimentos, carnes, y demás, y así seguir trabajando y luchando.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Luchadoras" is the name of this group of 18 fighters, and that is where the name of the group comes from. Each of them puts in their best effort to support their loved ones. 

Lucila is part of this group. She is the president and comments that she always tries to urge her fellow members to make the effort to work hard and get ahead. She makes meals and sells then door-to-door. She is requesting this loan to buy the ingredients she needs to continue selling, like vegetables, spices, meats, etc. Then she can continue to work and fight.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, spices, meats, etc to make meals.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña guapa forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permite, por medio de las capacitaciones y de la encuesta socioeconómica, poder conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar en los puntos que cada una debe mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Vicenta quien es vendedora de productos varios que trae de la argentina, como ser jabones, aceites, edulcorantes y demás. Es una persona muy sacrificada, que con esfuerzo está intentando salir adelante e ir superando su situación de pobreza. Comenta que es su familia quien siempre está a su lado apoyándola, y es por ellos que la señora esta luchando, por darles una vida más digna y sin privaciones.
Vicenta está contenta por formar parte del grupo, ya que así está mejorando su situación de vida por medio de las capacitaciones. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar jabones, aceites, edulcorantes y demás productos para la venta, que le garantizará tener una buena variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Kuña Guapa is part of the Program for Poverty Elimination. It enables them to undergo training and a socio-economic survey to determine the economic status of each member and allow them to work on the parts of their life that need improvement.

One of the members is Vicenta who sells products imported from Argentina such as soaps, oils, sweeteners, and others. She is a very self-sacrificing person who puts effort into getting by to gradually overcome her property. She says her family is always on hand to support her. They are the reason that she fights to give them a more dignified life without deprivation.

Vicenta is happy to join a group that is improving their life situation through training. She has requested this loan to buy soaps, sweeteners, and other products to sell, ensuring she will have a good variety for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase soaps, oils, and sweeteners to sell.

loans.name: La Alborada Group

texts.es:
La Alborada se formó en la ciudad de Santaní, en una comunidad aun en crecimiento, que está trabajando por crecer y mejorar, todas las integrantes se dedican a actividades rurales, como ser la cría y venta de animales.
Sonia es la presidenta de este grupo, y lo integra, ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, de manera a poder seguir con la cria de los mismos. Su sueño es algún día poder tener una granja con animales donde poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
"La Alborada" is a group that was formed in the city of Santaní, a community that is growing. The members are working so that they can grow and improve. All of them engage in rural businesses, such as raising and selling animals.

Sonia is a member and serves as the president of this group. She is requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchase of balanced feed for her animals so that she can continue raising them. Her dream someday is to have a farm with animals so that she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Ruvicha Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ruvicha está en su ciclo número 8 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde el grupo es caracterizado por la buena predisposición y la ayuda mutua de las integrantes, donde todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosa Carmen quien través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo ha podido ir mejorando su bienestar económico dentro del hogar, ella es una de las mujeres emprendedoras que supo cómo aprovechar la oportunidad que se le otorgó para así generar nuevos ingresos dentro de la familia Cuenta la misma que realiza la cría de pollitos para su posterior venta y así generar ingreso dentro de la casa. También realiza la producción de detergentes a partir  de kits de limpiezas que es también una ayuda accesible que recibe de la Fundación Paraguaya para ir implementando nuevas labores que le generen ingresos a través de las microfranquicias de limpieza. 
La Sra. Rosa Carmen solicita de este crédito para la compra de alimentos para los pollitos y después para volver a sacar ganancia de los mismos y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ruvicha Group is in its eighth loan cycle with the women's committee program.  The group's known for its good work and the mutual support among the members, all of whom are putting forth their best effort to get ahead.

One of the members is Rosa Carmen, who has improved her household finances with effort and her job.  She's one of the women entrepreneurs who was able to make the most of the opportunity she was given to earn additional income for her family.

Rosa Carmen said she raises chickens for sale to earn a living.  She also makes detergent with cleaning kits.  This additional help from Fundación Paraguaya helps start new jobs to earn income through cleaning microfrancises.

Rosa Carmen's requesting this loan to buy feed for her chicks to earn a profit from them so she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres solidarias, son mujeres muy emprendedoras, que luchan por mejorar sus vidas y las de sus familias por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que les permitirá poder conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder seguir mejorando.
Teresa comenta que es empleada y Costurera, ella es una persona muy emprendedora, que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y con lo que ayuda a su familia. Su sueño es poder agrandar su taller de costura, y así dar trabajo a otras personas.
La Sra. Teresa solicita de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, agujas, hijos, y desea comprar más adelante una máquina de coser.
texts.en:
The group is called Mujeres Solidarias [Solidarity Women]. They are very enterprising women, who fight to improve their lives and the lives of their families by striving together. They are doing a poverty elimination survey, which will allow them to understand the situation of each person, and according to that, be able to continue improving. 

Teresa says that she is an employee and seamstress. She is a very enterprising person, who with much sacrifice and effort is getting ahead and helping her family. Her dream is to be able to grow her sewing workshop, and therefore give work to other people.

Teresa asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of fabric, pins, thread, and desires to buy a sewing machine in the long run.

loans.use: buy fabric, pins, thread.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Maria Auxiliadora 2 está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, pero gracias al trabajo de ellas, sumado a las capacitaciones que han recibido, todas han mejorado mucho y creciendo.
La Sra.  Dominga una de las integrantes solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos para la confección de sus prendas, como telas e hilos, ya que ella se dedica a la confección,  lo cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos, y ayudando a su familia.
Dominga es una mujer muy entusiasta que siempre participa de forma muy activa, se define a sí misma como una persona luchadora y con grandes ansias de salir adelante y dar a su familia lo que ella no pudo tener.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora 2 communal bank is participating in the elimination of poverty survey.  However, thanks to their work and the trainings they have received, all of them have greatly improved and are growing.

Dominga is one of the members.  She is requesting this loan to buy products like fabric and thread in order to make clothes because she is a seamstress.  This will help her improve her income and help her family.

Dominga is a very enthusiastic woman who always very actively participates.  She describes herself as a very tenacious person with a great desire to get ahead.  She wants to give her family what she was not able to have.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Magno

texts.es:
Magno es una persona muy trabajadora, que desde joven ha trabajo y ha salido adelante, ayudando a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo. El cuenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en la compra de insumos para la despensa de su esposa, por lo cual esta muy agradecido.
El pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de mas insumos para la despensa, que le permitirá seguir cumpliendo con los clientes, ya que quiere comprar frutas, verdura, bebidas, y demás. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Magno's a very hardworking person who has worked and made progress from a young age by helping his loved ones through his work.  He said he used the previous loan to buy supplies for his wife's grocery store, for which he's very grateful.

Magno's requesting another loan to invest in buying more supplies for the store to keep on meeting the customers' needs.  He wants to buy fruits, vegetables, beverages, and other supplies.

He's grateful for this new opportunity.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, beverages, and other supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
“Mujeres Activas” se llama este nuevo grupo que está en el 1er ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
Una de las señoras es  Ana quien vende comidas de manera ambulante, y de este forma lucha por su familia para poder darles todo lo que necesitan para un día a día sin necesidades. Ella anhela en el futuro agrandar su producción  y lucha por un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que redobla esfuerzos en pos de su ideal. 
Pide este préstamo ya que quiere comprar insumos para sus comidas como ser verduras, condimentos, hortalizas, panificados y de demás. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Activas” is the name of this new group, which is in its first loan cycle as part of the programme run by the women's committee. The main goal decided by the committee was growth for every woman, not only economic growth but also personal growth.

One of the women is Ana, who sells meals as a street trader. She does this work to fight for her family and to be able to buy them what they need so they don't have to do without. Ana's dream for the future is to increase her production and to fight for a better future for her children, and this is why she is redoubling her efforts in pursuit of her dream.

She is asking for this loan because she wants to buy ingredients for her meals such as vegetables, condiments, garden produce and baked goods. She is grateful for this opportunity that is offered to her.

loans.use: to buy items such as vegetables, condiments, garden produce and baked goods.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “La Esperanza” debido a que las integrantes se unieron con la esperanza de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio de su trabajo en conjunto. Una de ellas es la Sra. Liduvina, quien se dedica a la venta de chipas, la cual es una comida típica paraguaya.
Liduvina comenta que gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo y por medio de la venta de sus chipas ha dado a su familia lo que necesitan para el día a día. Es una mujer muy luchadora y con ansias de ir mejorando su vida.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de chipas para poder venderlas y de esa forma seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This group is called “La Esperenza” (“The Hope”) since its members came together with the hope of improving their life conditions through their joint work. One of them is Mrs. Liduvina, who sells chipas (cheesy buns), a typical Paraguayan food.

Liduvina says that thanks to her work and effort, and to the sale of chipas, she has given her family everything they need to live day to day. She is a hardworking woman with a desire to improve her life. 

She is asking for this loan to invest it in the purchase of chipas for the sale, and in this way keep her business growing.

loans.use: to buy chipas (cheesy buns) for the sale.

loans.name: Buena Vista 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Buena Vista 2 está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza que les permitirá conocer la situación de vida que cada una tiene y conforme a eso poder seguir trabajando. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Perla quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir que ella ha ido mejorando su vida a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo  y por medio de la despensa que tiene.
Perla comenta que con mucho sacrificio ha podido montar su humilde despensa con la que ayuda a su familia para poder darles todo lo que necesitan.
La Sra.  Perla  Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas comestibles, bebidas y demás, lo que le ayudará a tener y concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group Buena Vista 2 is doing the poverty elimination survey enabling them to understand their life situation and according to that to continue working. Perla is one of the members who in her last survey showed a poverty level of 3, in other words she has been improving her life through effort and continuous work and through her store.

Perla says that with a lot of sacrifice she has been able to build her humble store which helps her family to give them everything they need.

Perla is requesting a loan to buy various supplies for her store such as vegetables, fruits, drinks and more, which will help her have and set up her business plan which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, drinks and more.

loans.name: Mburucuya Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mburucuya  está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir que ella fue mejorando su vida a través de las capacitaciones que fue recibiendo.  Ella por medio de la venta de frutas y verduras está teniendo los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia y de esa forma darles una vida digna y sin privaciones.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras de estación para la venta, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The "Mburucuya" group is on its sixth loan cycle as part of the women's committee programme, where all of the members work and help each other to get ahead. The members are undergoing the poverty elimination survey in order to understand each one's own financial situation.

One member of the group is María. Her last poverty survey showed that she was at level three - this means that her situation was improving through the training she was receiving.
