Through her work selling fruits and vegetables, María is earning the income to be able to help her family and to give them a decent life where they need for nothing.

María is applying for this loan in order to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell. This will help her to realise her business plan, allowing her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Renacer está en su ciclo número 19 del programa de comité de mujeres, este grupo lleva varios ciclos unido, y con mucho esfuerzo están creciendo gracias a las capacitaciones que han recibido.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Edith, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles en una escuela de la ciudad, gracias a los ingresos que ella tiene puede  ayudar a su familia económicamente, ella es una persona muy luchadora que se está esforzando por Salir adelante e ir creciendo. 
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para seguir haciendo comestibles, como ser: carne, verduras, condimentos, hortalizas y demás, y así seguir con sus ventas, como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Renacer (Rebirth) is in its 19th cycle of the communal bank program. This group has been together for several cycles and with a lot of effort they are growing thanks to the training they have received.

One of the members is Edith. She sells food at a school in the city. Thanks to the income she has, she can help her family economically. She is a fighter who is working hard to move ahead and keep growing.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy a variety of supplies to continue making food, such as: meat, greens, condiments, vegetables, and others, and in this way continue with her sales, as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy meat, greens, condiments, vegetables, and other supplies

loans.name: Yedi

texts.es: Yedi vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades económicas.  Su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio de taxi por la zona urbana. Su jornada laboral empieza desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 10:00 p.m.  de lunes a sábados. Por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su familia. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del Taxi.
texts.en: Yedi lives in the lovely city of Cusco, where she provides taxi services around the urban area.  His shift begins at 6:00 am and lasts to 10:00 pm, Monday through Saturday.  He gets his family ahead through this business.  He needs a loan to perform maintenance on his Taxi.

loans.use: to maintain his taxi.

loans.name: Marième

texts.fr: Marième est une jeune femme âgée de 28 ans qui est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente des mèches, greffages et produits cosmétiques. Elle a comme charge particulière les dépenses quotidiennes de ses parents. Elle a une expérience de plus de 8ans dans ce domaine et commence sa journée à 8 pour la finir à 19h. Elle sollicite ce crédit d’un montant de 100.000F pour renforcer son fond de roulement et diversifier ses produits. A l’avenir elle souhaite avoir une autonomie financière.
texts.en: Marième is a young woman who is 28 years old, single and has no children. She sells hair extensions, hair weaves and cosmetics. She has a specific responsibility for covering her parents' daily outgoings. She has more than eight years in this field and begins her day at 8 o'clock in the morning and finishes it at 8 o'clock in the evening. She is requesting this loan of 100,000 francs to boost her working capital and diversify her products. In the future she would like to be financially autonomous.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine is 22 years old from Baclayon, Bohol.
She is married to a carpenter. For two years now, Katherine has operated a sari-sari (convenience) store to make a living. She sells items that cater to the needs of her neighborhood like canned goods, eggs, seasonings, sugar, coffee and toiletries. She is asking for a loan to buy additional canned goods, chips and biscuits. She is hoping that with the loan she will have in stock all items needed by her customers. Her income goes toward food, savings and reinvestment in her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, chips and biscuits

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
El es Carlos Andrés un joven que encontró un apoyo con el convenio kiva y gracias a eso pudo presentar el tercer semestre con agrado.  No  ha dejado el estudio y actualmente está estudiando contabilidad financiera,  en el momento entra a cuarto semestre de esta, poniéndole sacrificio para mejorar la calidad de vida,  sigue creciendo con valores y espera muy pronto servirle a la familia, barrio, comunidad y nación. 
Aplicando en el estudios para ser el mejor en lo que le gusta, desea culminar la carrera, la gente que lo acompañan en el camino también agrade este apoyo, pues se ha reflejado en el vivir de la gente querida que lo acompaña a salir  adelante día a día  que  si se puede y que él puede ser un reflejo de que caminar por el buen camino aunque sea largo y duradero es la mejor opción para la vida.
Nuevamente como se ha planteado, el no tiene una situación económica que le convenga, por tal motivo pide nuevamente una  ayuda que fue muy favorable y quiere seguir con el proceso de la educación y así poder culminar los estudios.
texts.en:
This is Carlos Andrés, a young man who found a support in you all.  Thanks to the agreement he was able to be present for his third semester with pleasure.  He hasn't stopped going to school and currently he is studying financial accounting.  At this time he will enter his fourth semester of these studies, making a sacrifice in order to improve his quality of life.  He continues to grow in his values and hopes very soon to be of service to his family, neighborhood, community and nation.

Applying himself in his studies to be the best at what he likes, he wants to finish his studies.  The people who accompany him in his journey are also grateful for this support as it has been reflected in the lives of his loved ones that a person gets ahead day by day as they can and that he may be a reflection of the fact that walking on the right path, even though it is long and hard, is the best option in life. 

It has come up again that he doesn’t have the financial situation that he needs, for that reason he is asking again for help that was very favorable and he wants to continue with the process of education and to be able to finish his studies.

loans.use: to pay for a semester’s tuition.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Tambillo, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad pequeña ubicada cerca al Parque Nacional de Cutervo, con un clima variado y abundante vegetación, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura especialmente cafeto, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica básicamente al cultivo de cafeto de la variedad catimor tiene sembrado 2 ha de su propiedad y ganadería de ganado vacuno, su esposa e hijos le apoyan en esta labor mantiene buenas relaciones con los miembros de su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para el pago de mano de obra para el mantenimiento de su cultivo y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elmer, 34, lives with his wife and children in the hamlet of Tambillo, a rural area of Santo Tomás in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru.  It's a small community located near Cutervo National Park.  The climate's variable and there's abundant vegetation, which has allowed the development of commerce, ranching, and agriculture, especially coffee production.

Elmer works primarily growing the Catimor variety of coffee.  He has coffee crops and cows on two hectares of his property.  His wife and children help him with this job.  Elmer gets along well with the members of his community.

Elmer has requested a loan for 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to pay for labor to help maintain his crop.  That way he can have a good harvest to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to pay for labor for his coffee crop

loans.name: Chinarakhon

texts.ru: Чинарахон 45 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа одна воспитала 5 детей. Дочь замужем, сыновья находятся на заработках в России, отправляют ежемесячно часть своей зарплаты в Кыргызстан матери, остальные дети проживают с матерью, помогают по хозяйству. У Чинарахон - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Чинарахон занимается полеводством, стартовав 25 лет назад, с 2,500 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Чинарахон, на сегодняшний день имеется:0,37 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель, овощи и хлопок для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чинарахон обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку семян овощей и семян хлопка для посевных работ, а также удобрений для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Чинарахон планирует вложить в развитие сельского хозяйства, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Chinarakhon is a 45-year-old widow. After the death of her husband, she raised five children on her own. Her daughter is married; her sons are working abroad in Russia and they send part of their salaries to their mother in Kyrgyzstan monthly. The remaining children lives with their mother and help around the homestead. Chinarakhon has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Chinarakhon raises crops, having begun 25 years ago with 2,500 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Chinarakhon currently has a 0.37-hectare plot of land, on which annually she grows potatoes, vegetables and cotton for internal consumption and sale. Monthly income amounts to 12,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Chinarakhon applied to the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan - to purchase vegetable and cotton seeds for the sowing work, and also fertilizers for preparing the land.

Chinarakhon plans to invest income from the loan in developing her homestead and plans to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy cotton and vegetables seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Aliz Yamile

texts.es: Aliz Yamile es una mujer de edad 28 años, actualmente reside en la ciudad de Bogotá, madre de 2 niños y trabajadora independiente como estilista. Últimamente ha tenido presente la gran pretensión de terminar y fortalecer los estudios. Afortunadamente se le ha presentado una gran oportunidad de pertenecer a un grupo de beneficiarios en el lugar donde decidió continuar los estudios, una excelente institución llamada Campo Alto, en los que les permiten adquirir un convenio con kiva para facilidad de pago de la carrera, el cual le es de gran ayuda porque ella tiene una vida familiar y necesita suplir los gastos de la misma ya que es madre cabeza de hogar.
texts.en:
Aliz Yamile is a 28 year old woman who currently lives in the city of Bogotá.  She has two children, and she works independently as a stylist.  Lately, her big objective has been finishing and strengthening her education.  

Fortunately, she has been presented with a great opportunity to belong to a group of beneficiaries where she decided to continue her education.  There is an excellent institution by the name of Campo Alto.  It allows them to enter into an agreement with Kiva to make paying for her studies easier.  This is a big help because she has a family life, and she needs to cover her family’s expenses because she is a mother and the head of the household.

loans.use: to pay to register for a semester.

loans.name: Santos Anacleto

texts.es:
Santos es un hombre casado de 40 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos y su pareja  en el Departamento de Sololá.
Santos comenta que se dedica a la elaboración de sillas y mesas, lo cual lo realiza a pocos metros de su vivienda. Ahora cuenta con seis años de experiencia en este tipo de negocio, que le ha ayudado a salir adelante a su familia ya que obtiene buenos ingresos y ganancias que mejoran su economía.
El ahora se ha dado cuenta que este producto tiene una fuerte demanda, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 2,000.00 para la compra de madera para la elaboración de sillas y mesas y así ofrecerles nuevos estilos a sus clientes. 
Uno de sus sueños es tener un lugar en donde pueda trabajar y exhibir sus muebles, con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is a married man.  He is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Solola department.

Santos says that he makes tables and chairs from a workshop a few meters from his home.  He has six years’ experience in this type of business which has helped him to get his family ahead and earn a good income, which has improved his financial situation.

He’s realized that he has a strong demand for his products, so he is asking for a loan of Q 2,000 to buy lumber to make tables and chairs so he can offer new styles to his customers.

One of his dreams is to have a place where he can work and show his furniture so he can improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy lumber and supplies.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
La señora María Cristina es una persona emprendedora, que busca sobresalir día tras día en el ámbito laboral.  
Es por esta razón que no se conforma con los estudios de Estilista, sino viendo las necesidades del mercado empieza los estudios de Estética que con gran sacrificio los realiza, ya que debe cumplir con las obligaciones laborales y familiares, además de eso no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para cubrir el pago mensual de las cuotas, por eso se ve interesada en pedir el subsidio de kiva, ella quiere terminar esta carrera ya que  el  mayor aliciente son  los hijos; quienes ven en ella un ejemplo a seguir. 
Ha sido un camino un poco difícil, pues llega del campo a la ciudad hace aproximadamente 6 años y ha tenido que pasar por algunas dificultades, algo que no la ha aplacado sino que al contrario le ha dado las fuerzas y ánimos para seguir adelante y convertirse en una excelente profesional y así sacar a los hijos que son lo más importante, entendiendo que nunca es tarde para empezar a formarse y hacer los sueños realidad.
texts.en:
Ms. María Cristina is an enterprising woman who seeks to stand out day after day in the workforce.   

This is the reason she was not happy studying to be a stylist, but saw the need in the market to study Aesthetics. She does this with great sacrifices, since she has to meet her work and family obligations. In addition to that, she does not have the necessary resources to cover her monthly bills. That is why she became interested in requesting a loan from Kiva. She wants to finish her program, since her greatest incentive is her children who see her as an example.  

It has been a bit of a difficult time, but she came from the countryside to the city approximately six years ago. She has had to go through many difficulties, but she is not satisfied. Instead, it has given her strength and the spirit to keep moving forward and become an excellent professional. In this way, she will be able to give her children what is most important, an understanding that it is never too late to start studying and make your dreams a reality.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a semester.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is fifty-two years old from Panglao, Bohol. She is married and, together with her husband, operates an eatery and a barber shop to earn money. This has been her business for six years now, earning her 30,000 PHP per month. Marianita is asking for a loan to buy meat, rice and spices for her restaurant. She knows how much additional capital will impact her business. 

Marianita believes in the value of hard work and she hopes to continue making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice and spices

loans.name: Kaisarina

texts.en:
Kaisarina is forty-five years old and married with eight children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Kaisarina has requested a loan to buy a large frying pan, a gallon of dripping oil, baking soda, a new gas oven, stirring spoon, plastic bags and a large basin. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Kaisarina will pay for her children's education and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a large frying pan, a gallon of dripping oil, baking soda, a new gas oven, stirring spoon, plastic bags and a large basin

loans.name: Luz Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora Luz forma parte del grupo de crédito 10 de Agosto, en el tiempo que tiene en el grupo ha llegado a tener muy buenas amigas con quienes comparte sus momentos buenos y malos. Vive en la parroquia de Santa Ana en Cuenca, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno, su gente es de un corazón cálido y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Luz tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos de 23, 20, 19, 15, 13, 11 y 9 años, su primero hijo trabaja y ayuda económicamente, sus dos hijas siguientes pasan en casa ayudando en los quehaceres domésticos, dos de sus hijos están en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Luz  se dedica a la crianza de animales y la agricultura, este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres y le ha permitido sacar adelante  a su familia. 
El dinero de su crédito anterior lo ha invertido en animales, alimento y también en materiales para arreglo de su vivienda. Esta repitiendo el crédito ya que va a comprar gallinas, cuyes y cerdos para continuar creciendo en su negocio. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la solidaridad y compañerismo de todas sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Luz is part of the “10 de Agosto” lending group and she has made good friends with whom she shares good and bad times.  She lives in the Santa Ana parish in Cuenca, where its architecture is a mix of old and new.  Its people are warm hearted and keep their culture and traditions.

Luz is 43 years old, married, and has seven children, ages 23, 20, 19, 15, 13, 11, and 9.  Her oldest son works and helps her financially.  Her two oldest daughters help with the household chores.  The rest of her children attend the local school.  Her husband works as a mason and they own their home.

Luz raises animals and farms.  She learned this from her parents and it has allowed her to get her family ahead.

She used the money from the previous loan to buy animals, feed, and building materials to make improvements to her house.  She will use the money from this loan to buy chickens, Guinea pigs, and pigs so she can continue to grow her business.  She likes the unity of her lending group and the camaraderie of her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a twenty-nine-year-old married woman from the community of Panglao, Bohol. She is married with four children between the ages of three and ten. Marife works hard to help her husband, who is a Dive Equipment Technician. For five months now, she has sold spices, fruit and vegetables like squash, string beans, oranges, eggplant, spring onion, garlic and onion.

She would like to increase her inventory but has limited funds. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 to buy onion, garlic, ginger, string beans and squash. She can expect a good profit if she never runs out of stock in her business.
 
She hopes to give her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy onion, garlic, ginger, string beans and squash

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an iron, table and sewing machine.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es una mujer de 28 años de edad, es de San Gabriel. Ella es madre soltera tiene una hija de 7 años de edad que asiste a la escuela, es una persona alegre y responsable en lo que hace.
Ella inicio recientemente su negocio de venta de cosméticos por catálogo, ella promociona sus productos  puerta a puerta mediante revistas, y sus clientes le solicitan el producto que necesitan, posteriormente ella realiza el pedido al proveedor. Ella necesita el préstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo y tener un inventario de productos en su casa. Sus metas a futuro es tener su propio local donde pueda vender productos cosméticos,  y darle a su hija una buena educación.
texts.en:
Andrea, 28, is from San Gabriel.  She is a single mother and has a seven-year-old daughter who attends school.  She is a cheerful person and responsible in all she does.

Recently, she started selling cosmetics by catalogue.  She goes door-to-door with her catalogues and the customers order the products they need.  She then places an order with the supplier.  The loan she is requesting is to increase her work capital so she can have a stock of products at home.  Her goal for the future is to open an establishment where she can sell cosmetics, and give her daughter a good education.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Maria Bertha

texts.es:
María Bertha tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en su propia casa, cuenta con servicios públicos agua y luz, en el distrito de Morropon denominada Capital del Tondero, un baile típico de la zona norte del país, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, que pertenece a la Provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y comercio del mismo, también vende abarrotes, cerveza y recargas a celulares, su hija le apoya en esta ultima labor, son una familia unida, María ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos de primera necesidad para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Bertha, 48, lives with her daughter in her own house and has public electricity and water service.  They live in the district of Morropón, known as the capital of the "tondero," a traditional dance in northern Peru.  It's located in the Piura region of the province of the same name, on the northern coast of Peru.  The people there work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

María raises and sells cattle.  She also sells groceries, beer, and recharge cards for mobile phones.  Her daughter helps her with the store; they're a close family.

María has requested a loan for 1,000 soles [PEN] to buy a variety of staple products to sell to her customers and earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of staple products

loans.name: Inavat

texts.ru: Инават 58 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. Дети все взрослые, женаты, проживают отдельно со своими семьями. У Инават - среднее образование. В 1993 году после приватизации совхоза Инават начала заниматься животноводством, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Инават, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, 10 овец, дополнительно занимается полеводством, выращивает клевер, кукурузу, сено. Хозяйство развивается стабильно, имеет сарай и все необходимые условия для содержания и разведения скота. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Инават обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Инават планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en:
Inavat is 58 years old, married, and together with her spouse has brought up five children. The children are all grown and live separately with their own families. Inavat has a secondary education. In 1993 after the privatization of the state farm, Inavat began to raise livestock, with a livestock purchase of 3,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Inavat currently has on her homestead: four dairy cows, one calf, and ten sheep, and additionally she raises crops, growing clover, corn, and hay. The homestead is developing well, has a barn and all the needed conditions for tending and breeding livestock. Monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Inavat applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan - to purchase sheep for expanding her livestock count.

Inavat plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money to build a new home.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Copo De Nieve Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COPO DE NIEVE” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Bárbara es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de alfombras, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, costura de colchas, costura de ropa deportiva, venta de lejía, servicio de construcción.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Bárbara es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de alfombras; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio familiar y que ella al casarse decide implementar su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en la ciudad de Cochabamba. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “COPO DE NIEVE” is starting the eighth cycle of Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch regional office. It is made up of ten members and is run by a board. Ms. Bárbara is the President. The businesses that the communal bank members have vary. Some of them include: weaving rugs, selling food, a neighborhood store, making quilts, making athletic clothing, selling lejía (a paste made of quinoa ashes, corn, and stevia), and construction services.

The loan that they take out would benefit the small businesses where Ms. Bárbara is a member. She has been a member of Pro Mujer for one year. She joined when she was invited by a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, Bárbara has a business making rugs. It was a family business, and when she got married, Bárbara decided to start her own business.
 
The loan that Bárbara will take out now is to buy wholesale wool. She will buy it at the city markets in El Alto. After she makes the rugs, she will sell them in the city of Cochabamba. This work allows her to make the income she needs to care for her family, since she is married and has six children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Bárbara responded that she likes the savings the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia is thirty-three years old and married with no children. She owns and operates a small store that sells items such as sugar, flour, soft drinks, alcohol, and frozen products. She has been doing this for many years. Sofia needs a loan to buy chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, soft drinks, cigarettes, snacks, milk, noodles, mosquito coils, cooking oil and laundry soap. She hopes to use her profits to improve and extend her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, soft drinks, cigarettes, snacks, milk, noodles, mosquito coils, cooking oil and laundry soap

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. У Айнагул и ее супруга - высшее педагогическое образование, оба преподают в школе, имеют большой авторитет среди сельчан, так как, выпустили не одно поколение воспитанных и талантливых учеников. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Айнагул с супругом занимаются животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айнагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 10 овец, 12 коз, 2 кобылы. Дома есть все условия для содержания скота. Зимой скот содержит на дому, с началом весны отгоняет скот на пастбище до поздней осени. Есть небольшая поливная земля, где корм для скота готовят сами. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнагул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку земельного участка.
texts.en:
Ainagul is 55 years old, married, and together with her husband has brought up six children. Ainagul and her spouse have higher pedagogical educations. Both teach at a school, and have a lot of respect among the villagers, since they had graduated more than one generation of educated and talented students. As an additional source of income for their family, Ainagul and her husband raise livestock, having begun 14 years ago with a livestock purchase of 15,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Ainagul currently has on her homestead: five dairy cows, ten sheep, 12 goats, and two mares. The home has all the conditions for tending livestock. In the winter, the livestock are cared for at home, and with the start of spring are driven to the pastures until the end of autumn. There is a small irrigated area of land, where feed for the livestock prepares itself. Monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Ainagul applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan - to purchase steers for increasing her livestock count.

Ainagul plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money to purchase a lot of land.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмире 43 года, разведена, одна воспитывает 2 детей. Старший сын работает в Казахстане, а младший сын помогает по хозяйству. У Эльмиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Эльмира занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 12,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Эльмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 21 овца. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Эльмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку нетели для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Эльмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Elmira is 43 years old, divorced, and on her own is raising two children. The elder son is working in Kazakhstan, and the younger son helps around the homestead. Elmira has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Elmira raises livestock, having begun 15 years ago with a livestock purchase of 12,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Elmira currently has on her homestead: two dairy cows and 21 sheep. Monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Elmira applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan - to purchase a heifer for expanding her livestock count.

Elmira plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the quantity of domestic livestock, and plans to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy a heifer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Leao

texts.en:
Leao is 51 years old and married with five children. 

She has a small garden where she grows pineapples, cucumber, taro, and taamu, which she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Leao needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, knives, spade, weed-spray, vegetable seeds, and barbed wire. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. Leao will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrow, chemicals, knives, spade, weed-spray, vegetable seeds and barbed wire.

loans.name: Husniya

texts.ru: Хусния 25 летняя девушка из Шахринава. Она замужем. Хусния с мужем воспитывают двоих детей. Как и большинство населения Таджикистана Хусния занимается земледелием. Она на своем земельном участке выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Она начала такую деятельность около 5 лет назад и посей день, она продолжает продвигать деятельность земледелия. На сегодняшний день Хусния готовиться к очередному посеву. Ей не хватает немного средств для закупа семян. Она боится остаться без урожая и надеется на деньги от кредита купить семена.
texts.en:
Husniya is a 25-year-old young woman from Shahrinava. She is married. Husniya and her husband are bringing up two children. Like the majority of the population of Tajikistan, Husniya is involved in agriculture. On her own plot of land, she grows crops. She began this kind of activity about five years ago and to this very day, she continues to carry forward agricultural work.

Currently, Husniya is preparing for the next planting. She does not have enough money to purchase seeds. She is afraid to be left without a crop and needs money from the loan to buy seeds.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Feagaiga

texts.en:
Feagaiga is 30 years old and married with six children. She owns and operates a small vegetable market, selling items such as cucumbers, cabbages, coco beans, eggplants, etc. She has been doing this for many years.

Feagaiga needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, chemicals, rake, garden hose, wheelbarrow, and shovel. She hopes to use her profits to extend/improve her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, chemicals, rake, garden hose, wheelbarrow, and shovel.

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina is 50 years old and married with nine children.
 
She has a small garden where she grows cucumbers, tomatoes, peas, cabbages, eggplants, and pawpaws which she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Filipina needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, garden hose, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, crowbar and garden fork. She is a new member of SPBD since 2010. 

Filipina will use the profits from her sales to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, garden hose, wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and a crow bar.

loans.name: Siomia

texts.en:
Siomia is a 31-year-old married woman with one child. She would like to extend her small business, lawn mowing service, in her community. In order to do this, Siomia needs a loan to buy a new lawn mower, wheelbarrow, garden trimmer, and oil. 

She hopes to use her profits to save for family needs and improve her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy a new lawn mower, wheelbarrow, garden trimmer, and oil.

loans.name: Ivona

texts.en:
Ivona is 27 years old and single with one child. She runs a small business, selling pancakes in her community. She has been doing this for three years. 

Ivona has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil, baking powder, eggs, and a large pot. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. 
With her earnings, Ivona will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil, baking powder, eggs, and a large pot.

loans.name: Meretauutu

texts.en:
Meretauutu is a 42-year-old married woman with five children. She runs a small business, selling snacks, finger foods, etc. in her community, and has been doing this for three years. 

Meretauutu has requested a loan to buy chicken, sausages, noodles, rice, onions, and foam plates. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Meretauutu will help her family in every need.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sausages, noodles, rice, onions, and foam plates.

loans.name: Adriana Ramona

texts.es:
Adriana es una señora muy trabajadora que con esfuerzo y sacrificio esta saliendo adelante, por medio de su negocio ayuda a su marido en la crianza de su hijo, y de esa forma la familia esta mejorando sus condiciones de vida. Comenta que su préstamo anterior de kiva le ha sido de mucha ayuda, ya que le permitió poder tener mayor cantidad de prendas, por lo que está muy agradecida.
hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de camisas, zapatos, pantalones, medias y otras prendas que le permitirá seguir con su emprendimiento luchando por mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
Adriana's a very hardworking woman who is getting ahead with effort and sacrifice.  With her business she helps her husband raise their son, and the family's living conditions are improving.  She said her previous Kiva loan has been a big help because she was able to get more clothing, for which she's very grateful.

Adriana's currently requesting a new loan to be able to buy shirts, shoes, pants, socks, and other clothing so she can continue with her business venture and keep on striving to improve her life

loans.use: to buy shirts, shoes, pants, socks, and other clothing

loans.name: Antolin

texts.es: Antolin vive en la ciudad de Huancarani al sur del Cusco y continua participando en el banco comunal "Mamacha Rosario" de la Asociación Arariwa. Su actividad es brindar el servicio de costura ósea tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo cierres, hilos y agujas.
texts.en: Antolin lives in Huancarani city in the southern Cusco region and he is still a member of the communal bank "Mamacha Rosario", part of the  Asociación Arariwa organisation. He offers tailoring services, and has a small workshop at home. This time around he wants a loan to buy more work materials such as fasteners, thread and needles.

loans.use: to buy more work materials such as fasteners, threads and needles.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria vive en la ciudad de Huancarani y su actividad economica principal es la venta de combustible y venta de artefactos como por ejemplo radios, televisores, planchas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Victoria requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería ósea gasolina y petróleo.
texts.en: Victoria lives in the city of Huancarani . Her main economic activity is selling fuel and selling appliances like radios, TV's, irons. etc. She has been involved  in this business for several years and things are going well thanks to her dedication at work. At this time Victoria needs a loan to purchase  merchandise, like gas and fuel oil.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and oil.

loans.name: Sam Group

texts.en:
This group is called Sam and is composed of four women. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Amima, age 42, is the president of the group. She is married and has a child. She has been a nurse for many years. She said that her income is not enough to cover what she needs.

On this occasion, she needs a loan of YER 50,000 from AMB to buy an oven for her house. She is grateful for the loan and commits to making her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy an oven for her house.

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Shg Group

texts.en:
The "Maa Thakurani SHG" (self help group) is made up of eleven members. All of them are from one of the small villages of Sonepur district of Odisha state, India. All the women met because they are from the same village and community and chose to get a loan in a mutually supportive group, and in that way be able to help themselves economically to invest in their different businesses. 

Himadri, who is the President of the group and has the responsibility of making the payments on time, has an economic activity involving cultivating and selling vegetables. In picture the lady standing with her hand raised is Himadri. She wakes up very early to pluck the vegetables from the plants so she can sell fresh vegetables in market to satisfy her customers. She wants the funding to invest in her business in purchasing a higher quality of seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

The other members of this group are engaged in different livelihood activities like fish-selling, grocery shop, food stall, etc. All the members are very happy and thankful to KIVA for this great support.

loans.use: to purchase a higher quality of seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Omm Shg Group

texts.en:
Anjali is the group leader of a 10-member group from a small village situated in the Sonepur district of Odisha, India. Her family is comprised of seven members: herself, her husband and five children. The member standing with her hand raised is Anjali.

At present, she has been running a general store with the help of her husband for the last twenty years. Anjali is a very active lady who wants some extra income with her own efforts.

At present, her family income is Rs 7,500 per month, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. To improve her living conditions and earn some extra income, she wants to take a loan. With the loan, she will purchase bath soaps, washing powder, bangles, vanity bags, money purses, deodorant spray, face creams and some household items. It will be the first loan for this "Omm SHG" group from People's Forum.

Anjali dreams of being a wholesaler of general household items in her locality.

The other nine members of the group want loans for the development of their existing businesses such as grocery shop, betel shop, goat rearing, etc.

loans.use: to purchase bath soaps, washing powder, bangles, vanity bags, money purses, deodorant spray, face creams and some other personal items.

loans.name: Dhanalaxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
The "Dhanalaxmi SHG," a newly formed group, is made up of women who want to bring change to their daily lives through the program. They all live in the same village and share values of solidarity and working together. They mainly run small businesses and do some crop cultivation.

Madhabi is the lady in the picture who is standing with her hand raised, the featured borrower of the group. She is 38 years old and is a married mother of a son. She sells seasonal fruits and has perfectly mastered this business from having been doing it for more than twelve years. She sells fresh fruits like oranges, apples, bananas, pineapples, guavas, etc.

With her new loan, she plans to buy fresh fruits in bulk to resell. With her profits, she plans to increase her savings so as to better establish her business.

Other members of this group are engaged in different businesses like milk selling, fish selling, vegetable selling, etc.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fruits in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.es:
Ella es Jeniffer y les quiere contar un poco sobre la vida de ella, ella vivia con los padres, ella era muy consentida y todo lo que  quería los padres se lo concebían, hasta que  llego a la adolescencia  la etapa mas difícil, se enamoro de un joven muy simpático sin saber que este iba a ser el causante de que esta familia se dañara, ella  siempre lo apoyaba a el en todo lo que el quería, pero ella de el no recibía lo mismo así que  ella tomo la decisión de dejarlo atrás habiendo perdido grado decimo por culpa de el. 

Ella conoció un joven que  la enamoro  y aunque era del campo ella lo apoyo, él empezó a trabajar en la ciudad e iba a visitarla a la casa, se fueron a vivir juntos y  ella quedo embarazada a los 17 años, a los padres les dio muy duro  y la echaron de la casa,  ella se fue con el joven que nunca la  ha dejado sola en nada, después de unos días la volvieron a recibir en la casa con el joven y pues  con el bebe que venía en el vientre  las relaciones en el hogar nuevamente mejoraron y esta joven en ese año solo se cuido y cuido del embarazo, cuando nació la alegría de ese hogar y todo estaba volviendo a la normalidad, ella empezó a estudiar  a termino  el bachillerato, se graduó y empezó a trabajar, pero estaba descuidando el bebe, así que decidió salirse de trabajar  y volver a  ser la mama cariñosa y pendiente del hijo, encontró trabajo en un jardín y se dio cuenta que esto era una de las cosas que la apasionaba, matriculó al hijo y podía estar pendiente de el.

Los papas la apoyaron y ella decidió estudiar atención integral a  la primera infancia pensando en fundar el propio jardín o una fundación para apoyar  los niños y niñas de escasos recursos temporalmente mientras termina los estudios y después  realizar los pensados.

El subsidio de kiva le seria de gran ayuda ya que con los gastos del niño pagar el valor normal de las cuotas es un poco complicado, si le dan el subsidio de kiva el valor de la cuota seria amas económico y podría solventar otros gastos.
texts.en:
Jeniffer would like to tell a little bit about her life. She was living with her parents and was very spoiled. Everything that she wanted, her parents gave her. But when she became an adolescent, which is that most difficult age, she fell in love with a very nice young guy without knowing that he would cause a lot of pain in her family. She always supported this guy in everything he wanted, but she never received the same in return, so she decided to break up with him, but not before she ended up failing to complete tenth grade because of him.

She met another young guy who fell in love with her, and although he was from the country, she supported him. He started to work in the city and he came to visit her at home. They left to live together and she became pregnant at age 17. Her parents took it very badly, and they threw her out of the house. She left with the young guy, who never had left her alone in anything. After a few days, her parents allowed her to come back home with the young guy. And with the baby that was coming, her relationship with her parents improved. During that year she looked after herself and the baby, and on November 20, 2012 the joy of that home was born and everything began to return to normal. She studied to complete her high school degree, graduated, and started working. But with work she wasn’t able to look after the baby, so she decided to stop working and return to being a caring and attentive mother to her son. She found work in a daycare, which she realized was something she was passionate about. She enrolled her son in the daycare so that she could look after him. 

Her parents supported her and she decided to study Comprehensive Early Childhood Care, thinking that she would start her own daycare or a foundation to support children with limited resources after she finished her studies.

This Kiva loan would be a great help, because it is difficult to pay the full tuition payments while she is also paying for the needs of her son. If she receives the Kiva loan, the amount of her tuition payments will be more affordable and she will be able to pay other expenses.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Rosaura Liuvixa

texts.es: Es una joven con iniciativa, soltera, tiene 18 años de edad. Desde hace dos años estableció su carnicería con apoyo económico de su mamá. Actualmente alquila un tramo de madera en el mercado municipal, pagando una mensualidad de C$5000. El negocio lo atiende de lunes a viernes, debido a que los sábados estudia su segundo año de la carrera de Derecho en la Universidad de Puerto Cabezas. Con el propósito de obtener mayores ingresos y que su negocio crezca, solicita su primer financiamiento para incrementar la mercadería en su tramo: carne de res, carne cerdo, pollo, carne molida y chicharrón. Su sueño es culminar su carrera y apoyar a su mamá.
texts.en:
Rosaura is an 18 year old youth with ambition. Two years ago she opened her butcher shop with the financial assistance of her mother. She rents a stall made out of wood in the municipal market. She pays 5,000 NIO each month for rent. She works at her business from Monday to Friday, as on Saturday she has classes in her second year of a Law degree at the University of Puerto Cabezas. 

With the goal of generating more revenues and to expand her business, she is requesting her first loan to increase the stock in her stall: beef, pork, chicken, ground meat and pork cracklings. Her dream is to finish her studies and support her mother.

loans.use: to increase her stock with beef, pork, chicken, ground meat and pork cracklings.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 42-year-old woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro plants and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Maria has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, bush-knives, a wheelbarrow, barbed wire and a backpack sprayer. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Maria hopes to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, bush-knives, a wheelbarrow, barbed wire and a backpack sprayer

loans.name: Toalima

texts.en:
Toalima is a 43-year-old married woman with three children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience in this business.

Toalima needs a loan to buy sugar, cordial, foam cups, Chinese lollies, and a cooler. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and help with her family matters. 

Toalima has been a member of SPBD since 2013

loans.use: to buy sugar, cordial, foam cups, Chinese lollies, and a cooler.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Esperanza; está en su ciclo número  5  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas ellas están recibiendo las capacitaciones para poder crecer e ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida, y también para poder tener un mejor manejo de sus préstamos. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cornelia, una mujer muy trabajadora, que todos los días empieza su jornada desde muy tempranas horas. Es una mujer muy sacrificada, y comenta que se dedica a la venta de comidas varias que ella misma hace y que gusta mucho a sus clientes. Es muy conocida por sus delicias que  gustan mucho. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser carnes, condimentos, hortalizas y demás.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
La Esperanza Group is in its fifth loan cycle in the women's bank program.  All the members are receiving training to be able to grow, improve their living conditions, and better manage their loans.

Cornelia's one of the members.  She's a very hardworking and self-sacrificing woman who starts her work day very early.  She said she sells a variety of dishes that she makes herself and that her customers like a lot.  She's well known for her tasty delicacies.

Cornelia's requesting this loan to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, and other ingredients to keep on making her dishes.

She's grateful for this opportunity, which is going to be a big help to her.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, and other ingredients

loans.name: Adriss Group

texts.en:
The Adriss group consists of four hardworking women from Sana`a, Yemen. They have requested a group loan, and will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment.

Susan is a very active woman from a poor family. Her husband is employed and gets a small salary that is not enough to cover all of the family needs. Susan's husband works hard and does his best to provide his family with food and clothing. Susan loves her children and tries her best to raise her children well, and to offer them a good life. 

She would like to assist her husband in buying home supplies. She decided to apply for a loan from AMB to buy a fridge to use in her house. She dreams to provide for her children's needs in order to provide them with the best life.

loans.use: to buy a fridge to use in her house.

loans.name: Al-Nasser Group

texts.en:
This group of four hardworking women is called Al-Nasser. The members live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan in the amount of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Rawya is a 41-year-old married woman living in a poor area in Sana'a. She exhibits good moral values and is concerned for the well-being of her family, which is now living in a partially finished house that needs essential construction work to be completed. 

She has therefore requested a loan from AMB, which she will use to buy construction materials, such as paint, cement, and wood in order to finish building her house. 

She states that she feels happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for the support that she is being provided, because this way, she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as paint, cement, and wood in order to finish building her house.

loans.name: Maa Sakti Shg Group

texts.en:
Pushpanjali, aged 40, is the leader of this "Maa Sakti SHG" group that hails from a small village of Sonepue district of Odisha state, India. She lives with her husband and has one son and one daughter. The member standing with her hand raised in the photo is Pushpanjali. 

Pushpanjali is running a grocery store in her locality keeping daily household items with the support of her husband. Pushpanjali, along with eight other members of her village, formed this group and wants to take out a loan for the first time from People's Forum for the development of their existing businesses. Pushpanjali will use her portion to purchase sugar, edible oil, flour, rice, biscuits, detergent powder, etc., in bulk.

Currently she is earning about Rs. 3,000 per month from her business, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. She hopes that after the investment in the shop she will be able to make 6,000 INR per month.

The other members have businesses such as a grocery shop, dry foods business, fancy store, and vegetable shop. All the members are very grateful to KIVA and its lenders across the globe for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, edible oil, flour, rice, biscuits, detergent powder, etc., in bulk.

loans.name: Hamoudi Group

texts.en: This group is called Hamoudi. It consists of four ladies who reside in the same area. They live in Hodiedah, Yemen. This group has requested financial aid from AMB to boost their business. The group's representative, Bahia, is 59-years-old and married with five children.  She  works to cover the different household expenses. To help meet the different needs of the family, she has been selling incense and perfumes for many years. This business enables her to support herself without much trouble. She gets her supplies from the city market. Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, she is asking for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB to buy incense, perfumes, etc. She hopes to expand her business to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy incense, perfumes, etc. for her business

loans.name: Gotitas De Chocolate Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GOTITAS DE CHOCOLATE” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Reina es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de repuestos de auto, tejido de mantas, peluquería, venta de detergentes, venta de batidos, artesano en joyas, costura de deportivos, macramé de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Reina es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de batidos (jugo tradicional); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al apoyar a su suegra, a quien apoyaba en su negocio, posterior a aprender las técnicas decide emprender un  espacio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de huevo y bicervecina por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Gotitas de Chocolate” (Little Drops of Chocolate) is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Reina serves as the secretary. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling auto parts, weaving blankets, operating a beauty salon, selling detergents, selling shakes, making handcrafted jewelry, manufacturing sportswear, and producing macramé blankets.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Reina. She says that she joined Pro Mujer eight years ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who is a member of the organization. Reina currently has a business of selling shakes (traditional beverages). She has become more knowledgeable about this business since she started it with the help of her mother-in-law, who also did the same type of work. Once she learned her techniques, Reina decided to acquire her own space and become independent.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying eggs and Bolivian beer in bulk. She will acquire these products from the distribution stores in the city of El Alto and use them for making the product she sells from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income for supporting her family. Reina is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Reina said that she enjoys the loans and the training seminars offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy eggs and Bolivian beer in bulk.

loans.name: Saleh Group

texts.en: Saleh Group is made up of four women who live in  in Hodiedah, Yemen. They requested a loan of 80,000 YER as financial support with the aim of expanding their businesses. Baria is 34-years-old. She lives with her family in Hodiedah. She has been operating an incense sales business for one year.  This business allows her to meet her needs without much difficulty. She obtains her supplies at a market in the city. She requested a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB to buy more incense and perfumes for resale. She plans to develop her business into a clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy more incense and perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Wendy Lorena

texts.es: Ella es Wendy Lorena, vive en un Bogotá, sobre todo en los barrios periféricos existen historias increíbles que demuestran el valor de nuestras gente y es el caso de Wendy Lorena, una mujer que ha querido superarse estudiando servicios farmacéuticos en campo alto, pero para ello tiene que hacer grandes sacrificios, trabajando a diario en un restaurante como auxiliar de cocina  atendiendo el hogar y estudiando en las noches con gran sacrificio, pues el dinero que gana no alcanza para todos los gastos y bien merece una ayuda para continuar los estudios, por tal razón solicita el descuento de kiva,  descuento mensual del 15%  para así salir adelante en lo que más le gusta la farmacia, gracias a los medios tubo el conocimiento de campo alto  y así mismo lo eligió por la presentación y servicios para un buen futuro, no solo para ella sino también para los integrantes
texts.en:
This is Wendy Lorena, who lives in Bogotá.  There are incredible stories that demonstrate the courage of the Colombian people, especially in the peripheral neighborhoods, and this is the case with Wendy Lorena. 

She is a woman who has wanted to excel; studying Pharmaceutical Services at CampoAlto. But she has to make big sacrifices for this—working every day in a restaurant as a kitchen assistant, taking care of her home, and studying at night—as her earnings are not enough to cover all the expenses.

She is very worthy of receiving help in order to continue her studies, so she is seeking the monthly Kiva discount, which is 15%, in order to move forward with what she likes most: Pharmacy. 

Thanks to the media, she had knowledge of CampoAlto. She also chose it for its course offerings and services, which will provide a better future, not only for her, but for all its members.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Kuña Kyre’Y Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña  Kyre’y está en su ciclo número 10° Del programa de comité de mujeres, lleva ese nombre que significa mujeres muy animosas, ya que eso son, mujeres que están luchando por salir adelante y poder mejorar, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que por medio de los 50 indicadores ellas podrán conocer en qué situación se encuentran y en que deben mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Aurea, quien además de ser miembro del grupo es la presidenta, y con mucho esfuerzo lleva adelante su cargo. Ella se dedica a las ventas, tiene un copetín surtido con todo tipo de cosas, como ser comestibles, bebidas, golosinas y demás. Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella sus productos. Pide este préstamo para poder surtirse y tener una mejor variedad de bebidas y golosinas para poder seguir con sus ventas, mejorando de esa forma sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Kuña  Kyre’y Group is in its tenth loan cycle with the women's bank program.  The group's name means "very brave women," because that's what they are, women who are striving to get ahead and be able to improve.  They're doing the "Poverty Stoplight" survey, in which 50 indicators will help them understand the situation they're in and where they can improve.

One of the members is Aurea, who's also the president of the group, a responsibility she carries out with great effort.  Aurea makes a living in sales.  She has a small snack bar stocked with all kinds of things, including food, beverages, and snacks.  She said she has very good customers who always shop at her store.

Aurea's requesting this loan to be able to stock up and have a better selection of beverages and snacks so she can continue with her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy beverages and snacks

loans.name: Ascencia

texts.es: Ascencia se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria los días domingos en la plaza principal de la ciudad de Huancarani. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Ascencia requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo verduras, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, carne y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Ascencia sells food on Sundays as a street vendor in the main plaza in the city of Huancarani. She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Ascencia is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy more supplies such as vegetables, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, meat, and other items.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, meat, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar-powered generator for home electricity.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha was born in 1968. She is married and a mother of six children. Her husband works in a private company in Jordan.

Ten years ago, Aisha opened a small food market in a room in her house to financially support her husband. 

Now, she needs to buy more new products and add variety to what she sells, such as accessories, in order to raise her sales and profit. But, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to add more food products and accessories to her store.

loans.name: Al-Khir Group

texts.en: Al-Khir is a three-member group from Hodeida, Yemen. All the members are women. Amima is 34-years-old. She works very hard and does her best to provide her family with food and clothes.  She started going to door-to-door selling perfumes, incense and clothes. She intends to expand her business.  Therefore, she asked for a loan of 20,000 YER to buy clothes, perfumes and incense to resell. She hopes that she earns profits from buying a lot of products and selling them to new clients in different quarters and places in her city.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, incense and clothes to help expand her business.

loans.name: Ameeneh

texts.en: Ameeneh is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Ameeneh was born in 1985. She is married and a mother of 3 children. Her husband is in the military. Ameeneh decided to help her husband financially in order to cover her children's needs by running her business of selling cosmetics for the last year. She started her project selling a small amount of them and now she needs to expand it by buying a larger quantity of cosmetic products to raise her sales and income. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so and thus she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic products for her business

loans.name: Watfa

texts.en: Watfa was born in 1982. She is a married woman living in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla with her husband, son and daughter. Her husband serves in the military. Watfa noticed the financial crisis her husband is facing. So, she decided to help him cover their children's needs by selling blankets to her neighbors and friends for the past year. She is planning now to expand her project and her sales by buying a larger quantity of blankets, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more blankets to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes, perfume and incense.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy glass shelves and repair equipment

loans.name: Kathy Aracelly

texts.es: Es una mujer amable, tiene 35 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos, un adolescente de 14 años que se encuentra estudiando cuarto año de secundaria y un pequeño de 2 años. Con el objetivo que su familia este segura en la vivienda, solicita su tercer financiamiento para construir el muro perimetral de su vivienda, comprar 2 rollos de maya, 16 unidades de postes de madera, grapas y el costo de mano de obra. Con los dos créditos anteriores y capital propio le permitieron construir su vivienda de concreto. Su esposo no dispone de un empleo formal, trabaja atendiendo el negocio de comideria de su mamá. Su sueño es realizar la división de los cuartos para sus hijos, construir tanque séptico y construir el muro perimetral de concreto.
texts.en: Kathy is a friendly woman. She is 35 years old, married, and has two children. One is 14 years old and in the fourth year of secondary school. The other is 2 years old. With the goal of keeping her family safe in their home, Kathy is requesting her third loan to build a perimeter wall for her home. She will use the loan to buy 2 rolls of mesh, 16 units of wood posts, staples, and the cost of labor. With her two previous loans and her own money, she was able to build a concrete home. He husband does not have formal employment. He works taking care of his mother's eatery. Her dream is to divide rooms for her children, to build a septic tank, and to build a concrete perimeter wall.

loans.use: to build a perimeter wall for her home, to buy 2 rolls of mesh, 16 units of wood posts, staples, and the cost of labor.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en: Sahar was born in 1976. She is a married mother of four who lives in a sector in Jordan called Salt. Her husband is a retired man. Sahar has been concentrating on covering her children's needs and providing them with the best education. She noticed the financial crisis her husband is facing. So, she decided to run a business selling clothes and blankets for the past three years and found it profitable. Now Sahar is out of products. So, she needs to buy more clothes and blankets to sell. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and blankets for her business

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa is 20 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Rsaifeh with his mother. His father is deceased. Mustafa is the only one who could support his mother after his father's death. He is now studying for a diploma majoring in Hotel Management. He is in his first year, which is the beginning of his journey. He is planning to work in his study field after graduation in order to help his mother financially. Now he is seeking a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Qusai

texts.en:
Qusai is 22 years old. He works in the drilling works. He lives in a village in Tulkarem city.

Qusai applied for this loan in order to complete building his house. He has a shortage of money to pave the walls and build the ceiling. This will be a step forward because he is thinking to get married when the house gets ready. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to complete building his house. He has a shortage of money to pave the walls and build the ceiling; this will be a step forward.

loans.name: Mapit Sartasiñani Cullacanaca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAPIT SARTASIÑANI CULLACANACAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rufina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa deportivas, venta de ropa de bebe, venta de coca, servicio de construcción, venta de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rufina es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de bebe; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de una vecina que tiene, la que le enseñó la forma de venta de este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa de bebe por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de la frontera Bolivia - Perú y posteriormente lo comercializará en la ciudad de Cobija. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “MAPIT SARTASIÑANI CULLACANACAS” will start its first cycle of Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch regional office. It is made up of eight members and is run by a board. Ms. Rufina is the President. The communal bank members' businesses vary. Some of them include: selling athletic clothing, selling baby clothing, construction services, and selling cheese.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small businesses where Rufina is a member. It has been two years since she joined Pro Mujer. She was invited by a friend who was a member of the institution. Currently Rufina has a business selling baby clothing. She learned the business from a neighbor who taught her the best way to sell this product. 
 
The loan Rufina will take out now is to buy baby clothing wholesale. She will buy the clothing in the markets on the Bolivia - Perú border and later sell it in the city of Cobija. This work allows her to make the income she needs to care for her family since she is single and has three children.  

When asked why she likes Pro Mujer, Rufina responded that she likes the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy baby clothing wholesale.

loans.name: 10 Estrellas Del Norte Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “10 ESTRELLAS DEL NORTE” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: hilado de lana, elaboración de cotillones, tienda de barrio, elaboración de empanadas y masitas, panadería, hilado de lana de vicuña, tejido de prendas de alpaca.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de hilado de lana de vicuña; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al observar el trabajo de su hermana, que también realiza los mismos productos, ya conocida la técnica del hilado decide establecer su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de vicuña por mayor) que adquirirá de las fábricas de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, capacitación y crédito que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "10 Estrellas del Norte" is applying for its first loan from Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima headquarters.  It is made up of 8 members and is run by a board of directors with Lidia as the president.  The businesses of the members are varied and include spinning wool, making party favors, a convenience store, making empanadas and pastries, a bakery, spinning vicuña wool (a llama-like animal), and knitting clothes from alpaca wool.

The loan that they are asking for will benefit small businesses including that of Lidia.  She says that she has been involved with Pro Mujer for 7 years following the invitation of a Pro Mujer worker who visited her at her home.  Currently, she has a business spinning vicuña wool.  She learned this trade by observing her sister work.  After learning how to do it herself, she decided to start her own business.  

The loan that she is asking for will be used to increase her working capital by buying vicuña wool wholesale.  She will buy the wool from La Paz suppliers and then sell it according to the demand of her customers.  By working in this way, she can make income to support her family.  She is married by common law and has one son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health benefits, the training, and the loans that the group offers.

loans.use: buy vicuña wool wholesale.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Miguel está en su ciclo número 2do. Del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que con mucho esfuerzo está aprendiendo y empezando a trabajar todas juntas. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 6 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que deben seguir esforzándose para mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Alicia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  do, es decir con ingresos medios, donde ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa irá mejorando su situación de pobreza, sumado esto a su trabajo en la venta de prendas que hace.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, ya que así podrá seguir creciendo y trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The San Miguel group is on its second Kiva loan as a part of the Fundación Paraguaya Women Entrepreneurs program.  It is a new group and with great effort they are learning and starting to work together.  They are participants in the poverty elimination survey and 6 of the group members are below the poverty line, indicating that they have to continually struggle to improve their lives.

Alicia is a member of this group and during the last survey was found to be in the 2nd poverty level, meaning a medium level of income.  Through her efforts, hard work, and her enthusiastic behavior as a successful woman, she will continue to improve her income level.  She does this through her work selling clothing.

She will use this loan to buy various types of clothing to sell, since in this way she will be able to continue to grow and work as she always has.

loans.use: buy various types of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 44-years-old.  He works as a laborer in a drilling workshop.  He lives with his wife and four children in Jenin, a Palestinian city in the northern West Bank. It serves as the administrative center of the Jenin Governorate and is a major agricultural center for the surrounding towns. In 2007 the city had a population of 39,004.  He has two children at the public primary school.

Mohammad wants to make it better so he is asking Ryada for this loan to paint and repair the bathroom, which will help him to take step forward because he has a shortage of money. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to paint and repair the bathroom

loans.name: Ameera

texts.en: Ameera was born in 1969. She is married and a mother of four living in a sector in Jordan called Marka. Her husband is a contractor. Ameera has been making handmade occasion gifts for five years. She started her work as a hobby. Then she decided to use it as a source of income in order to cover her children's needs and found it profitable. Now she is seeking a loan to buy more raw materials that she needs to do more occasion gifts and to add new types of crafts in order to raise her productivity and sales.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials to make more gifts

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
El es Mario Alberto, ingresó al programa de Auxiliar De Enfermería en la escuela de enfermería  CAMPO ALTO. Actualmente ingresa al cuarto semestre y está haciendo las prácticas en el hospital san Carlos. Ha sido muy responsable con todos los compromisos adquiridos, le fue muy bien en la parte teórica. Y está contento con lo que está estudiando.
El grupo familiar se compone de 5 hermanos, en el cual ocupa el tercer lugar. Siempre ha sido apoyado por la madre, quien es cabeza de hogar, por este motivo solicita ser beneficiado por el programa KIVA, para poder finalizar el cuarto semestre de la carrera.
